MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Breads In Jars: Brownies
 Categories: Holiday
      Yield: 3 servings
 
MMMMM--------------------SUPPLIES NEEDED-----------------------------
      3    Jars Ball (#14400-81400)
           (12 oz)
      8    New lids - don't use old
           Ones
      8    Rings okay to use old ones

MMMMM-------------------------BATTER----------------------------------
      1 c  Unbleached flour
      1 c  Granulated sugar
    1/2 ts Baking soda
    1/4 ts Cinnamon
    1/3 c  Margarine -- at room
           Temperature
    1/4 c  Water
      3 tb Cocoa powder -- sifted
    1/4 c  Buttermilk* -- at room
           Temperature
      1    Egg white -- whipped
    1/2 ts Vanilla
 
  Preheat oven at 325.  Place a baking sheet onto middle rack and
  remove top rack from oven.  Before starting batter, wash jars, lids,
  and rings in hot soapy water and let drain, dry, and cool to room
  temperature.  Generously prepare inside of jars with margarine  To
  prepare batter, combine flour, sugar, baking soda, and cinnamon in a
  mixing bowl.  In another mixing bowl, combine margarine, water, cocoa
  powder, buttermilk, egg white, and vanilla. Divide batter among 3
  jars (should be slightly less than half full). Carefully wipe rims
  clean, then place jars on baking sheet (or they'll tip over) in the
  center of oven.  Bake 40 minutes.  Keep lids in hot water until
  they're used.  When cakes are done, remove jars which are HOT from
  oven one at a time.  If rims need cleaning, use moistened paper
  towel. Carefully put lids and rings in place, then screw tops on
  tightly shut. Place jars on a wire rack; they will seal as they cool.
  
  Once jars are cool, decorate with round pieces of cloth and then glue
  on flowers, ribbons, etc. on lid, ring and side of jar.  Unscrew the
  ring (the lid should be sealed by now) and place a few cotton balls
  on top of the lid (makes it poofy on top), then a piece of cloth
  (about 3" larger than the lid) on top and screw the ring back on.
  Decorate as desired (example pinking shears).
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Buttermilk Spice Cupcakes
 Categories: Cake/cookie, Holiday
      Yield: 24 servings
 
MMMMM-------------------------BATTER----------------------------------
      2 c  Unbleached flour
    3/4 ts Cinnamon
    1/2 ts Allspice
    3/4 ts Baking powder
    3/4 ts Baking soda
    1/2 ts Nutmeg
    1/4 ts Cloves
    1/4 ts Salt
    3/4 c  Margarine -- softened
  1 1/2 c  Brown sugar -- packed
      3    Egg whites -- whipped
    3/4 c  Buttermilk* -- at room
           Temperature

MMMMM------------------------FROSTING---------------------------------
    1/4 c  Margarine -- melted
      2 c  Powdered sugar -- sifted
      7 ts Cream
      1 tb Water -- hot
      2 ts Vanilla
    1/8 ts Salt
 
  Preheat oven at 325.  Prepare 24 muffin pans with cooking spray and
  flour. To prepare batter, combine flour, baking powder, baking soda,
  cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and salt in a mixing bowl.  In another
  mixing bowl, combine margarine,  brown sugar, egg whites, and
  buttermilk.  Mix dry ingredients with wet ingredients just until
  moistened.  Spoon into prepared pans, filling each halfway full.
  Bake for 25 minutes. Meanwhile, to prepare frosting, combine
  margarine, powdered sugar, cream, water, vanilla, and salt in a small
  mixing bowl.  Frost each cupcake and garnish as desired.
  
  Recipe By     : Family Circle's Christmas Helps
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Candy Apples
 Categories: Candies
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      8    Apples
      8    Popsicle sticks
      3 c  Granulated sugar
      1 c  Water
    1/2 c  Corn syrup
    1/4 c  Red hot candies
    1/2 ts Red food coloring
 
  Insert a popsicle stick part way through stem end of apples.  Prepare
  a baking sheet with cooking spray and set aside.  In a saucepan over
  medium heat, combine sugar, water, corn syrup, candies, and food
  coloring.  Boil without stirring until candy thermometer reaches 290,
  about 20 minutes. With brush dipped in water, brush sugar from sides
  of pan.  Remove mixture from heat, dip pot bottom briefly in cold
  water to arrest cooking.  Tip saucepan, swirl each apple in mixture
  to coat.  Place apples on prepared baking sheet to cool.  Work
  quickly before mixture hardens.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Carrot
 Categories: Breads
      Yield: 12 servings
 
      2 c  Unbleached flour
      1 c  Brown sugar -- packed
      2 ts Baking soda
      2 ts Baking powder
      1 ts Cinnamon
    1/2 ts Ginger
    1/2 ts Allspice
      1 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
      3    Egg whites -- whipped
      1 c  Carrots -- shredded
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare pan(s) with cooking spray and flour.
  In a mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder,
  cinnamon, ginger, and allspice.  In another mixing bowl, combine
  applesauce, egg white, and carrots.  Mix dry ingredients with wet
  ingredients just until moistened.  Pour batter into prepared pan(s).
  Bake for 30 minutes depending on pan size.
  
  Recipe By     : Ziploc

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Carrot Ginger
 Categories: Breads
      Yield: 12 servings
 
      2 c  Unbleached flour
      1 tb Baking powder
      1 ts Baking soda
    1/4 ts Salt
    1/2 ts Nutmeg
    1/2 ts Cinnamon
      2 ts Ginger
    1/2 c  Buttermilk*
    1/4 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
    1/4 c  Maple syrup
    1/4 c  Honey
      3    Egg whites -- whipped
      2 c  Carrots -- grated
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare pan(s) with cooking spray and flour.
  In a mixing bowl, combine flour, baking powder, baking soda,
  cinnamon, and ginger.  In another mixing bowl, combine buttermilk,
  applesauce, honey, egg whites, and carrots.  Mix dry ingredients with
  wet ingredients just until moistened.  Pour batter into prepared
  pan(s).  Bake for 30 minutes depending on pan size.
  
  Recipe By     : The California Culinary Academy

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Carrot Pineapple Fruitcakes
 Categories: Holiday, Cake/cookie, Fruit
      Yield: 24 servings
 
      3 c  Unbleached flour
      1 tb Baking powder
      2 ts Cinnamon
      1 ts Baking soda
    1/2 ts Nutmeg
    1/2 ts Cloves
    1/2 ts Salt
      1 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
    3/4 c  Granulated sugar
    3/4 c  Brown sugar -- packed
      4    Egg whites -- whipped
      1 ts Vanilla
      2 c  Carrots -- grated
      1    20 oz can pineapple
           -- crushed/drained
           Powdered sugar icing
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare 2 loaf pans with cooking spray and
  flour. In a mixing bowl combine flour, baking powder, cinnamon,
  baking soda, nutmeg, cloves, and salt.  In another mixing bowl,
  combine applesauce, sugars, egg whites, vanilla, carrots, and
  pineapple.  Mix dry ingredients with wet ingredients just until
  moistened.  Divide batter equally between prepared pans.  Bake for 55
  minutes.  Brush with powdered sugar icing and decorate as desired.
  
  Recipe By     : Family Circle's Christmas Helps

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Carrot, Raisin, Nut, Coconut, And Apple
 Categories: Breads
      Yield: 16 servings
 
      2 c  Unbleached flour
  1 1/4 c  Granulated sugar
      1 ts Baking powder
      1 ts Baking soda
      2 ts Cinnamon
    1/4 ts Salt
      2 c  Carrots -- shredded
    1/2 c  Raisins
    1/2 c  Nuts -- chopped
    1/2 c  Coconut -- shredded
      1 c  Apples -- shredded
      3    Egg whites -- whipped
      1 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
      2 ts Vanilla
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare pan(s) with cooking spray and flour.
  In a mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda,
  cinnamon, and  salt.  In another mixing bowl, combine carrots,
  raisins, nuts, coconut, apples, egg whites, applesauce, and vanilla.
  Mix dry ingredients with wet ingredients just until moistened.  Pour
  batter into prepared pan(s).  Bake for 1 hour depending on pan size.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cheddar Cheese Biscuits
 Categories: Breads
      Yield: 10 servings
 
      1 c  Unbleached flour
      2 ts Baking powder
  1 1/2 ts Granulated sugar
    1/4 ts Salt
      3 tb Olive oil
    1/3 c  Cheddar cheese -- grated
    1/3 c  Skim milk -- at room
           Temperature
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  In a mixing bowl, combine flour, baking powder,
  sugar, and salt.  In another mixing bowl, combine oil, cheese, and
  milk, stirring until mixture comes together to form a soft dough.
  Using a lightly floured rolling pin, roll out dough until 1/2" thick.
  Using a cutter of choice, cut out shapes, gently reroll the scraps,
  to form 10 biscuits.  Place biscuits on unprepared baking sheet,
  spacing 2" apart. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes, or until biscuits are
  pale golden brown and well risen.
  
  Recipe By     : Cheap Eats

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cherry Crumb Coffee Cake
 Categories: Cake/cookie
      Yield: 8 servings
 
MMMMM-------------------------BATTER----------------------------------
    1/4 c  Margarine -- softened
      2    Egg whites --whipped
      1 c  Fat-free sour cream
    1/4 c  Skim milk -- at room
           Temperature
    1/2 ts Vanilla
    1/4 ts Almond extract
      2 c  Unbleached flour
      1 c  Granulated sugar
  1 1/2 ts Baking powder
    1/2 ts Baking soda
    1/4 ts Salt
      1 cn Cherry pie filling -- (21
           Oz)

MMMMM------------------------TOPPING---------------------------------
    1/2 c  Unbleached flour
    1/4 c  Brown sugar -- packed
      2 ts Cinnamon
      3 ts Margarine -- cold
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a cake pan with cooking spray and
  flour.  To prepare batter, combine margarine, egg whites, sour cream,
  milk, vanilla, and almond extract in a mixing bowl.  In another
  mixing bowl, combine flour, granulated sugar, baking powder, baking
  soda, and salt.  Spread half of the batter in prepared pan.  Spread
  cherry pie filling over batter. Cover with remaining batter.  To
  prepare topping, combine 1/2 cup flour, brown sugar, cinnamon, and
  margarine. Cut in margarine, if needed. Sprinkle topping over batter.
  Bake for 45 minutes.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Chocolate Cherry Cobbler
 Categories: Desserts, Fruit, Pie/tart
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      2 tb Brown sugar -- packed
      2 tb Cornstarch
      1 cn 16 oz red tart cherries
           - pitted/undrained
    1/4 ts Almond extract
      6 dr Red food coloring
      2 tb Margarine
    1/2 c  Unbleached flour
      1 tb Cocoa powder
      1 ts Cocoa powder
      1 tb Brown sugar -- packed
    3/4 ts Baking powder
    1/8 ts Salt
    1/3 c  Skim milk -- at room
           Temperature
      1 ts Vanilla
 
  Preheat oven at 375.  Prepare a 1 quart baking dish lightly with
  cooking spray.  Mix 2 tablespoons brown sugar and cornstarch in 2
  quart saucepan. Stir cherries.  Cook over medium heat, 4 to 5
  minutes, stirring occasionally, until slightly thickened.  Stir in
  almond extract and food color. Pour into baking dish.  Cut margarine
  into flour, cocoa, brown sugar, baking powder, and salt until mixture
  resembles fine crumbs.  Stir in milk and vanilla.  Drop dough by 6
  spoonfuls onto hot cherry mixture. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until
  topping is no longer doughy.
  
  Recipe By     : Betty Crocker's New Choices Cookbook
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Chocolate Cookies
 Categories: Low cal/fat, Cake/cookie
      Yield: 30 servings
 
  1 1/2 c  Unbleached flour
    1/2 c  Granulated sugar
    1/2 c  Cocoa powder -- sifted
    1/4 ts Baking powder
    1/4 ts Baking soda
    1/4 ts Salt
    1/2 c  Corn syrup
      3    Egg whites -- beaten
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare baking sheets with cooking spray.  In a
  mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda,
  and salt.  In another mixing bowl, combine corn syrup and egg whites.
  Mix dry ingredients with wet ingredients (dough will be thick and
  sticky) just until combined.  Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto
  prepared baking sheet. Bake for 7 to 9 minutes or until set.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Chocolate Doubles Muffins
 Categories: Breads, Muffins, Chocolate
      Yield: 12 servings
 
  1 1/2 c  Unbleached flour
    1/2 c  Granulated sugar
    1/4 c  Cocoa powder -- sifted
      1 ts Baking soda
    1/4 ts Salt -- at room temperature
    1/2 c  Water
    1/2 c  Applesauce -- whipped
      1 tb Vinegar
      1 ts Vanilla
    1/2 c  Chocolate chips
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare 12 muffin tins with cooking spray and
  flour. In a mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda and
  salt.  In another mixing bowl, combine water, applesauce, vinegar,
  vanilla, and chocolate chips.  Stir just until moistened.  Use an ice
  cream scoop to fill muffin tins two thirds full.  Bake for 20 to 25
  minutes or until brown.
  
  Recipe By     : Muffin Magic
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Chocolate Easter Eggs
 Categories: Chocolate
      Yield: 15 servings
 
MMMMM-------------------CHOCOLATE COATING----------------------------
      1 c  Semisweet chocolate disks --
           Melted
      1    7 oz Hershey bar -- melted

MMMMM-------------------PEANUT BUTTER EGGS----------------------------
  4 1/2 c  Powdered sugar -- sifted
      1 lb Peanut butter
  1 1/2    Sticks butter

MMMMM-------------------BUTTER CREAM EGGS----------------------------
      4 oz Cream cheese -- softened
    1/2 c  Butter
  1 1/2 ts Vanilla
      5 c  Powdered sugar --sifted
 
  Chocolate Coating - In a double boiler, melt disks and Hershey bar.
  Keep over heat as long as needed. Peanut Butter Eggs - In a small
  mixing bowl, combine 4 1/2 cups sugar, peanut butter, and butter
  until thoroughly combined.  Then, form into small eggs. Refrigerate a
  short time, about 1/2 hour on wax paper covered baking sheet. Dip in
  hot chocolate coating, using a fork. Butter Cream Eggs - In a small
  mixing bowl, combine cream cheese, butter, vanilla, and 5 cups sugar
  until thoroughly combined. Then, refrigerate a short time on wax
  paper covered baking sheet. Dip into hot chocolate coating, using a
  fork.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Chocolate Mini Cakes
 Categories: Cake/cookie
      Yield: 8 servings
 
  1 1/2 c  Unbleached flour
      1 c  Granulated sugar
      2 ts Baking powder
    1/2 ts Salt
    1/2 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
    3/4 c  Skim milk -- at room
           Temperature
      1 ts Vanilla
      4 ts Egg whites -- whipped
      1    Bars unsweetened chocolate
           (2 oz) melted
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare 8 small loaf pans with cooking spray and
  flour.  In a mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and
  salt. In another mixing bowl, combine milk, vanilla, egg whites, and
  chocolate. Pour into pans, filling each 1/2 full.  Bake for 20 to 25
  minutes.  Cool 10 minutes; remove from pans.
  
  Recipe By     : Betty Crocker's Cake Decorating

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Chocolate Mint
 Categories: Holiday, Chocolate
      Yield: 12 servings
 
MMMMM-------------------------BATTER----------------------------------
      2 c  Unbleached flour
  1 1/2 c  Granulated sugar
      3 ts Baking powder
      1 ts Salt
    3/4 c  Water -- cold
    1/2 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
    1/2 ts Peppermint extract
      7    Egg whites -- whipped
           Mint candies

MMMMM------------------------FROSTING---------------------------------
      3 c  Whipping cream -- chilled
  1 1/2 c  Powdered sugar -- sifted
    3/4 c  Cocoa powder -- sifted
  1 1/2 ts Peppermint extract
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare pan(s) with cooking spray and flour.
  In a mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking powder
  and salt. In another mixing bowl, combine water, applesauce,
  peppermint extract, egg whites.  Divide batter between prepared
  pan(s).  Bake until top springs back when touched lightly, about 50
  to 55 minutes depending on pan size.
  
  Recipe By     : Betty Crocker's Cake Decorating

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Chocolate Mint Cheesecake Cups
 Categories: Desserts
      Yield: 24 servings
 
    3/4 c  Fat-free cream cheese --
           Softened
    1/2 c  Fat-free cottage cheese
      3 tb Creme de menthe
      1    Egg white -- whipped
    1/2 ts Vanilla
      2 tb Unbleached flour
    1/2 c  Granulated sugar
      3 tb Cocoa powder -- sifted
    1/4 ts Salt
           Andes Candies
 
  Preheat oven at 300.  Prepare 24 mini muffin pans with cooking spray
  and flour.  In a mixing bowl, combine cream cheese, cottage cheese,
  cream de menthe egg white, and vanilla.  In another mixing bowl,
  combine flour, sugar, cocoa powder, and salt.  Mix wet ingredients
  with dry ingredients just until moistened.  Spoon batter into
  prepared pans.  Bake for 18 minutes.  Pull a vegetable peeler down
  the sides of the candies, making tiny shavings.  Top cheesecakes with
  shavings.
  
  Recipe By     : Cooking Light Guilt Free Desserts
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Chocolate Peanut Butter Crunch Cake
 Categories: Cake/cookie
      Yield: 8 servings
 
MMMMM-----------------CHOCO/PEANUT BUTTER SWIRL----------------------
      1 c  Semi sweet chocolate chips
           Melted
    1/4 c  Peanut butter

MMMMM--------------------------CRUMBS---------------------------------
  1 1/2 c  Unbleached flour
      1 c  Brown sugar -- packed
      1    Stick margarine -- softened
    1/2 c  Peanut butter

MMMMM---------------------------CAKE----------------------------------
      2    Egg whites -- whipped
    1/2 c  Skim milk -- at room
           Temperature
      1 ts Vanilla
    1/2 ts Baking powder
    1/2 ts Baking soda
 
  Preheat oven to 350.  Prepare a 8" square baking pan with cooking
  spray and flour.  To prepare chocolate peanut butter swirl, melt the
  chocolate chips and peanut butter in a small saucepan over low heat,
  stirring often until smooth.  Remove from the heat; let cool while
  preparing the crumbs and batter.  To prepare crumbs, combine the
  flour, brown sugar, margarine, and peanut butter in a mixing bowl
  until the mixture forms crumbs.  Remove 3/4 cup (tightly packed) of
  the mixture and set aside.  To prepare cake, add egg whites, milk,
  vanilla, baking powder, and baking soda to the remaining crumbs in
  the mixing bowl until thoroughly moistened.  Spread half of the
  batter in the prepared pan; gently streak half of the chocolate
  peanut butter mixture over the top.  Repeat with the remaining batter
  and chocolate peanut butter mixture.  Scatter the reserved crumbs
  over the top, pressing them in gently so they adhere to the batter.
  Bake for about 50 minutes or until crumbs and top of the cake are
  firm.  Cover the pan loosely with aluminum foil, if the cake is
  getting too dark during baking, loosely cover it with a piece of
  aluminum foil.  Let the cake cool in the pan on a wire rack for 15
  minutes.  Loosen around the sides of the pan, then carefully invert
  onto the rack and turn right-side-up.  Cool completely before serving.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cinnamon Candy Muffin
 Categories: Holiday, Muffins, Candies
      Yield: 12 servings
 
  1 3/4 c  Flour
    1/2 c  Granulated sugar
      2 ts Baking powder
      1 ts Cinnamon
    1/4 ts Salt
    1/2 ts Cloves
    1/4 ts White pepper
      1 ts Orange peel
      1    Egg white -- whipped
      1 c  Skim milk -- at room
           Temperature
    1/3 c  Margarine -- at room
           Temperature

MMMMM----------------------GLAZE-------------------------------------
    1/2 c  Powdered sugar -- sifted
      1 tb Lemon juice
     60    Cinnamon candies
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare 12 muffin pans with cooking spray and
  flour. In  mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder,
  cinnamon, salt, cloves, and pepper.  In another mixing bowl, combine
  orange peel, egg white, milk, and margarine.  Mix wet ingredients
  with dry ingredients just until moistened.  Use an ice cream scoop to
  fill muffin tins 2/3 full.  To prepare glaze, combine powdered sugar
  and lemon juice.  Bake 20 minutes. While still warm, spread glaze on
  muffins.  Press 5 candies into glaze.
  
  Recipe By     : Muffin Magic

      Title: Cinnamon Yogurt Muffins
 Categories: Breads, Muffins
      Yield: 8 servings
 
  1 1/2 c  Unbleached flour
    1/4 c  Granulated sugar
  1 1/2 ts Baking powder
    3/4 ts Baking soda
      2 ts Cinnamon
    1/4 ts Nutmeg
    1/4 ts Salt
      1    Egg white -- whipped
    1/2 c  Fat-free plain yogurt
      3 tb Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
  1 1/2 ts Vanilla
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare 8 muffin tins with cooking spray and
  flour. In a mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking
  soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.  In another mixing bowl, combine
  remaining ingredients.  Mix dry ingredients with wet ingredients just
  until moistened Use an ice cream scoop to fill muffin tins two thirds
  full. Bake 12 minutes, or until lightly browned.

      Title: Cocoa Spice Cake
 Categories: Low cal/fat, Cake/cookie
      Yield: 8 servings
 
    1/4 c  Margarine -- melted
    3/4 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
      1    Egg white -- whipped
    1/4 c  Cocoa powder -- sifted
  1 1/4 c  Unbleached flour
      1 c  Granulated sugar
    3/4 c  Baking soda
    1/2 ts Cinnamon
    1/4 ts Salt
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a 9" square pan with cooking spray and
  flour. In a mixing bowl, combine, margarine, applesauce, and egg
  white. In another mixing bowl, combine cocoa powder, flour, sugar,
  baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.  Mix wet ingredients with dry
  ingredients just until moistened. Pour batter into prepared pan.
  Bake for 35 minutes.

      Title: Cranberry (Any Size)
 Categories: Breads, Fruit
      Yield: 12 servings
 
      2 c  Unbleached flour
      1 c  Granulated sugar
  1 1/2 ts Baking powder
    1/2 ts Baking soda
      1 ts Salt
    3/4 c  Orange juice
      1 tb Orange peel -- grated
      2 tb Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
      1    Egg white -- whipped
      1 c  Cranberries -- chopped
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare pan(s) with cooking spray and flour.
  In a mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda,
  and salt. In another mixing bowl, combine orange juice, orange peel,
  applesauce, egg white, and cranberries.  Mix wet ingredients to dry
  ingredients just until moistened.  Pour mixture into prepared pan(s).
  Bake for 40 to 50 minutes depending on pan size.

      Title: Cranberry Apple (Any Size)
 Categories: Breads, Fruit
      Yield: 12 servings
 
      2 c  Apples -- peeled/shredded
      1 c  Cranberries -- chopped
      1 c  Carrots -- shredded
      2    Egg whites -- whipped
    1/2 c  Applesauce
  2 1/2 c  Unbleached flour
  1 1/3 c  Granulated sugar
      1 tb Baking powder
      2 ts Baking soda
    1/2 ts Salt
      2 ts Cinnamon
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare pan(s) with cooking spray and flour.
  In a mixing bowl, combine apples, cranberries carrots, egg whites, and
  applesauce.  In another mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking
  powder, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon.  Fill prepared pan(s) 2/3
  full.  Bake for 20 to 25 minutes depending on pan size.
  
  Recipe By     : Jo Ann Merrill

      Title: Cranberry Apple Bread
 Categories: Breads, Fruit
      Yield: 16 servings
 
  1 1/2 c  Unbleached flour
    3/4 c  Brown sugar -- packed
  1 1/2 ts Baking powder
  1 1/2 ts Baking soda
    1/2 ts Salt
    3/4 ts Cinnamon
    1/2 ts Nutmeg
    1/8 ts Cloves
    1/2 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
      2    Egg whites -- whipped
    1/3 c  Skim milk -- at room
           Temperature
    3/4 c  Cranberries -- chopped fine
    3/4 c  Apples -- chopped
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a 9x5" loaf pan with cooking spray and
  flour. In a mixing bowl, combine flour, brown sugar, baking powder,
  baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves.  In another mixing
  bowl, combine applesauce, egg whites, milk, cranberries, and apples.
  Pour batter into prepared pan.  Bake for 50 minutes.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cranberry Apple Cobbler
 Categories: Pie/tart, Fruit
      Yield: 8 servings
 
  1 1/2 c  Cranberries -- sliced
  1 1/2 c  Apples -- grated
      1 tb Orange peel -- grated
    1/2 c  Brown sugar -- packed
      1 ts Cinnamon
    1/8 ts Cloves
      1 tb Unbleached flour
    1/2 c  Unbleached flour
      1 tb Margarine -- in bits
    1/2 ts Baking powder
    1/4 ts Salt
      2 tb Margarine
    1/3 c  Fat-free plain yogurt
    1/2 ts Granulated sugar
 
  Preheat oven at 400.  Prepare a baking pan with cooking spray and
  flour. In a mixing bowl, combine cranberries, apples, orange peel,
  brown sugar, cinnamon, cloves, and 1 tablespoon flour.  Put mixture
  in prepared baking pan.  Dot with 1 tablespoon margarine.  In another
  bowl, combine remaining flour, baking powder, and salt. Add the
  remaining margarine, combine until resembles crumbs, and stir in
  yogurt (dough will be sticky).  Drop dough by spoonfuls onto
  cranberry mixture, sprinkle with sugar. Bake for 30 minutes.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka

      Title: Cranberry Apple Crisp
 Categories: Breads, Fruit

      2 ts Cinnamon

  flour. In a mixing bowl, combine cranberries, apples, sugar,
  margarine, salt, flour, and cinnamon until mixture is crumbly.  Bake
  for 45 minutes.

      Title: Cranberry Banana Muffins
 Categories: Muffins, Fruit
      Yield: 12 servings
 
      2    Egg whites -- whipped
      3 tb Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
      3 tb Honey
      3 tb Molasses
      3 tb Orange juice -- at room
           Temperature
      1 ts Vanilla
      1 c  Banana -- mashed
      1 c  Unbleached flour -- sifted
      1 tb Orange peel -- grated
    1/2 ts Baking powder
    1/2 ts Baking soda
      1 c  Cranberries -- chopped
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare muffin tins with cooking spray and
  flour. In a mixing bowl, combine egg whites, applesauce, honey,
  molasses, orange juice, vanilla, and banana.  In another mixing bowl,
  combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and cranberries.  Use an
  ice cream scoop to fill prepared tins.  Bake for 15 minutes.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cranberry Button Cookies
 Categories: Cake/cookie, Fruit
      Yield: 48 servings
 
      2 c  Unbleached flour
  1 1/2 c  Brown sugar -- packed
      1 ts Baking soda
    1/2 ts Ginger
    1/2 ts Nutmeg
    1/4 ts Salt
      3 c  Oats
  1 1/2 c  Cranberries -- chopped
      1 c  Margarine -- cold
 
  Preheat oven at 375. Prepare a baking sheet with cooking spray.  In a
  mixing bowl, combine flour, brown sugar, baking soda, ginger, nutmeg,
  salt, oats, and cranberries.  Use a pastry blender to cut in
  margarine until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.  Mix all ingredients
  until thoroughly combined.  Roll out dough to 1/4" thick and cut into
  3" rounds. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka

      Title: Cranberry Cornmeal Muffins
 Categories: Muffins, Fruit
      Yield: 12 servings
 
      1 c  Unbleached flour
    3/4 c  Cornmeal
    1/3 c  Granulated sugar
      2 ts Baking powder
    1/4 ts Salt
      1    Egg white -- whipped
    3/4 c  Buttermilk* -- at room
           Temperature
    1/4 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
    1/2 ts Lemon peel -- grated
      1 c  Cranberries -- chopped
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare 12 muffin tins with cooking spray and
  flour. In a mixing bowl, combine flour, cornmeal, 1/3 cup sugar,
  baking powder, and salt.  In another mixing bowl, combine egg white,
  buttermilk, applesauce, and lemon peel, and cranberries.  Use an ice
  cream scoop to fill muffin tins 2/3 full.  Bake for 20 minutes or
  until golden.
  
  Recipe By     : Better Homes And Gardens Farmer's Market Cookbook

      Title: Cranberry Dried Chocolate Oatmeal Cookies
 Categories: Cake/cookie, Fruit
      Yield: 48 servings
 
      2 c  Cranberries* -- dried
      2 c  Unbleached flour
      1 ts Salt
      1 ts Baking soda
      6 c  Rolled oats
      2 pk Semisweet chocolate chips --
           (12 oz)
      2 c  Brown sugar -- packed
      1 c  Granulated sugar
  1 1/2 c  Margarine -- softened
      2    Egg whites -- whipped
    1/2 c  Water
      2 ts Vanilla
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a baking sheet with cooking spray.  In a
  mixing bowl, combine cranberries, flour, salt, baking soda, oats,
  chocolate chips, and sugars.  In another mixing bowl, combine
  margarine, egg whites, water, and vanilla.  Mix dry ingredients with
  wet ingredients just until moistened.  Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls
  about 2" apart on a prepared baking sheet.  Press top of each cookie
  lightly with finger to spread slightly.  Bake for 17 minutes.
  
  Recipe By     : Seattle Times food section

      Title: Cranberry Drops
 Categories: Cake/cookie, Fruit
      Yield: 66 servings
 
      1 c  Granulated sugar
    3/4 c  Brown sugar -- packed
      3 c  Unbleached flour
    1/4 ts Salt
    1/4 ts Baking soda
    1/2 c  Margarine -- softened
    1/4 c  Skim milk -- at room
           Temperature
      2 tb Orange juice
      1    Egg white -- whipped
  2 1/2 c  Cranberries -- chopped
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a baking sheet with cooking spray.  In a
  mixing bowl, combine sugars, flour, salt, and baking soda.  In another
  mixing bowl, combine margarine, milk, orange juice, egg white, and
  cranberries.  Mix dry ingredients with wet ingredients just until
  moistened.  Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls about 2" apart on a prepared
  baking sheet.  Push down slightly with a spoon.  Bake for 10 to 15
  minutes.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka

      Title: Cranberry Fruit (Any Size)
 Categories: Breads, Fruit
      Yield: 12 servings
 
      1 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
      3    Egg whites -- whipped
  1 1/2 c  Fat-free sour cream
    3/4 c  Cranberries -- chopped
      1 ts Vanilla
  2 1/2 c  Unbleached flour
  1 1/2 c  Granulated sugar
  1 1/2 ts Baking powder
  1 1/2 ts Baking soda
    1/4 ts Salt
    1/4 ts Nutmeg
    1/2 c  Raisins
    1/3 c  Apricots -- dried/chopped
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a pan(s) with cooking spray and flour.
  In a mixing bowl, combine applesauce, egg whites, sour cream,
  cranberries, and vanilla.  In another mixing bowl, combine flour,
  sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, nutmeg, raisins, and
  apricots.  Mix wet ingredients with dry ingredients just until
  moistened.  Pour into prepared pan(s). Bake about 1 hour depending on
  pan size.

      Title: Cranberry Fruitcake
 Categories: Holiday, Fruit, Cake/cookie
      Yield: 10 servings
 
  1 1/3 c  Unbleached flour
    1/2 c  Rolled oats
  1 1/2 ts Baking soda
      1 ts Ginger
    1/2 c  Egg whites -- whipped
    1/2 c  Honey
    1/3 c  Orange juice -- at room
           Temperature
    1/4 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
      1 ts Vanilla
      1 c  Cranberries -- chopped
    3/4 c  Apples -- shredded
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a 9 x 13 pan with cooking spray and
  flour. In a mixing bowl, combine flour, oats, baking soda, and
  ginger.  In another mixing bowl, combine egg whites, honey, orange
  juice, applesauce, vanilla, cranberries, and apples.  Mix dry
  ingredients with wet ingredients just until moistened.  Pour batter
  into prepared pan.  Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until browned and
  firm to the touch.
  
  Recipe By     : Prevention Quick and Healthy Low Fat Cooking

      Title: Cranberry Gingerbread (Any Size)
 Categories: Breads, Fruit
      Yield: 12 servings
 
  2 1/2 c  Unbleached flour
      1 ts Baking powder
      1 ts Baking soda
    1/4 ts Salt
      1 ts Cinnamon
      2 ts Ginger
    1/2 c  Brown sugar -- packed
    1/3 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
      1    Egg white -- whipped
    1/2 c  Fat-free yogurt
    1/4 c  Molasses
      2 tb Molasses
      1 c  Water -- very hot
      1 c  Cranberries -- chopped
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare pan(s) with cooking spray and flour.
  In a mixing bowl, combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt,
  cinnamon, ginger, and brown sugar.  In another mixing bowl, combine
  applesauce, egg white, yogurt, molasses, hot water, and cranberries.
  Mix dry ingredients with wet ingredients just until moistened.  Pour
  the batter into the prepared pan(s).  Bake for 35 to 45 minutes
  depending on pan size.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka

      Title: Cranberry Pumpkin (Any Size)
 Categories: Breads, Fruit
      Yield: 12 servings
 
      2 c  Unbleached flour
    1/2 c  Brown sugar -- packed
      1 ts Cinnamon
      1 ts Baking soda
    1/2 ts Nutmeg
    1/4 ts Salt
      1 c  Pumpkin
      2 c  Cranberries -- chopped
    1/2 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
    1/4 c  Skim milk -- at room
           Temperature
    1/4 c  Granulated sugar
      1    Egg white -- whipped
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare pan(s) with cooking spray and flour.
  In a mixing bowl, combine flour, brown sugar, baking soda, cinnamon,
  nutmeg, and salt.  In another mixing bowl, combine cranberries,
  applesauce, milk, sugar, and egg white.  Add wet ingredients with dry
  ingredients just until moistened.  Pour mixture into prepared pan(s).
  Bake for 40 to 50 minutes depending on pan size.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cranberry Rolls (Yeast)
 Categories: Breads, Fruit
      Yield: 24 servings
 
      1 c  Skim milk
      4 tb Oil
    1/4 c  Granulated sugar
    1/2 ts Salt
      2 tb Yeast
    1/4 c  Water -- warmed
      2    Egg whites -- whipped
    1/2 ts Ginger
      1 ts Cinnamon
      5 c  Unbleached flour
    1/2 c  Cranberries -- chopped
 
  Preheat oven at 350 after first and second rise.  Prepare a baking
  sheet with cooking spray.  In a small bowl, proof yeast with 1/2
  teaspoon honey in 1/4 cup water; stir and set aside until foamy, 5 to
  10 minutes.  Heat milk to th boiling point and dissolve the oil,
  sugar, and salt in it.  Let cool to lukewarm.  In a mixing bowl,
  combine milk mixture, egg whites, ginger, cinnamon, and proofed
  yeast.  Stir in almost all the flour until the dough starts to come
  away from the sides of the bowl.  Turn out and knead about 3 to 4
  minutes, adding more flour as necessary.  Sprinkle some flour over
  the cranberries, then knead them into the dough.  Clean your bowl and
  spray with cooking spray.  Return the dough to it; let rise, covered
  with plastic wrap, until doubled in size. Turn out and roll the dough
  to a thickness of 1/2".  Cut into 2 1/2" circles, plump the dough up
  by pulling the sides under and pinching together on the bottom, and
  place on prepared baking sheet an inch apart, seam side down.  Cover
  with a kitchen towel and let rise about 30 minutes.  Bake for 25
  minutes.
  
  Recipe By     : The Book of Bread
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cranberry Sauce (Any Size)
 Categories: Salsa/sauce, Fruit
      Yield: 16 servings
 
      3 c  Unbleached flour
      1 tb Baking powder
  1 1/2 ts Baking soda
  1 1/2 ts Salt
      2 ts Egg whites -- whipped
      1 c  Granulated sugar
      2 c  Cranberry sauce -- canned
    1/2 c  Skim milk
    1/2 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare pan(s) with cooking spray and flour.
  In a mixing bowl, combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, and
  salt.  In another mixing bowl, combine egg whites, sugar, cranberry
  sauce, milk, and applesauce.  Mix dry ingredients with wet
  ingredients just until moistened. Pour batter into prepared pan(s).
  Bake for 55 minutes, depending on pan size.
  
  Recipe By     : The Fannie Farmer Baking Book

      Title: Cranberry Sauce And Carrot Cake
 Categories: Cake/cookie, Breads, Fruit
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      3 c  Unbleached flour
      1 c  Brown sugar -- packed
      1 c  Granulated sugar
      2 ts Baking powder
      1 ts Cinnamon
      1 ts Nutmeg
      1 ts Cloves
    1/4 ts Salt
      1 c  Oil
      4    Egg whites -- whipped
      1 c  Whole cranberry sauce
      1 c  Carrots -- grated
    1/2 c  Lemon peel -- grated
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a cake pan with cooking spray and
  flour. In a mixing bowl, combine flour, sugars, baking powder, baking
  soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and salt.  In another mixing bowl,
  combine oil, egg whites, cranberry sauce, carrots, and lemon peel.
  Mix dry ingredients with wet ingredients just until combined.  Pour
  mixture into prepared pan. Bake for 45 minutes.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cranberry Sauce Carrot (Any Size)
 Categories: Breads, Fruit
      Yield: 12 servings
 
      3 c  Unbleached flour
      2 ts Baking powder
      1 ts Baking soda
    1/4 ts Salt
      1 ts Cinnamon
    1/2 ts Nutmeg
    1/2 ts Cloves
      1 c  Brown sugar -- packed
      1 c  Granulated sugar
      1 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
      4    Egg whites -- whipped
      1 c  Whole berry cranberry sauce
      1 c  Carrots -- peeled/shredded
    1/2 c  Lemon peel -- shredded
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare pan(s) with cooking spray and flour.
  In a mixing bowl, combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt,
  cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and sugars.  In another mixing bowl,
  combine applesauce, egg whites, cranberry sauce, carrots, and lemon
  peel.  Mix dry ingredients with wet ingredients just until moistened.
  Pour batter into prepared pan(s).  Bake for 50 to 55 minutes
  depending on pan size.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cranberry Sauce Cheese Bars
 Categories: Cake/cookie, Fruit
      Yield: 24 servings
 
MMMMM-------------------------CRUST----------------------------------
      2 c  Unbleached flour
  1 1/2 c  Rolled oats
    3/4 ts Brown sugar -- packed
      1 c  Margarine -- softened

MMMMM------------------------FILLING----------------------------------
      1 pk Fat-free cream cheese -- (8
           Oz) softened
      1 cn Sweetened condensed milk --
           (14 oz)
    1/4 c  Lemon juice -- at room
           Temperature

MMMMM------------------------TOPPING---------------------------------
      1 tb Brown sugar -- packed
      2 tb Cornstarch
      1 cn Whole berry cranberry sauce
           (16 oz)
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a 9 x 13 pan with cooking spray and
  flour. In a mixing bowl, combine flour, oats,  3/4 cup brown sugar,
  and margarine. Use a pastry blender to cut in margarine until mixture
  resembles coarse crumbs.  Reserving 1 1/2 cups of the crumb mixture,
  press remaining firmly on bottom of prepared pan.  Bake 15 minutes.
  Cool 10 minutes before topping with cheese mixture.  In another
  mixing bowl, combine cream cheese, condensed milk and lemon juice.
  Pour over baked crust. In a smaller mixing bowl, combine 1 tablespoon
  brown sugar, cornstarch, and cranberry sauce. Pour over cheesecake
  base.  Top with reserved crumb mixture. Bake 40 minutes or until
  golden brown.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cranberry Slice Cookies
 Categories: Cake/cookie, Fruit
      Yield: 84 servings
 
  4 1/2 c  Unbleached flour
  1 1/2 ts Baking soda
      1 ts Salt
  1 1/2 ts Cinnamon
      1 c  Granulated sugar
      1 c  Brown sugar -- packed
  1 1/2 c  Margarine -- softened
  1 1/2 c  Cranberries -- chopped
      2    Egg whites -- whipped
  1 1/2 ts Almond extract
 
  Preheat oven at 375.  In a mixing bowl, combine flour, baking powder,
  salt, cinnamon, and sugars.  In another mixing bowl, combine
  margarine, cranberries, egg whites, and almond extract.  Mix dry
  ingredients with wet ingredients just until moistened.  Shape into
  long rolls and wrap in waxed paper. Chill overnight.  Cut into 1/8"
  slices.  Place on unprepared baking sheet.  Bake for 10 to 12 minutes.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cream Cheese Pumpkin Pie
 Categories: Pie/tart
      Yield: 8 servings
 
MMMMM-------------------------CRUST----------------------------------
      1 pk Fat-free cream cheese -- (8
           Oz) softened
    1/4 c  Granulated sugar
      1 ts Vanilla
      1    Egg white -- whipped

MMMMM------------------------FILLING---------------------------------
  1 1/4 c  Pumpkin
    1/2 c  Granulated sugar
      1 ts Cinnamon
    1/4 ts Ginger
    1/4 ts Nutmeg
    1/4 ts Salt
      2    Egg whites -- whipped
      1 c  Evaporated skimmed milk
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a 9" pie pan with cooking spray and
  flour. To prepare filling, combine cream cheese, 1/4 cup sugar,
  vanilla, and egg white in a mixing bowl.  Spread mixture onto
  prepared pie pan.  To prepare filling,  combine pumpkin, 1/2 cup
  sugar, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, salt, egg whites, and milk in
  another mixing bowl.  Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until top layer is
  set.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Fancy Spritz Cookies
 Categories: Cake/cookie, Holiday
      Yield: 48 servings
 
      2 c  Unbleached flour
    1/4 ts Salt
    1/2 c  Granulated sugar
    1/2 c  Almonds -- ground
      2    Sticks margarine --
           Softened
      1    Egg white -- whipped
      1 ts Vanilla
      1 ts Almond extract
 
  Preheat oven at 375.  Prepare a baking sheet with cooking spray.  In a
  mixing bowl, combine flour, salt, and sugar.  In a blender grind the
  almonds to a powder-fine consistency.  In a mixing bowl, combine
  margarine, egg white, vanilla, and extract.  Mix dry ingredients with
  wet ingredients just until moistened.  Pack dough into cookie press.
  Keep unused portion of dough in refrigerator.  Press out desired
  shapes on prepared cookie sheet.  Space the cookies 1" apart.  Bake
  10 to 12 minutes, until cookies are pale gold in color.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka

      Title: Fudgy Mint Brownies
 Categories: Chocolate, Cake/cookie
      Yield: 12 servings
 
    1/4 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
      2 tb Water
      2 ts Vanilla
      2    Egg white -- whipped
      8    Andes Candies -- crushed
    3/4 c  Unbleached flour
    3/4 c  Granulated sugar
    1/3 c  Cocoa powder -- sifted
    1/4 ts Baking powder
    1/4 ts Salt
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a 8" square pan with cooking spray and
  flour. In a mixing bowl, combine applesauce, water, vanilla, egg
  white, and candies.  In another mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar,
  cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt.  Mix wet ingredients with dry
  ingredients just until moistened.  Bake for 25 minutes.

      Title: Ginger Carrot Bars
 Categories: Desserts, Cake/cookie
      Yield: 12 servings
 
    1/3 c  Rolled oats
      1 c  Unbleached flour -- sifted
      1 tb Ginger
      1 ts Baking powder
      2 md Carrots -- shredded
    1/2 c  Orange juice -- at room
           Temperature
    1/3 c  Maple syrup
      1    Egg white -- whipped
      1 tb Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
      1 ts Vanilla
 
  Preheat oven at 375.  Prepare a 8" x 8' baking pan with cooking spray
  and flour.  In a mixing bowl, oats, flour, ginger, and baking powder.
  In another mixing bowl, combine carrots, orange juice, maple syrup,
  egg white, applesauce, and vanilla.  Mix dry ingredients with wet
  ingredients just until moistened.  Bake for 20 minutes.
  
  Recipe By     : Prevention Quick and Healthy Low Fat Cooking

      Title: Harvest
 Categories: Breads
      Yield: 12 servings
 
      2 tb Water
      1 c  Cranberries -- chopped
      1 c  Apple -- grated
    1/2 c  Apple juice
      1 tb Lemon peel
      2    Egg whites -- whipped
      2 c  Unbleached flour
    1/2 c  Granulated sugar
    1/2 c  Brown sugar -- packed
    1/2 c  Raisins
      1 ts Baking powder
    1/2 ts Baking soda
      1 ts Cinnamon
    1/2 ts Nutmeg
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare pan(s) with cooking spray and flour.
  In a mixing bowl, combine water, cranberries, apple, apple juice,
  lemon peel, and egg whites.  In another mixing bowl, combine flour,
  sugars, raisins, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
  Mix wet ingredients with dry ingredients just until moistened.  Pour
  batter into prepared pan(s). Bake for 20 minutes depending on pan
  size.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Heart Healthy Pie Crust
 Categories: Pie/tart
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      2 c  Unbleached flour
    1/3 c  Olive oil
    1/4 c  Water -- ice cold
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a 9" pie pan with cooking spray and
  flour. Place flour in a bowl and drizzle with oil.  Use a pastry
  blender to evenly distribute the oil and produce a mixture the
  consistency of coarse cornmeal.  Sprinkle on the water, 1 tablespoon
  at a time, and continue mixing until you can gather the dough into a
  ball.  Roll the dough into a 11" circle onto a floured surface.
  Patch any cracks that may form, but otherwise try not to handle the
  dough more than necessary.  Transfer the dough to a pie plate.  Trim
  the dough, leaving a 1" overhang.  Crimp the overhanging dough into a
  decorative edge.  Chill the crust 20 minutes. Fill and bake according
  to your pie recipe directions.
  
  Recipe By     : The Healing Foods Cookbook
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Herbed Buttermilk Biscuits
 Categories: Breads
      Yield: 9 servings
 
  1 2/3 c  Unbleached flour
      2 ts Granulated sugar
  1 1/2 ts Baking powder
    1/2 ts Baking soda
    1/4 ts Salt
      1 tb Dill
      1 tb Parsley
      1 tb Chives
      2 tb Margarine -- cold
    2/3 c  Buttermilk*
      2 tb Olive oil
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a baking sheet with cooking spray.  In a
  mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt,
  dill, parsley, and chives.  Using a pastry blender, cut in margarine
  until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.  In a small mixing bowl,
  combine buttermilk and oil.  Mix dry ingredients with wet ingredients
  just until moistened.  Place dough on lightly flour surface.  Using a
  lightly floured rolling pin, roll out dough until 3" thick.  Using a
  cutter of choice, cut out shapes, gently reroll the scraps, to form
  12 biscuits.  Place biscuits on prepared baking sheet, spacing 1"
  apart.  Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden.
  
  Recipe By     : Reader's Digest Live Longer Cookbook

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Honey Chicken Muffins
 Categories: Breads, Muffins
      Yield: 12 servings
 
      1 c  Unbleached flour
      1 c  Cornmeal
      1 tb Baking powder
      1 tb Mustard -- dry
    1/2 ts Baking soda
    1/2 ts Salt
      2 c  Skinless boneless chicken
           Breast -- cooked/chopped
      1 c  Buttermilk* -- at room
           Temperature
    1/4 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
      2    Egg whites -- whipped
      2 tb Honey
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare 12 muffin tins with cooking spray and
  flour. In a mixing bowl, combine flour, cornmeal, baking powder,
  mustard, baking soda, and salt.  In a another mixing bowl, combine
  chicken, buttermilk, applesauce, egg whites, and honey.  Mix wet
  ingredients with dry ingredients just until moistened.  Use an ice
  cream scoop to fill muffin tins 3/4 full.  Bake for 20 minutes.
  
  Recipe By     : Reader's Digest Live Longer Cookbook

      Title: Honey Cinnamon Pumpkin Pie
 Categories: Pie/tart
      Yield: 16 servings
 
      3 c  Pumpkin
      3    Egg whites -- whipped
      2 c  Skim milk -- at room
           Temperature
    1/2 c  Honey
      2 tb Honey
    1/4 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
      2 tb Vanilla
      4 sl Bread -- diced
      3 tb Unbleached flour
      2 ts Cinnamon
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare 2-9" pie pans with cooking spray and
  flour. In a mixing bowl, combine pumpkin, egg whites, milk, honey,
  applesauce, and vanilla.  In another mixing bowl, combine bread,
  flour, and cinnamon. Mix wet ingredients with dry ingredients just
  until moistened.  Pour into prepared pie pans.  Bake 40 to 50 minutes.

      Title: Lemon
 Categories: Breads
      Yield: 12 servings
 
      1 ts Lemon peel -- grated
  2 1/4 c  Unbleached flour
    1/2 ts Baking powder
    1/2 ts Baking soda
    1/4 ts Salt

    3/4 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature

    3/4 c  Skim milk -- at room
           Temperature

           Temperature

  In a mixing bowl, combine lemon peel, flour, baking powder, baking
  soda, salt, and sugar.  In another mixing bowl, combine applesauce,

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Lemon Cheese Pie
 Categories: Pie/tart
      Yield: 12 servings
 
MMMMM-------------------------CRUST----------------------------------
  1 1/2 c  Graham cracker crumbs
    1/3 c  Granulated sugar
      6 tb Margarine -- melted
      1 ts Cinnamon

MMMMM------------------------FILLING---------------------------------
      1 pk Fat-free cream cheese -- (8
           Oz) softened
      2 tb Margarine -- softened
    1/2 c  Granulated sugar
      1    Egg white -- whipped
      2 tb Unbleached flour
    2/3 c  Skim milk -- at room
           Temperature
    1/4 c  Lemon juice -- at room
           Temperature
      2 tb Lemon peel -- grated
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a 9" pie pan with cooking spray and
  flour. To prepare crust, combine crumbs, sugar, margarine, and
  cinnamon in a mixing bowl.  Spread around prepared pan, gently
  pressing down.  Bake for 10 minutes.  Meanwhile, to prepare filling,
  combine cream cheese, margarine, sugar, egg white, flour, milk, lemon
  juice, and lemon peel in a another mixing bowl.  Pour into prepared
  pie crust.  Bake for 40 minutes.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Lemon Cheesecake Bars
 Categories: Desserts, Cake/cookie
      Yield: 24 servings
 
MMMMM-------------------------CRUST-----------------------------------
  1 1/2 c  Unbleached flour
    2/3 c  Powdered sugar -- sifted
    1/4 ts Salt
    3/4 c  Margarine -- cold

MMMMM------------------------FILLING----------------------------------
      1 pk Fat-free cream cheese -- (8
           Oz) softened
    2/3 c  Granulated sugar
      3    Egg whites -- whipped
    1/3 c  Lemon juice -- at room
           Temperature
    1/2 ts Vanilla

MMMMM-------------------------GLAZE----------------------------------
  2 1/2 c  Powdered sugar -- sifted
    1/2 ts Vanilla
      1 tb Skim milk -- at room
           Temperature
      4 tb Lemon juice -- at room
           Temperature
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a 9 x 13 pan with cooking spray and
  flour. In a mixing bowl, combine flour, 2/3 cup powdered sugar, and
  salt.  Use a pastry blender to cut in margarine until mixture
  resembles coarse crumbs. Press firmly over bottom of prepared pan.
  Bake 15 minutes.  Cool 10 minutes before topping with cheese mixture.
  To prepare filling, combine cream cheese, 2/3 granulated sugar, egg
  whites, milk, lemon juice and vanilla in another mixing bowl.  Pour
  over baked crust.  Bake for 22 to 28 minutes or until firm.
  Meanwhile, to prepare glaze, combine 2 1/2 cups powdered sugar,
  vanilla, and milk.  Add enough lemon juice to make a thick smooth
  glaze.  Pour glaze over cheesecake base; smooth surface.  Cover and
  refrigerate overnight before cutting.
  
  Recipe By     : The Joy Of Cookies
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Lemon Coffeecake
 Categories: Desserts, Cake/cookie, Fruit
      Yield: 12 servings
 
    2/3 c  Honey
    1/3 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
      1 c  Egg whites -- whipped
  1 1/2 ts Lemon extract
      1 c  Fat-free lemon yogurt
      1 c  Cranberries* -- chopped
  2 1/2 c  Unbleached flour -- sifted
      1 ts Baking powder
      1 tb Lemon peel -- grated
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a 9 cup Bundt pan(s) with cooking spray
  and flour.  In a mixing bowl, combine honey, applesauce, egg whites,
  lemon extract, lemon yogurt, and cranberries.  In another bowl,
  combine flour, baking powder, and lemon peel.  Mix wet ingredients
  with dry ingredients just until moistened.  Bake for 30 to 35 minutes.
  
  Recipe By     : Prevention Quick and Healthy Low Fat Cooking
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Lemon Filled Coconut Cake
 Categories: Cake/cookie
      Yield: 16 servings
 
MMMMM------------------------FILLING---------------------------------
    3/4 c  Granulated sugar
      3 tb Cornstarch
    1/4 ts Salt
    3/4 c  Water
      1 tb Margarine -- melted
      1 ts Lemon peel -- grated
    1/3 c  Lemon juice -- at room
           Temperature
      4 dr Yellow food coloring

MMMMM--------------------------CAKE-----------------------------------
  2 1/4 c  Unbleached flour
  1 2/3 c  Granulated sugar
  3 1/2 ts Baking powder
      1 ts Salt
  1 1/4 c  Skim milk -- at room
           Temperature
    2/3 c  Margarine -- softened
      1 ts Vanilla
      5    Egg whites -- whipped
      1 c  Coconut -- shredded

MMMMM------------------------TOPPING---------------------------------
      1 c  Whipping cream
    1/4 c  Powdered sugar -- sifted
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare 2 round cake pans with cooking spray and
  flour.  To prepare filling, combine 3/4 cup granulated sugar,
  cornstarch, and salt in a 1 1/2 quart saucepan.  Gradually stir in
  water.  Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture
  thickens and boils.  Boil and stir 5 minutes; remove from heat.  Stir
  in margarine and lemon peel until margarine is melted.  Gradually
  stir in lemon juice and food color. Press plastic wrap onto hot
  filling.  Refrigerate until set, about 1 hour. To prepare cake,
  combine flour, remaining granulated sugar, baking powder, and salt in
  a mixing bowl.  In another mixing bowl, combine milk, vanilla, egg
  whites, and coconut.  Mix dry ingredients with wet ingredients just
  until moistened.  Pour batter into prepared pans.  Bake 30 to 35
  minutes. Meanwhile, to prepare topping, combine whipping cream and
  powdered sugar in chilled mixing bowl until stiff.  Fill layers with
  filling and frost with whipped cream; refrigerate.
  
  Recipe By     : Betty Crocker's Casual Country Cooking
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Lemon Pumpkin Pie
 Categories: Desserts, Pie/tart
      Yield: 8 servings
 
MMMMM------------------------FILLING---------------------------------
  1 1/2 c  Pumpkin
    3/4 c  Egg whites -- whipped
    3/4 c  Evaporated skim milk
    1/3 c  Maple syrup
    1/2 ts Cinnamon
    1/2 ts Ginger
    1/4 ts Nutmeg

MMMMM------------------------TOPPING---------------------------------
      1 c  Fat-free vanilla yogurt
      1 tb Lemon juice -- at room
           Temperature
      2 ts Lemon peel -- grated
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a 9" pie pan with cooking spray and
  flour. To prepare filling, combine pumpkin, egg whites, milk, and
  maple syrup in a mixing bowl.  In another small mixing bowl, combine
  cinnamon, ginger, and nutmeg.  Mix wet ingredients dry ingredients
  just until moistened. Pour into mixture into prepared pan.  Bake for
  55 minutes.  Cool on wire rack. Meanwhile, to prepare topping,
  combine yogurt, lemon juice, and lemon peel in a small mixing bowl.
  Spread on top of the pie.  Chill before serving.
  
  Recipe By     : The Healing Foods Cookbook

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Lemon Spice
 Categories: Breads
      Yield: 8 servings
 
    1/4 c  Molasses
    1/4 c  Water -- hot
      1    Egg white -- whipped
      2 tb Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
      1 c  Unbleached flour
      2 tb Brown sugar -- packed
    1/2 ts Baking soda
    1/2 ts Ginger
    1/2 ts Cinnamon
    1/8 ts Salt

MMMMM--------------------------SAUCE----------------------------------
      3 tb Granulated sugar
      1 tb Cornstarch
      1 c  Water
      1 tb Lemon peel -- grated
      1 tb Lemon juice
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a pan(s) with cooking spray and flour.
  In a mixing bowl combine molasses, water, egg white, and applesauce.
  In another mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking soda, ginger,
  cinnamon, and salt. Pour mixture into prepared pan.  Bake for 30 to
  35 minutes. Meanwhile, to prepare sauce, mix sugar and cornstarch in
  1 quart saucepan. Gradually stir in water.  Cook over medium heat,
  stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and boils.  Boil and stir
  1 minute; remove from heat. Stir in lemon peel and lemon juice.
  Serve over gingerbread.
  
  Recipe By     : Betty Crocker's New Choice Cookbook

      Title: Lemon Spritz Cookies
 Categories: Cake/cookie, Holiday
      Yield: 40 servings
 
  1 1/2    Sticks margarine --
           Softened
      3 ts Lemon juice -- at room
           Temperature
      1 ts Lemon peel -- grated
  2 1/4 c  Unbleached flour
      1 c  Powdered sugar -- sifted
    1/4    Salt
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a baking sheet with cooking spray.  In a
  mixing bowl, combine margarine, lemon juice, and lemon peel.  In
  another mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, and salt.  Mix wet
  ingredients with dry ingredients just until moistened.  Spoon dough
  into a cookie press with fitted template of desired shape.  Press
  cookies 2" apart onto prepared baking sheets.  Bake 10 to 12 minutes,
  or until golden brown.
  
  Recipe By     : 365 Great Cookies You Can Make

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Lemony Carrot Cake
 Categories: Cake/cookie
      Yield: 9 servings
 
  1 1/4 c  Unbleached flour
      1 c  Granulated sugar
    1/2 ts Baking powder
    1/2 ts Baking soda
    1/2 ts Salt
    1/3 c  Margarine -- at room
           Temperature
      1 ts Lemon peel -- grated
      1 ts Vanilla
      2    Egg whites -- whipped
    1/2 c  Fat-free plain yogurt*
  1 1/2 c  Carrots -- shredded

MMMMM-------------------------TOPPING---------------------------------
      3 tb Margarine
  1 1/2 c  Powdered sugar -- sifted
    1/2 ts Lemon peel -- grated
    1/2 ts Vanilla
      2 tb Fat-free plain yogurt*
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a 9 x 9" baking pan with cooking spray
  and flour.  In a mixing bowl combine flour, sugar, baking powder,
  baking soda, and salt.  In another mixing bowl, combine margarine,
  lemon peel, 1 teaspoon vanilla, egg whites, yogurt, and carrots.  Mix
  dry ingredients with wet ingredients just until moistened.  Pour
  batter into prepared pan. Bake 30 minutes.  Meanwhile, to prepare
  topping, combine margarine, sugar, lemon peel, and remaining vanilla.
  Add enough yogurt to make a spread able frosting.  Spread on cooled
  cake.
  
  Recipe By     : Dannon Healthy Habit Cookbook

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Little Cinnamon Crumb Cakes
 Categories: Desserts
      Yield: 12 servings
 
MMMMM-------------------------CRUMBS----------------------------------
      1    Stick margarine -- cold
      1 c  Unbleached flour
    2/3 c  Granulated sugar
      1 tb Cinnamon

MMMMM-------------------------BATTER----------------------------------
  2 1/4 c  Unbleached flour
      1 c  Granulated sugar
      1 tb Baking powder
    1/4 ts Salt
    3/4 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
    1/3 c  Skim milk -- at room
           Temperature
      3    Egg whites -- whipped
      1 ts Vanilla
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare pan(s)with cooking spray and flour.  To
  make crumbs, work the margarine, 1 cup flour, 2/3 cup sugar, and
  cinnamon in a small bowl with pastry blender until the mixture forms
  crumbs; set aside. To make the batter, combine flour, sugar, baking
  powder, and salt in mixing bowl.  In another mixing bowl, combine
  applesauce, milk, egg whites, and vanilla.  Mix dry ingredients with
  wet ingredients just until moistened. Divide the batter between the
  prepared pan(s).  Scatter the crumbs over the tops, pressing them in
  gently.  Bake for 40 minutes or until the tops are golden and springy
  to the touch.  If the cakes have overflowed a bit, cut them apart
  with a sharp knife.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Low Fat Devil's Food Cookies
 Categories: Cake/cookie
      Yield: 30 servings
 
    1/4 c  Margarine -- softened
    1/2 c  Buttermilk* -- at room
           Temperature
      1 ts Vanilla
      2    Egg whites -- whipped
  1 1/2 c  Unbleached flour
    1/2 c  Unsweetened cocoa powder --
           Sifted
    2/3 c  Granulated sugar
      1 ts Baking soda
    1/4 ts Salt
      2 ts Powdered sugar -- sifted
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare baking sheets with cooking spray.  In a
  mixing bowl, combine margarine, buttermilk, vanilla , and egg whites.
  In another mixing bowl, combine  flour, cocoa powder, sugar, baking
  soda, and salt.  Mix wet ingredients with dry ingredients just until
  moistened. Drop dough by tablespoonfuls, 2" apart onto prepared
  baking sheets.  Bake for 7 minutes.  Sprinkle with powdered sugar.
  
  Recipe By     : Cooking Light Magazine

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Low Fat Pumpkin Cookies
 Categories: Cake/cookie
      Yield: 36 servings
 
    3/4 c  Pumpkin
    1/2 c  Fat-free plain yogurt
      2 tb Fat-free plain yogurt
      1 ts Vanilla
      2 c  Unbleached flour
      1 c  Raisins
    3/4 c  Brown sugar -- packed
      2 ts Cinnamon
      1 ts Ginger
    1/2 ts Baking soda
    1/4 ts Salt
    1/2 ts Allspice
    1/2 ts Nutmeg
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare baking sheets with cooking spray.  In a
  mixing bowl, combine pumpkin, yogurt, and vanilla.  In another mixing
  bowl, combine flour, raisins, brown sugar, cinnamon, ginger, baking
  soda, salt, allspice, and nutmeg.  Mix wet ingredients with dry
  ingredients just until moistened.  Drop by tablespoonfuls onto
  prepared baking sheet, 2" apart. Bake for 15 minutes, until they seem
  firm.
  
  Storage: Since these cookies have no added fat they don't store well.
  They become stale quickly and stick together if stacked.  As soon as
  they cool, wrap in layers separated by wax paper and freeze.  To
  serve, simply let them thaw to room temperature.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Low Fat Pumpkin Oatmeal Cookies
 Categories: Cake/cookie
      Yield: 48 servings
 
      1 c  Pumpkin
      2    Egg whites -- whipped
      1 c  Brown sugar -- packed
  1 1/2 c  Unbleached flour
      1 ts Baking soda
      1 ts Cinnamon
    1/2 ts Nutmeg
    1/2 ts Cloves
      3 c  Rolled oats
      1 c  Raisins
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare baking sheet with cooking spray.  In a
  mixing bowl, combine pumpkin and egg whites.  In another mixing bowl,
  combine sugar, flour, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, oats,
  and raisins. Mix wet ingredients with dry ingredients just until
  moistened. Drop by tablespoonfuls onto prepared baking sheet, 2"
  apart.  Bake for 15 minutes, or until they seem firm.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka

      Title: Low Fat Rocky Road Brownies
 Categories: Chocolate, Low cal/fat
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      4    Egg whites -- whipped
      1 c  Marshmallow creme
      1 tb Vanilla
    1/2 c  Unbleached flour
      1 c  Granulated sugar
    1/2 c  Cocoa powder -- sifted
    1/4 ts Baking soda
    1/4 ts Baking powder
    1/4 ts Salt
 
  Preheat oven at 325.  Prepare a 9 x 13" pan with cooking spray and
  flour. In a mixing bowl, combine egg whites, marshmallow creme, and
  vanilla.  In another mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, cocoa powder,
  baking soda, baking powder, and salt.  Mix dry ingredients with wet
  ingredients just until moistened.  Bake for 18 minutes.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Low Fat Spice Cookies
 Categories: Cake/cookie
      Yield: 50 servings
 
  1 3/4 c  Whole wheat flour
      1 c  Unbleached flour
      1 c  Brown sugar -- packed
      2 ts Cinnamon
    1/2 ts Nutmeg
    1/4 ts Ginger
    1/4 ts Cloves
    1/2 ts Baking soda
    1/4 ts Salt
    1/4 c  Margarine -- softened
    1/4 c  Fat-free spread -- softened
      1    Egg white -- whipped
      1 ts Vanilla
    1/2 c  Fat-free sour cream
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare baking sheets with cooking spray.  In a
  mixing bowl, combine flours, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, cloves,
  baking soda, and salt.  In another mixing bowl, combine margarine,
  spread, egg white, vanilla, and sour cream.  Mix dry ingredients with
  wet ingredients just until moistened.  Cover and chill overnight.  On
  a heavily floured surface (dough will be slightly sticky that's why
  more flour is needed), roll dough 1/8" thickness.  Using a 2 1/2 "
  cutters, cut dough into desired shapes.  Arrange 1" apart on prepared
  baking sheet. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes and until lightly browned.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka

      Title: Low Fat White Cake
 Categories: Cake/cookie, Low cal/fat
      Yield: 12 servings
 
      1    Box white Duncan Hines cake
           Mix
      1 pk Dream Whip powder
    1/2 ts Baking powder
      1 c  Water -- cold
      4    Egg whites -- whipped
      1 tb Oil
      1 ts Vanilla

MMMMM------------------------FROSTING---------------------------------
      1    Box Betty Crocker Home Style
           Frosting
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a 9 x 13" pan with cooking spray.  In a
  mixing bowl, combine cake mix, Dream Whip, and baking powder.  In
  another mixing bowl, combine water, egg whites, oil, and vanilla.
  Mix dry ingredients with wet ingredients just until moistened.  Bake
  for 40 minutes until golden brown.  To prepare frosting, follow
  directions on box.

      Title: Low-Fat Chocolate Cake
 Categories: Low cal/fat, Chocolate, Cake/cookie
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      6    Egg whites -- whipped
      1 c  Granulated sugar
      1 tb Vanilla
    1/3 c  Cocoa powder -- sifted
    3/4 c  Unbleached flour
    1/4 ts Salt
    1/2 ts Baking powder
    1/2 ts Baking soda
  1 1/2 c  Marshmallow creme
 
  Preheat oven at 325.  Prepare a 8" square pan with cooking spray and
  flour. In a mixing bowl, combine cocoa powder, flour, salt, baking
  powder, and baking soda.  In another mixing bowl, combine egg whites,
  sugar, vanilla, and marshmallow creme.  Mix dry ingredients with wet
  ingredients just until moistened.  Bake for 30 minutes.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Marbleized Mint Bank
 Categories: Holiday, Candies
      Yield: 20 servings
 
    1/3 c  Semisweet mint-flavored
           Chocolate pieces -- or
           Semisweet
           Chocolate pieces
      1 lb Vanilla flavored candy --
           Cut up
    3/4 c  Candy canes or peppermint
           Candies -- crushed
 
  Line a baking sheet with foil; set aside.  In a double boiler, heat
  chocolate pieces over low heat, stirring constantly, until melted and
  smooth.  Remove from heat.  In a double boiler, heat candy coating
  over low heat, stirring constantly, until melted and smooth.  Remove
  pan from heat. Stir in crushed candies.  Pour melted coating mixture
  onto prepared baking sheet.  Spread coating mixture to about a 3/8"
  thickness; drizzle with melted chocolate.  Gently zigzag a narrow
  metal spatula through chocolate and peppermint layers to create a
  swirled effect.  Let candy stand several hours or until firm (candy
  can be chilled 30 minutes or until firm). Use foil to lift candy from
  baking sheet.  Carefully break into pieces. Store, lightly covered,
  for as long as 2 weeks.  Makes about 1 1/4 pounds.
  
  Recipe By     : Christmas At Home By The Fireside

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Marguerites
 Categories: Holiday, Muffins
      Yield: 36 servings
 
      1 c  Margarine -- softened
      1    Egg white -- whipped
      1 ts Vanilla
      1 c  Unbleached flour
    3/4 c  Brown sugar -- packed
    1/2 ts Salt
    1/4 ts Baking powder
    1/8 ts Baking soda
      1 c  Rolled oats
      1 c  Nuts -- chopped
 
  Preheat oven at 375.  Prepare baking sheet with cooking spray.  In a
  mixing bowl, combine margarine, egg white, and vanilla.  In another
  mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, baking soda,
  oats, and nuts. Pour mixture into mini-muffin tins.  Bake for 15 to
  20 minutes. While hot, tap muffin tin to get muffins out of pan.
  Decorations that can be used are cinnamon candies and green icing.
  
  Recipe By     : Jane Johnson

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Mint Chocolate Logs
 Categories: Holiday, Chocolate
      Yield: 48 servings
 
      1    Stick margarine -- softened
      4 oz Fat-free cream cheese --
           Softened
      1    Egg white -- whipped
      1    Square unsweetened chocolate
           Melted
    1/2 ts Vanilla
    1/2 ts Peppermint extract
  1 1/2 c  Unbleached flour
    3/4 c  Granulated sugar
    1/4 c  Almonds -- finely chopped
    1/2 ts Baking powder
    1/4 ts Salt
    1/2 c  Mint chocolate chips --
           Melted
 
  Preheat oven at 375.  In a mixing bowl, combine margarine, cream
  cheese, egg white, melted chocolate, vanilla, and peppermint extract.
  Add flour mixed with almonds, baking powder.  In another mixing bowl,
  combine flour, sugar, almonds, baking powder, and salt.  Cover and
  refrigerate at least 1 hour, until firm.  Divide one fourth of dough
  into 12 pieces.  Roll each piece into 2 1/2" long strip and place the
  strips 1" apart on unprepared baking sheets.  Repeat with remaining
  dough.  Bake 8 to 10 minutes, or until edges are set.  Let cookies
  cool on sheets 2 minutes, then remove to a rack and let cool
  completely.  Using a knife or a metal spatula, spread melted
  chocolate on one end of each log.
  
  Recipe By     : 365 Great Cookies You Can Make

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Oatmeal Cookie Crust
 Categories: Pie/tart
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      2 tb Margarine -- melted
    1/4 c  Honey
    1/2 ts Vanilla
  1 1/2 c  Rolled oats
    1/2 c  Unbleached flour
    1/2 ts Salt
      1 ts Cinnamon
    1/4 c  Walnuts -- minced fine
 
  In a mixing bowl, combine margarine, honey, and vanilla.  In another
  mixing bowl, combine oats, flour, salt, cinnamon, and walnuts.  Mix
  wet ingredients with dry ingredients just until moistened.  Press
  crust firmly and evenly into the bottom and around the sides of a 9"
  pie pan.
  
  Recipe By     : Pamela Smith
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Orange Candy
 Categories: Candies
      Yield: 32 servings
 
      3 c  Granulated sugar
    1/4 c  Water
      1 c  Evaporated skim milk --
           Undiluted
      1 ds Salt
      2 ts Orange peel -- grated
      1 c  Black walnuts -- chopped
 
  Put 1 cup sugar into a heavy skillet and stir slowly with a wooden
  spoon over medium heat until the sugar is melted and caramelized to a
  golden brown color.  Add the water and stir until the sugar is
  completely dissolved.  Add the remaining 2 cups sugar, evaporated
  milk and salt. Place over low heat and stir constantly until the
  mixture boils.  Cook, stirring frequently, until it reaches the soft
  ball stage (236 degrees). Remove from heat; cool to lukewarm.  Do not
  stir.  Add the orange peel and nuts. Beat vigorously until the candy
  loses its gloss and will hold its shape when dropped from a spoon.
  Pour into lightly greased (margarine) 8 x 8 inch baking dish.  Cool
  until set.  Cut into squares before the candy becomes too firm.
  
  Recipe By     : Jo Anne Merrill

      Title: Palouse Soup Mix
 Categories: Holiday
      Yield: 10 servings
 
  2 1/2 c  Green split peas -- (16 oz
           Pkg)
  2 1/2 c  Lentils -- (16 oz pkg)
  2 1/2 c  Pearl barley -- (16 oz pkg)
      2 c  Macaroni OR -- (8 oz pkg )
      2 c  Brown rice
    1/2 c  Celery flakes -- (3/8 oz)
    1/2 c  Parsley flakes -- (1/4 oz)
    1/2 ts Thyme
    1/2 ts White pepper
 
  Mix all ingredients together.  Store in a jar with a tight fitting
  lid. Stir before using.
  To give as a gift.  Present these instructions on a nice card:
  Combine 1 cup of soup mix with 4 cups of water or seasoned stock in a
  large pan. Add 1 cup of cooked chopped meat, if desired.  Bring to a
  boil.  Reduce heat to low and cover pan.  Simmer gently for 45 to 50
  minutes, or until peas are tender.  Add 1/2 teaspoon of salt if
  desired.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka

      Title: Peanut Butter
 Categories: Cake/cookie
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      2 c  Unbleached flour
    1/2 c  Granulated sugar
    1/2 c  Brown sugar -- packed
  1 1/4 ts Baking soda
    3/4 ts Baking powder
    1/2 ts Salt
      1 c  Skim milk -- at room
           Temperature
      1 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
      1    Egg white -- whipped
      1 ts Vanilla
      1 c  Peanut butter
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare pan(s) with cooking spray and flour.
  In a mixing bowl, combine flour, sugars, baking soda, baking powder,
  and salt. In another mixing bowl, combine milk, applesauce, egg
  white, vanilla, and peanut butter.  Mix dry ingredients with wet
  ingredients just until moistened.  Pour batter in the prepared pan.
  Bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes depending on pan size.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka

      Title: Peanut Butter And Banana Cookies
 Categories: Cake/cookie
      Yield: 30 servings

      1 c  Bananas -- mashed
      1    Egg white -- whipped
      1 ts Vanilla

  1 1/2 c  Unbleached flour
    1/2 c  Granulated sugar
    1/2 c  Brown sugar -- packed
      1 ts Baking soda
 
  Preheat oven at 375.  Prepare a baking sheet with cooking spray.  In a

  another mixing bowl, combine flour, sugars, and baking soda.  Mix wet

      Title: Peanut Butter And Jelly
 Categories: Breads
      Yield: 12 servings
 
      2 c  Unbleached flour
      6 tb Granulated sugar
  1 1/2 tb Baking powder
    1/4 ts Salt
      6 tb Peanut butter
    3/4 c  Skim milk
    1/4 c  Applesauce -- at room
           Temperature
      1    Egg white -- whipped
    1/4 c  Grape or strawberry jelly
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare pan(s) with cooking spray.  In a mixing
  bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.  In another

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Peanut Butter Brownie Treats
 Categories: Chocolate, Cake/cookie
      Yield: 12 servings
 
MMMMM-------------------------BATTER----------------------------------
      1 pk Semi sweet chocolate chips
           (12 oz) melted
    1/4 c  Margarine -- melted
    1/2 c  Peanut butter -- at room
           Temperature
      3    Egg whites -- whipped
      1 ts Vanilla
  1 1/2 c  Granulated sugar
  1 1/4 c  Unbleached flour
    1/2 ts Baking powder

MMMMM------------------------TOPPING---------------------------------
  1 1/2 c  Powdered sugar -- sifted
      2 tb Peanut butter -- at room
           Temperature
    1/2 ts Vanilla
      2 tb Skim milk
 
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare bottoms only of 12 muffin cups with
  cooking spray and flour.  In a mixing bowl, combine chips, margarine,
  peanut butter, egg whites, and vanilla.  In another mixing bowl,
  combine granulated sugar, flour, and baking powder.  Mix wet
  ingredients with dry ingredients just until moistened.  Divide batter
  evenly among muffin cups. Bake 18 to 20 minutes or until tops are
  dry.  Meanwhile, to prepare topping, combine powdered sugar, peanut
  butter, vanilla, and milk until smooth.  Spread on cooled muffins.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Peanut Butter Creams
 Categories: Candies
      Yield: 57 servings
 
    1/4 c  Cream cheese
      2 c  Powdered sugar -- sifted
      3 tb Peanut butter
      1 tb Butter
      1 ts Vanilla
    1/4 c  Peanuts -- chopped fine
 
  In a mixing bowl, combine cream cheese, sugar, peanut butter, butter,
  and vanilla.  If necessary add a little more powdered sugar.  Cover
  and chill for 1 to 2 hours.  Form into small balls and roll each ball
  in peanuts. Place in paper candy cups, cover and keep refrigerated
  for up to 4 days. Return to room temperature about 2 hours before
  eating.
  
  Recipe By     : The Complete Home Confectioner

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Peanut Butter Cups
 Categories: Candies, Chocolate
      Yield: 20 servings
 
      1 c  Semisweet chocolate disks --
           Melted
      1    7 oz Hershey Bar -- melted
    1/3 c  Peanut butter -- at room
           Temperature
  2 1/2 tb Powdered sugar -- sifted
 
  Melt chocolate disks and Hershey bar in a double boiler.  In a small
  mixing bowl, combine peanut butter and powder sugar until smooth.
  Shape into balls and set aside .  With small paint brush, brush
  melted chocolate onto the bottom and up sides of paper candy cups
  till about 1/8 inch thick. Put a peanut butter ball in each chocolate
  coated candy cup.  To seal peanut butter balls, spoon another layer
  of melted chocolate over each ball. Chill or freeze until hardened.
  
  Recipe By     : Rosemary Matejka

      Title: Peanuts, Chocolate Or Butterscotch
 Categories: Holiday, Candies
      Yield: 1 servings
 
      1 c  Semi sweet or butterscotch
           Chips -- melted
  2 1/2 c  Roasted shelled peanuts --
           Skins on
 
  Melt chocolate or butterscotch chips in a double boiler over hot (not
  boiling) water.  Add peanuts and stir to coat.  Turn out on waxed
  paper, separate with fork.  Allow to cool.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Peanuts, Spiced
 Categories: Holiday, Nuts/grains, Snacks
      Yield: 15 servings
 
      1 c  Granulated sugar
    1/2 c  Water
      1 ts Cinnamon
    1/2 ts Nutmeg
      1 ts Cloves
      3 c  Roasted peanuts -- skins on
 
  Boil sugar, water, and spices until syrup reaches hard crack stage
  (293). Drop peanuts into syrup.  Stir until nuts are dry looking.
  Pour out on to waxed paper and let stand until cool and dry.  Makes 3
  1/2 cups.
  
  Recipe By     : Anita A. Matejka
