MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Enchilada Bean Bake
 Categories: Tex/mexican, Casseroles
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      2    Cl Garlic; minced
    1/2 c  Onion; chopped
    1/2 c  Mushrooms; chopped
    1/4 c  Water
      2 c  Beans
  1 1/2 c  Stewed tomatoes
    1/2 c  Red wine
      1 ts Chili powder
      1 ts Cumin
    1/2 c  Fat-free cottage cheese
    1/4 c  Fat-free plain yogurt
    1/4 c  Cheddar cheese; shredded
      5    Corn tortillas
 
  Recipe by: No Red Meat Preparation Time: 0:15 Preheat oven at 350.
  Prepare a 2 quart casserole dish with cooking spray.
   In a skillet over low heat, cook garlic, onion, and mushrooms in 1/4
  cup water until tender.  Add beans, tomatoes, wine, chili powder, and
  cumin. Heat over medium-high heat until boiling; reduce heat and
  simmer about 30 minutes or until most of liquid is gone.  Using a
  potato masher, mash beans thoroughly.  In a bowl, mix cottage cheese
  and yogurt; set aside. In prepared casserole dish, put a layer of
  tortillas, a layer of beans and a little cheese mixture.  Sprinkle
  with cheddar cheese.  Bake, uncovered, about 30 minutes or until
  bubbling.
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Fish En Papillote
 Categories: Fish/seafoo
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      4    Fish fillets
      2 md Carrots; cut into strips
      4    15 x 12" pieces waxed paper
      1 tb Mustard, prepared
    1/2 ts Honey
    1/4 ts Lemon pepper seasoning
    2/3 c  Onions, sliced
 
  Recipe by: Better Homes And Gardens Family Favorites Made Lighter
  Preparation Time: 0:15
  
  Preheat oven at 450.  Prepare a baking sheet lined with foil with
  cooking spray.  Rinse fillets; pat dry with paper towels.  In a small
  covered saucepan cook the carrots in a small amount of boiling water
  about 4 minutes or until nearly tender. Drain well.  To assemble each
  package, fold each piece of waxed paper in half crosswise.  From
  each, cut out a half heart shape 6" longer and 2" wider than fillets.
  (The fold will be the center of the heart.)  Open each heart shape
  piece of paper.  Place a fillet on the right half  of each heart,
  tucking under any thin edges of the fillet. (If fillet is less than
  1/2" thick, stack fillets to about 1/2" thickness.).  In a small
  mixing bowl stir together mustard, honey, and lemon pepper seasoning.
  Spread mustard mixture over fish portions. Top with the carrots and
  onions.  Fold left of each heart over the fillet, matching edges.
  Starting at the top of each heart, seal the packages by folding the
  edges together in a double fold.  Fold only a small section at a time
  to ensure a tight seal.  Then twist the tip of each heart to seal the
  packages.  (The secret to a beautifully puffed papillote is a tight
  seal.) Place the packages on a baking sheet.  Bake for 12 to 15
  minutes or just until fillet begins to flake easily and the paper
  puffs up (carefully open paper to check doneness.)  To serve, cut a
  large X on the top of each package, then pull back the paper.
  Transfer packages to dinner plates.
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Five Spice Fish
 Categories: Fish/seafoo
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      2 lb Fillets
    2/3 c  Onion; chopped
  1 1/2 tb Ginger
    1/2 c  Soy sauce
  1 1/2 tb Sugar
      1 tb Olive oil
    1/2 ts Cinnamon
    1/2 ts Allspice
    1/4 ts Cloves
 
  Recipe by: One Year of Healthy Hearty & Simple One Dish Meals
  Preparation Time: 0:20 Cut fillets in 2'" x 2" long slices. Mix
  fillets with onions, ginger, soy sauce, sugar, oil, and spices. Cover
  and chill for several hours.  Broil on both sides.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Fresh Blender Lemonade
 Categories: Beverages
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      2    Lemons; white pith removed
    1/2 c  Water
    1/4 c  Simple syrup*
  1 1/2 c  Crushed ice
 
  Recipe by: Ed Kasky Preparation Time: 0:10 Place 2 lemons, simple
  syrup, and water in a blender with top on and blend at medium speed
  until lemons are liquefied.  Add ice and blend on high until pureed
  (3 to 4 minutes). Serve in a tall glass with a straw and iced tea
  spoon and garnish with a lemon wheel.

      Title: Garlic & Rosemary Potatoes
 Categories: Vegetables, Side dish
      Yield: 5 servings
 
      2 lb Red potatoes; cut in half
      1 tb Rosemary
      1 ts Salt
      2    Cl Garlic; chopped
 
  Recipe by: Anita A. Matejka Preparation Time: 0:15 Preheat oven at
  400. Spray a baking pan with cooking spray.  Sprinkle potatoes with
  rosemary, salt, and garlic.  Mix well.  Bake for 20 to 30 minutes.
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Garlic Potato Skins
 Categories: Snacks
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      2 lg Potatoes
      2 ts Olive oil
    1/4 ts Basil
    1/8 ts Garlic powder
      2 ts Parmesan cheese
 
  Recipe by: Quick, Healthy, And Delicious Cooking Preparation Time:
  0:15 Preheat oven at 425.  One day ahead, prick potatoes with fork.
  Bake for 40 to 50 minutes or until tender.  Cool.  Wrap and store in
  refrigerator. At serving time, cut baking potatoes into quarters.
  Scoop out insides (reserve for another use), leaving 1/2" thick
  shells.  Lightly brush both sides of potato skins with olive oil.
  Place cut side up, on a baking sheet.  Bake for 15 minutes or until
  crisp.  Meanwhile, in a bowl, combine basil and garlic powder.  Spoon
  some of the mixture into each potato quarters.  Sprinkle with cheese.
  Bake for 2 to 3 minutes more or until heated through.
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Glazed Meatloaf
 Categories: Poultry, Vegetables
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      1 lb Turkey; cooked
    1/2 c  Cracker crumbs or bread crum
      1 c  Rice; cooked
    1/2 c  Onion; chopped
    1/4 c  Carrot; grated
    1/4 c  Celery; chopped fine
  1 1/2 ts Mustard; prepared or dijon
      1 ts Garlic powder
    1/8 ts White pepper
    1/4 c  Tomato sauce
      2    Egg whites
    1/2 c  Ketchup
    1/4 c  Honey
 
  Recipe by: Cooking without Fat Preparation Time: 0:20 Preheat oven at
  350. Prepare a loaf pan with cooking.  Combine all ingredients except
  ketchup and honey and mix well.  Turn mixture into a prepared pan and
  bake for 40 minutes.  Combine ketchup and honey.  Spread evenly over
  meat and bake 5 minutes longer.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Grilled Fillets
 Categories: Fish/seafoo
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      2 tb Balsamic vinegar
      2 tb Lemon juice; at room tempera
      1 tb Olive oil
      4    Cl Garlic; crushed
      1 tb Ginger
    1/8 ts White pepper
      4    5 oz fish fillets
 
  Recipe by: Weight Watchers Homestyle Recipes Preparation Time: 0:20
  In a shallow glass casserole dish, combine vinegar, lemon juice, oil,
  garlic, ginger, and pepper.  Add fillets; turn to coat with marinade.
  Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours, turning occasionally.  Spray
  grill with cooking spray.  Preheat grill.  Drain and discard any
  remaining marinade. Grill fillets 4 minutes on each side, until
  cooked through.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Ground Turkey Dish
 Categories: Poultry
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      1 lb Turkey; ground
    1/2 c  Onions; chopped
      1 tb Chili powder
    1/2 ts Salt
      1 cn Stewed tomatoes; (16 oz)
      1 cn Kidney beans; (15 oz)
    3/4 c  Rice; uncooked
    3/4 c  Water
    1/2 c  Bell peppers; chopped
      1 c  Cheddar cheese; shredded
 
  Recipe by: Anita A. Matejka Preparation Time: 0:20 In a skillet cook
  onion and peppers until tender.  Add meat until no pink remains. Add
  chili powder and salt.  Stir in tomatoes, beans, rice, and water.
  Cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes.  Serve with
  cheese on top.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Halibut with Braised Vegetables
 Categories: Fish/seafoo
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      2 c  Onions; chopped
    1/2 c  Tomato juice
    1/2 c  Apple juice
      2    Cl Garlic; chopped fine
      1 c  Bell peppers-- chopped
      1 c  Corn; frozen
      2 tb Lemon juice; at room tempera
      1 tb Mustard; prepared
    1/4 ts Salt
    1/4 ts Black pepper
  1 1/2 lb Fish fillets
 
  Recipe by: Betty Crocker's New Choices Cookbook Preparation Time: 0:15
  Preheat oven at broil.  Prepare a broiler pan rack lined with foil
  with cooking spray. Prepare a loaf pan l with cooking spray.  Heat
  onions, tomato juice, apple juice, and garlic to boiling in 2 quart
  saucepan; reduce heat to medium.  Cook uncovered about 10 minutes,
  stirring occasionally, until most of the liquid has evaporated.  Stir
  in remaining ingredients except fillets.  Cook uncovered 6 to 8
  minutes or until corn is tender.  Cover and remove from heat.  Place
  fillets on rack in broiler pan. Broil with tops about 4" from heat
  about 10 minutes or until fillets flake easily with fork.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Handmade Shake And Bake Chicken
 Categories: Poultry
      Yield: 4 servings
 
    1/2 c  Unbleached flour
      1 ts Paprika
    1/2 ts Salt
    1/2 ts Garlic powder
    1/2 ts Thyme
    1/4 ts Black pepper
      4    Skinless boneless chicken br
    1/2 c  Skim milk; at room temperatu
 
  Recipe by: 365 Ways To Cook Chicken Preparation Time: 0:20 Preheat
  oven at 375.  Prepare pan with foil, sprayed with cooking spray.
  Combine flour, paprika, salt, garlic powder, thyme, and pepper in a
  plastic bag. Dip breasts in milk; shake off excess.  Add to bag and
  shake to coat evenly. Place chicken on a prepared baking dish.  Bake
  40 minutes, until chicken is tender and coating crisp.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Hawaiian Popcorn Bars
 Categories: Snacks
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      1 c  Coconut; flaked
      1 c  Granulated sugar
      1 c  Corn syrup
    1/2 c  Margarine; melted
    1/4 c  Water
      1 ts Vanilla
      2 qt Popcorn; popped
    1/4 c  Pineapple; candied
 
  Recipe by: I Love Popcorn Preparation Time: 0:20 Preheat oven at 350.
  Spread coconut in a large baking pan and toast for 8 to 10 minutes in
  oven. Stir it 3 or 4 times so it toasts evenly.  To make syrup,
  combine sugar, salt, corn syrup, margarine, and water in a 2 quart
  saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring until the sugar
  dissolves. Continue to boil gently until the mixture reaches 270 on a
  candy thermometer. Remove from heat and stir vanilla.  Pour the syrup
  over warm popped corn, coconut and pineapple, and stir with a spoon
  until all kernels are coated. Shape like chocolate bars.
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Homemade Potato Chips
 Categories: Snacks, Potatoes
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      2 md Potatoes; sliced 1/16" thick
      1 tb Parmesan cheese; grated
      1 ts Paprika
 
  Recipe by: Reader's Digest Live Longer Cookbook Preparation Time: 0:15
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a baking sheet with cooking spray.
  Arrange potato slices in 1 layer on baking sheet and bake, turning
  occasionally, for 45 minutes or until golden brown.  In a small bowl,
  combine cheese and paprika and sprinkle mixture over the potatoes.
  Bake 5 minutes more, let cool, and transfer to a serving dish.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Honey Apple Waffles
 Categories: Breakfast, Pcake/waffl
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      2 c  Unbleached flour
      2 ts Baking powder
  1 1/2 ts Baking soda
      1 ts Cinnamon
    1/4 ts Salt
  1 1/3 c  Buttermilk*; at room tempera
  1 1/3 c  Apple juice; at room tempera
      1 tb Honey
      4    Egg whites; whipped
 
  Recipe by: 500 Fat-Free Recipes Preparation Time: 0:20 Prepare waffle
  iron with cooking spray and heat up.  In a mixing bowl, combine
  flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.  In another
  mixing bowl, combine buttermilk, apple sauce, honey, and egg whites.
  Add dry ingredients with wet ingredients just until moistened.  Pour
  enough batter to fill two-thirds of the waffle iron.  Cook until
  crisp and golden brown. Set aside.  Repeat with remaining batter.

      Title: Hot Holiday Punch
 Categories: Beverages
      Yield: 20 servings
 
      3 c  Apple juice
      3 c  Orange juice
      6 c  Cranberry juice cocktail
    3/4 c  Maple syrup
      2 ts Powdered sugar
  1 1/2 ts Cinnamon
    3/4 ts Cloves
    3/4 ts Nutmeg
           Cinnamon sticks
 
  Recipe by: Jo Anne Merrill Preparation Time: 0:15 Cinnamon sticks are
  optional but make a very pretty addition as stirrers in steaming hot
  mugs of punch.  Combine all the ingredients in a very large heavy
  pan, except the cinnamon sticks.  Bring to a boil and turn to simmer
  for few minutes. You can put the ingredients in a crockpot after it
  has boiled and keep warm over low heat.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Italian Chicken and Rice
 Categories: Poultry, Pasta/rice
      Yield: 4 servings
 
  1 1/2 c  Water
      1 c  Rice; uncooked
      1    14 oz can tomatoes; broken/u
    1/2 lb Cheddar cheese; shredded
    1/2 c  Onion; chopped
    1/4 ts Garlic powder
      2 ts Italian seasoning; divided
      4    Skinless boneless chicken br
    2/3 c  Parmesan cheese; grated
 
  Recipe by: Art Ginsburg Preparation Time: 0:15 Preheat oven at 375.
  Prepare a 9x13 baking pan with cooking spray.  Mix water, rice,
  tomatoes, cheese, onion, garlic powder, and 1 teaspoon Italian
  seasoning. Top the mixture with the chicken and sprinkle with
  Parmesan cheese and remaining Italian seasoning.  Bake for 50 to 60
  minutes or until the chicken is fork tender and no pink remains.
  Remove from the oven and let stand for 5 to 10 minutes before serving.

      Title: Italian Popcorn
 Categories: Snacks
      Yield: 10 servings
 
      1 qt Popcorn; popped
      1 ts Italian seasoning
    1/8 ts Cayenne; or to taste
      1 tb Parmesan cheese; grated
 
  Recipe by: The Joslin Diabetes Gourmet Cookbook Preparation Time: 0:15
  Preheat oven at 400.  Prepare cookie sheet with cooking spray.  Place
  popped popcorn on a prepared baking sheet.  Toss combination of
  seasonings for the flavor.  Bake for 10 minutes, tossing once.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Layered Tosada Bake
 Categories: Poultry, Tex/mexican, Casseroles
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      1 lb Turkey; ground/cooked
      1 md Onion; chopped
      1 pk Taco seasoning mix
      1 cn Tomato sauce; (8 oz)
      1 cn Fat-free refried beans; (16
      1 c  Baking mix
    1/2 c  Cornmeal
    1/4 c  Skim milk; at room temperatu
      1    Egg white
      2 tb Olive oil
      1 c  Fat-free sour cream
      1    Egg whites
      2 c  Cheddar cheese; shredded
 
  Recipe by: Betty Crocker's Mexican Made Easy Preparation Time: 0:15
  Preheat oven at 375.  Prepare a 12 x 7 x 2" baking dish, with lightly
  cooking spray.  Cook and stir turkey and onion in a skillet until
  meat is brown. Stir in seasoning mix, tomato sauce and beans.  In a
  mixing bowl, combine baking mix, cornmeal, milk, egg white, and oil
  until moistened. Spread in dish.  Spoon meat mixture over dough.  Mix
  remaining ingredients; spoon over meat mixture.  Bake uncovered 30
  minutes.  Let stand 10 minutes before cutting.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Left Over Turkey Enchiladas
 Categories: Vegetables, Tex/mexican, Poultry
      Yield: 10 servings
 
    1/4 c  Olive oil
    1/2 c  Onions; chopped
    1/2 c  Bell peppers
    1/4 c  Olive oil
      2 c  Turkey; cooked/chopped
      2 c  Corn; frozen
      1 cn Enchilada sauce; (15 oz) und
      3 ts Chili powder
      1 ts Salt
    1/2 c  Regular cheddar cheese; shre
    1/2 c  Fat-free cheddar cheese
     10    Tortillas
 
  Recipe by: Anita A. Matejka Preparation Time: 0:20 Preheat oven at
  350. In a large saucepan, cook onions and bell peppers in oil until
  tender. Stir in turkey, corn, enchilada sauce, chili powder, and salt
  until cooked through. Spread about 1/4 filling and fat-free cheese on
  each tortilla, roll up and place seam side down on a baking sheet
  lined with foil. Sprinkle with remaining cheese.  Bake for 30 minutes.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Lemon Barbecued Chicken
 Categories: Poultry, Bbq/grill
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      2    Skinless boneless chicken br
      1 c  Olive oil
    1/2 c  Lemon juice at room temperat
      1 ts Salt
      1 ts Paprika
      2 ts Onion powder
    1/2 ts Thyme
    1/2 ts Garlic powder
 
  Recipe by: Elizabeth Powell Preparation Time: 0:15 Cut chicken into
  serving pieces and place in shallow dish.  Combine all other
  ingredients and pour over chicken.  Cover dish with foil; refrigerate
  overnight. Remove to room temperature 1 hour before cooking. Place
  chicken on hot grill 25 minutes; then turn and cook 25 minutes more.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Lemon Chicken Pasta
 Categories: Poultry, Pasta/rice
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      2    Cl Garlic; minced
      6 oz Boneless skinless chicken br
    1/2 c  Green peas; frozen/thawed
    1/3 c  Carrot; shredded
    1/2 c  Chicken broth
      2 tb Fat-free cream cheese
      2 c  Pasta
      3 tb Parmesan cheese; grated
    1/2 ts Lemon peel; grated
    1/8 ts Salt
    1/8 ts Black pepper
 
  Recipe by: Cooking Light Magazine Preparation Time: 0:15 Prepare a
  skillet with cooking spray.  Place over medium-high heat until hot.
  Add garlic, chicken,  peas, and carrot; sauté until tender.  Remove
  from skillet; set aside. Add broth and cream cheese to skillet; cook
  over medium-high heat 3 minutes or until cheese melts, stirring
  constantly with a whisk.  Stir in chicken mixture, pasta, Parmesan
  cheese, lemon peel, salt, and pepper; cook 1 minute.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Lemon Dill Chicken
 Categories: Poultry
      Yield: 6 servings
 
    1/2 c  Onion; chopped
    1/2 c  Chicken broth
    1/4 c  Lemon juice
      2 ts Dill weed
    1/4 ts Salt
    1/4 ts Black pepper
      2    Cl Garlic; chopped fine
      6    Skinless boneless chicken br
 
  Recipe by: Betty Crocker's New Choice Cookbook Preparation Time: 0:15
  Mix all ingredients except chicken breasts in glass dish.  Add
  chicken; turn to coat with marinade.  Cover and refrigerate at least
  3 hours but no longer than 24 hours.  Preheat oven control at broil.
  Prepare broiler pan with cooking spray.  Remove chicken from
  marinade; reserve marinade. Place chicken in pan.  Broil chicken with
  tops 5 to 7 " from heat 7 minutes; turn.  Brush with marinade.  Broil
  about 7 minutes longer or until juices run clear.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Lemony Ginger Chicken
 Categories: Poultry
      Yield: 2 servings
 
      2    Boneless skinless chicken
           -breasts
      1    Garlic        clove; minced
    1/2 ts Ginger
      2 tb Unbleached flour
    1/4 ts Ginger
    1/8 ts Salt
    1/8 ts Black pepper
      1 ts Olive oil
      1 tb Water
      1 ts Brown sugar
      2    Lemon; slices
 
  Recipe by: No Red Meat Preparation Time: 0:15 Preheat oven at 350.
  Prepare a baking pan lined with foil with cooking spray. Combine
  lemon juice, garlic, and 1/2 teaspoon ginger in a small bowl; pour
  over chicken. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour.  Remove chicken
  from marinade and dry with paper towel; reserve marinade. Combine
  flour, 1/4 teaspoon ginger, salt, and pepper in a plastic bag.  Put
  chicken in flour mixture; shake gently to coat.  Heat oil in a
  skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken in oil until brown on both
  sides.  Place chicken on prepared baking pan. Combine 2 tablespoons
  reserved marinade and 1 tablespoon water; pour over chicken. Spoon
  brown sugar on top of chicken pieces; place a lemon slice on top of
  sugar.  Bake, uncovered for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until tender.
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Little Italy Pepperoni Mushroom Pizza Loaf
 Categories: Meats
      Yield: 8 servings
 
    1/4 c  Olive oil
      2 c  Onions; chopped fine
      4    Cl Garlic       ; minced
      1 tb Oregano
    1/2 ts Cayenne
      1    8 oz pkg mushrooms; coarsely
           -chopped
      2 ts Salt
      1 c  Ketchup
  2 1/2 lb Turkey; ground
      3    Egg whites
    1/2 c  Bread crumbs
      1 ts Black pepper
    1/2 lb Mozzarella cheese; cut into
           -cubes
      1    3 oz pkg pepperoni; sliced
 
  Recipe by: Fifty Two Meat Loaves Preparation Time: 0:15 Preheat oven
  at 350.  Prepare a loaf pan or muffin tins with cooking spray and
  flour. In a large skillet, warm oil over medium heat.  Add onions,
  garlic, oregano and cayenne, cover and cook, stirring once or twice,
  for 10 minutes. Add mushrooms and 1 teaspoon of the salt, raise the
  heat to medium-high and cook uncovered, tossing and stirring the
  mushrooms often, until they render their juices and are tender, about
  10 minutes.  Stir in 1/2 cup of ketchup, remove from heat and cool to
  room temperature. Position a rack in the middle of the oven.  In a
  mixing bowl, combine the turkey, mushroom mixture, egg whites, bread
  crumbs, remaining 1 teaspoon salt, and black pepper and mix
  thoroughly.  Add the cubes of mozzarella and mix until evenly
  distributed.  Transfer the meat mixture to a shallow baking dish and
  shape it into a flat loaf about 2 1/2" thick.  Smooth the top of the
  loaf or muffin tins with the back of a spoon.  Spread the remaining
  1/2 cup pizza sauce evenly over the loaf.  Lay pepperoni slices
  evenly over the sauce, overlapping them if necessary and using them
  all. Bake for about 1 1/4 hours, pouring off accumulated pan juices
  as necessary. Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing.
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Low Fat Sausage
 Categories: Poultry, Breakfast
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      1 lb Turkey; ground/cooked
  2 1/2 ts Sage
    1/2 ts Salt
    1/4 ts Black pepper
    1/2 ts Marjoram
    1/8 ts Thyme; flakes
    1/4 ts Allspice
    1/4 ts Nutmeg
    1/4 ts Mustard
    1/8 ts Cayenne
    1/8 ts Garlic powder
      1 c  Water cold
 
  Recipe by: Rosemary Matejka Preparation Time: 0:15 Mix spices in water
  first.  Then add turkey. Mix batter with hands until thoroughly
  blended. Cook and freeze in smaller portions.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Lower Fat Meat Loaf
 Categories: Poultry, Main dish
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      1 c  Zucchini; grated
      2 ts Salt
  1 1/2 c  Onions; chopped fine
    1/2 c  Egg white
    1/2 c  Ketchup
  1 1/2 tb Worcestershire sauce
      1 tb Mustard; prepared
      3    Cl Garlic; crushed
    1/2 ts Black pepper
    1/2 ts Thyme
    1/2 ts Oregano
      2 lb Turkey; ground
    1/2 c  Bread crumbs
 
  Recipe by: Fifty Two Meat Loaves Preparation Time: 0:15 Preheat oven
  at 350.  Prepare a loaf pan or muffin tins with cooking and flour. In
  a strainer set over a bowl, combine zucchini and 1 teaspoon salt and
  let stand, stirring once or twice, for 30 minutes.  With your hands
  squeeze as much liquid out of the zucchini as possible.  In a mixing
  bowl, stir onions, zucchini, egg white, ketchup, Worcestershire
  sauce, mustard, garlic, remaining 1 teaspoon salt, pepper, thyme, and
  oregano. Add meat and bread crumbs and mix thoroughly to blend well.
  Transfer meat mixture to loaf pan and pack it firmly into a loaf.
  Smooth top with the back of a spoon.  Bake meat loaf for about 1 hour
  depending on pan size. Let meat loaf rest on a rack for 10 minutes
  before slicing.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Mac and Turkey Soup
 Categories: Poultry, Pasta/rice, Soup/stew
      Yield: 8 servings
 
    1/2 lb Turkey; ground/cooked
    1/2 c  Onion; chopped
    1/2 c  Bell pepper; chopped
    1/2 ts Basil
    1/2 ts Oregano
      3 cn Tomato soup
      3 c  Water
      2 c  Elbow macaroni; cooked
      2 ts Lemon juice; at room tempera
 
  Recipe by: Campbell's Preparation Time: 0:15 Spray saucepan with
  cooking spray.  Heat over medium-high heat 1 minute. Add beef, onion,
  pepper, basil, and oregano; cook until turkey is browned and
  vegetables are tender, stirring to separate meat.  Stir in soup,
  water, macaroni, and lemon juice. Heat through, stirring occasionally.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Meal  Casserole
 Categories: Casseroles
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      1 lb Ground turkey; cooked/draine
      1 c  Onions; chopped
      1    28 oz can tomatoes; chopped
      1 tb Worcestershire sauce
      1 ts Salt
      2 c  Potatoes; diced
    1/3 c  Flour
      1    10 oz pkg corn; frozen/thawe
      1    10 oz pkg lima beans; frozen
      1 lg Green pepper; cut in strips
  1 1/2 c  Cheddar cheese; shredded
 
  Recipe by: Jo Anne Merrill Preparation Time: 1:20 Preheat oven at 375.
  Prepare a 3-quart casserole dish with cooking spray and flour. In a
  bowl, combine browned and drained turkey, onion, and tomatoes with
  liquid, Worcestershire sauce and salt.  Spoon into casserole dish.
  Layer the potatoes, flour, corn, lima beans and green pepper on top.
  Cover and bake for 45 minutes.  Sprinkle with the cheese and continue
  baking, uncovered, for 30 minutes longer.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Meatloaf with Sun Dried Tomatoes
 Categories: Poultry, Tomatoes
      Yield: 8 servings
 
    1/4 c  Olive oil
  1 1/2 c  Onions; chopped fine
    1/2 c  Celery; chopped
      3    Garlic        cloves; minced
      1 ts Basil
      1 ts Oregano
      1 ts Thyme
  2 1/2 lb Turkey; ground
    1/2 c  Stewed tomatoes
    1/2 c  Parsley
      2    Egg whites
    1/2 c  Bread crumbs
  1 1/2 ts Salt
  1 1/2 ts Black pepper
 
  Recipe by: Fifty Two Meat Loaves Preparation Time: 0:15 Preheat oven
  at 350.  Prepare a loaf pan or muffin tins with cooking spray and
  flour. In a skillet, warm olive oil over medium heat.  Add onions,
  celery, garlic, basil, oregano, and thyme, cover and cook, stirring
  once or twice, for 10 minutes.  Remove from heat and cool to room
  temperature. Position a rack in the middle of the oven.  In a large
  bowl, mix together turkey, onion mixture, tomatoes, parsley, egg
  whites, crumbs, salt, and pepper. Transfer meat mixture to a shallow
  baking dish and shape it into a flat loaf or muffin tins;  smooth the
  top of the loaf with the back of a spoon. Bake about 1 1/2 hours
  depending on pan size.  Let rest on a rack for 10 minutes before
  slicing.

      Title: Mexican Fish Bake
 Categories: Fish/seafoo
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      1 c  Tortilla chips; crushed
      2 c  Rice; cooked
      1 c  Kidney beans; drained
  1 1/2 lb Fillets; cut into 1" strips
      1 c  Salsa
    1/2 c  Monterey jack cheese; shredd
    1/2 c  Onions; chopped
      3 oz Tortilla chips; for serving
 
  Recipe by: The Health Lover's Guide To Super Seafood Preparation
  Time: 0:15 Preheat oven at 400.  Prepare a 2 quart casserole dish
  with cooking spray.
   Using half the ingredients at a time, make alternate layers of
  crushed tortilla chips, rice, beans, fish strips, salsa, cheese, and
  onion.  Bake for 25 to 30 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Nacho Loaf
 Categories: Meats
      Yield: 6 servings
 
MMMMM----------------------------LOAF---------------------------------
      2 lb Turkey; ground
    1/2 c  Fat-free sour cream
      1 c  Cheddar cheese; shredded
    1/2 c  Onion; diced
    1/2 c  Taco sauce
    1/2 c  Cornmeal*
      1 pk Taco seasoning mix

MMMMM------------------------CHEESE SAUCE-----------------------------
      1 tb Margarine
      2 tb Unbleached flour
      1 c  Skim milk; at room temperatu
      1 c  Cheddar cheese; shredded
    1/8 ts Salt
 
  Recipe by: The Great American Meatloaf Contest Cookbook Preparation
  Time: 0:15 Preheat oven at 350. Prepare a 9" loaf pan with cooking
  spray and flour. In a mixing bowl, combine all loaf ingredients and
  mix well. Press meat mixture into prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour.
  Remove from the oven and drain off any liquid.  While loaf is baking,
  in a small saucepan melt margarine.  Add flour and blend well. Cook 1
  minute, stirring constantly. Add milk all at once, mixing well.  Keep
  stirring until the mixture starts to boil and thicken.  Remove from
  heat and add cheese all at once.  Stir until cheese is melted and
  then salt as needed.  Serve sauce over nacho loaf.
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Oatmeal Raisin Pancakes
 Categories: Breakfast, Pcake/waffl
      Yield: 6 servings
 
  1 1/2 c  Rolled oats
    1/2 c  Wheat flour
      1 tb Baking powder
      2 tb Cinnamon
      1 ts Nutmeg
      1    Egg white; whipped
    1/2 c  Bananas; mashed
      1 tb Applesauce
  1 1/2 c  Skim milk; at room temperatu
    1/2 c  Raisins
 
  Recipe by: Anita A. Matejka Preparation Time: 0:15 Prepare skillet
  with cooking spray and heat on medium until hot.  In a mixing bowl,
  combine oatmeal, flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and nutmeg. In
  another mixing bowl, combine egg white, banana, applesauce, and milk.
  Mix dry ingredients with wet ingredients just until moistened .
  Ladle in the batter, using 2 or more tablespoons per cake.  Cook for
  2 minutes, then flip carefully and cook for 2 minutes more.  Repeat
  with remaining batter.

      1 c  Skim milk
    1/2 c  Orange juice
    1/2 ts Vanilla
 
  Recipe by: Anita A. Matejka Preparation Time: 0:05 Mix ingredients for
  either shake in blender and serve.  Milk shake number 1 serves 1 and
  milk shake number 2 serves 2.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Parmesan Basil Perch
 Categories: Fish/seafoo
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      1 lb Fish fillets
      2 tb Bread crumbs
      1 tb Parmesan cheese; grated
      1 tb Basil
    1/2 ts Paprika
    1/8 ts Black pepper
      1 tb Egg white
      2 tb Parsley
 
  Recipe by: Betty Crocker's New Choice Cookbook Preparation Time: 0:15
  Preheat oven at 500.  Prepare a loaf pan lined with foil with cooking
  spray.  Move rack to position slightly above middle of oven.  Mix
  remaining ingredients except egg white and parsley.  Brush one side
  of fillet with egg white; dip into bread crumb mixture.  Place
  fillets, coated sides up, in pan.  Bake uncovered for 10 minutes or
  until fillets flake easily with fork.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Pasta Vegetable Soup
 Categories: Vegetables, Pasta/rice, Soup/stew
      Yield: 10 servings
 
      6 c  Water; divided
      1 c  Onion; chopped
      1 c  Carrot; sliced
      1 c  Celery; sliced
      1 tb Brown sugar; packed
    1/2 ts Basil
    1/2 ts Marjoram
    1/2 ts Oregano
    1/2 ts Thyme
    1/2 ts Black pepper
      3    Cl Garlic; crushed
      3    10 1/2 cans chicken broth
      1    28 oz can whole tomatoes;
           -undrained
      1    9 oz pkg green beans; frozen
           -thawed
      1    6 oz can tomato paste
      1 c  Macaroni; uncooked
      1 c  Parmesan cheese
 
  Recipe by: Cooking Light Magazine Preparation Time: 1:00
  
   In a large sauce pan, combine 4 cups water, onion, carrot, celery,
  brown sugar, basil, marjoram, oregano, thyme, pepper, garlic, chicken
  broth, tomatoes, beans, and tomato paste then bring to a boil.
  Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 45 minutes.  Add remaining 2 cups
  water; bring to a boil.
  
   Stir in macaroni, and cook an additional 8 minutes.  Ladle into soup
  bowls; top with Parmesan cheese.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Pinto Bean Tacos
 Categories: Vegetables
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      4    Taco shells
      1    15 oz can pinto beans; rinse
    1/2 c  Tomato sauce
    1/2 c  Bell peppers; chopped
    1/2 c  Onion; chopped
    1/2 pk Taco seasoning mix
      1 ts Chili powder
    1/4 ts Oregano
    1/4 ts Cumin
    1/2 c  Cheddar cheese; shredded
 
  Recipe by: Quick, Healthy, And Delicious Cooking Preparation Time:
  0:15 Heat taco shells according to package directions.  Meanwhile, in
  a saucepan combine pinto beans, tomato sauce, peppers, onions, taco
  seasoning mix, chili powder, oregano, and cumin.  Bring to a boiling.
  Reduce heat; simmer occasionally.  Mash beans slightly.  Spoon
  mixture into taco shells. Top with cheese.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Pork Tacos
 Categories: Tex/mexican, Meats
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      1 cn Stewed tomatoes; (16 oz)
      1 cn Tomato sauce; (8 oz)
    1/2 c  Bell peppers; chopped
      1    Cl Garlic; chopped
      1 ts Sugar
      2 c  Pork; chopped/cooked
    3/4 c  Cheddar cheese; shredded
    1/2 c  Onions; chopped
    1/4 ts Salt
      1 tb Olive oil
     12    Taco shells
    3/4 c  Cheddar cheese; shredded
 
  Recipe by: Complete Guide To Food And Cooking Preparation Time: 0:20
  Preheat oven or toaster oven at 300.  Place taco shells in oven to
  heat watch carefully could brown quickly .  In a skillet, heat oil.
  Add undrained tomatoes, tomato sauce, bell peppers, garlic, onion,
  and sugar until softened.  Then, combine pork, 3/4 cup cheese and
  salt.  Spoon about 1/4 cup mixture into each taco shell.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Potato Loaf
 Categories: Potatoes, Vegetables
      Yield: 8 servings
 
    3/4 c  Fat-free cottage cheese
  2 1/2 c  Mushrooms; coarsely chopped
    1/2 c  Parmesan cheese; grated
    3/4 c  Onions; sliced thin
      3    Egg whites; at room temperat
    1/3 c  Bread crumbs
    1/2 ts Marjoram
    1/4 ts Salt
    1/4 ts Black pepper
      6 md Potatoes; peeled/ shredded
 
  Recipe by: Reader's Digest Live Longer Cookbook Preparation Time: 0:15
  Preheat oven at 400.  Prepare a loaf pan cooking spray.  In a blender,
  puree cottage cheese for 1 minute or until smooth.  In a mixing bowl,
  combine pureed cottage cheese, mushrooms, Parmesan cheese, onions, egg
  whites, bread crumbs, marjoram, salt, and pepper.  Fold in potatoes.
  Transfer mixture to prepared pan(s).  Bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes
  or until firm.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Potatoes Romanoff
 Categories: Vegetables, Side dish, Potatoes
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      4    Potatoes; quartered
      2 tb Margarine
      1 c  Fat-free sour cream
      1 md Onion; sliced
  1 1/4 c  Cheddar cheese; shredded
      1 ts Salt
    1/8 ts Black pepper
    1/4 ts Paprika
 
  Recipe by: Elizabeth Powell Preparation Time: 1:30 Preheat oven at
  350. Prepare a 1 1/2 quart baking dish with cooking spray. Boil
  potatoes until tender.  Mash with margarine, sour cream, onions, 3/4
  cup cheese, salt and pepper.  Turn mixture into baking dish. Sprinkle
  with remaining cheese and paprika.  Bake uncovered, for 40 minutes.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Red and Black Beans
 Categories: Vegetables
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      1 c  Black beans; soaked overnigh
      1 c  Red beans; soaked overnight
      6 c  Vegetable broth; or water
      2 c  Tomatoes; diced
      1 lg Onion; chopped
      1 c  Corn; frozen
      1 c  Green bell pepper; diced
    1/2 c  Red bell pepper; diced
      1 tb Garlic; minced
      2 ts Ground cumin
    1/8 ts Red pepper flakes
           Black pepper
           Salt
     12    Corn tortillas
 
  Recipe by: Stephanie da Silva Preparation Time: 0:15 Preheat oven at
  350. In a large saucepan, combine the soaked beans and vegetable
  stock. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer, covered, for 45
  minutes or until the beans are tender.  Add the tomatoes, onion,
  corn, green pepper, red pepper, garlic, cumin and chili flakes.
  Simmer for 15 minutes. Season to taste with pepper and salt.  Steam
  the corn tortillas (the microwave works fine for this) until soft
  enough to roll without breaking. Using a slotted spoon, fill each
  tortilla with a generous 1/2 cup of beans. Roll and place seam side
  down, in a nonstick baking dish. Pour the beans and their sauce over
  the stuffed tortillas and bake for 15 minutes, or until bubbling hot.
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Savory Mushroom Hamburgers
 Categories: Poultry
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      2 tb Olive oil
      1 ts Worcestershire sauce
    1/4 ts Lemon juice
      1    Cl Garlic; minced
      1 sm Onion; sliced
      1 c  Mushrooms; sliced
      1 lb Turkey; ground/cooked
    1/2 ts Salt
    1/4 ts Black pepper
 
  Recipe by: Betty Crocker, Best Recipes For Ground Turkey Preparation
  Time: 0:20 Heat oil in a large skillet. Add Worcestershire sauce,
  lemon juice, garlic, onion, and mushrooms; cook and stir over medium
  heat 2 minutes. Remove from heat.  Mix meat, salt, and pepper.  Shape
  mixture into 4 patties, about 3/4" thick.  Push mushroom-onion
  mixture to side of skillet. Cook patties in same skillet over
  medium-high heat, about 10 minutes, turning once, to desired
  doneness.  Serve mushroom-onion mixture over patties.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Shells With Broccoli
 Categories: Pasta/rice, Vegetables
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      2 ts Olive oil
      2    Cl Garlic; crushed
    1/2 ts Basil
    1/2 ts Oregano
  1 1/2 ts Salt
    1/4 ts Red pepper; crushed
      1 lb Shell pasta shape
      1    Broccoli; cut into florets
    1/4 lb Pepperoni; diced
      2 tb Parmesan cheese
 
  Recipe by: Art Ginsburg Preparation Time: 0:15 In a skillet, heat
  olive oil over low heat until warm; stir in garlic, basil oregano,
  salt, and red pepper; cook, stirring, until garlic is soft, about 5
  minutes (do not let garlic brown).  Meanwhile, in a pot of boiling
  water, cook pasta and broccoli until tender. Drain pasta and
  broccoli, reserving 1/2 cup of the cooking water. Place pasta in a
  large bowl. Toss with garlic mixture, reserved cooking water, and
  pepperoni.  Sprinkle with cheese.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Skillet Chicken with Couscous
 Categories: Poultry
      Yield: 5 servings
 
      2 tb Olive oil
      4    Skinless boneless chicken br
      1 lg Onion; chopped
      4    Carrots; sliced thin
      3    Celery ribs; sliced
      2    Cl Garlic; minced
      2 c  Water
      1 c  Couscous
      1    15 oz can garbanzo beans; ri
      2 tb Lemon juice
    1/4 tb Black pepper
 
  Recipe by: 365 Ways To Cook Chicken Preparation Time: 0:15 In a large
  skillet, heat oil over high heat, until hot.  Add chicken and cook,
  turning, until browned on both sides, 10 to 12 minutes.  Reduce heat
  to medium-low, cover, and cook chicken 10 minutes.  Remove chicken to
  a dish and drain off fat and liquid from pan.  Add onion, carrots,
  and celery to skillet.  Cook over medium-high heat, stirring, until
  onion is softened, 2 to 3 minutes.  Stir in garlic, water, couscous,
  garbanzo beans, lemon juice, and pepper.  Heat to boiling, then
  reduce heat to medium-low. Place chicken on top of couscous mixture.
  Cover and cook 20 to 25 minutes, or until chicken is very tender and
  cooked through.
 
MMMMM

      Title: Spice Popcorn
 Categories: Snacks
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      2 tb Granulated sugar
    1/8 ts Cinnamon
    1/8 ts Nutmeg
    1/4 ts Margarine; melted
      2 qt Popcorn; popped
 
  Recipe by: I Love Popcorn Preparation Time: 0:15 Preheat oven at 400.
  Prepare baking sheet with cooking spray.  Place popped popcorn on a
  prepared baking sheet.  Toss combination of seasonings for the
  flavor. Bake for 10 minutes, tossing once.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Spiced Rum Cider
 Categories: Beverages
      Yield: 10 servings
 
      4    Cinnamon sticks; broken
      1 ts Allspice; whole
      1 ts Whole cloves
      7 c  Apple juice
    1/3 c  Packed brown sugar
           Margarine; or butter
      1 c  Rum (more or less); optional
 
  Recipe by: Jo Anne Merrill Preparation Time: 4:00 Tie cinnamon,
  allspice, and cloves in spice bag or cheesecloth.  In a crockpot,
  combine spice bag, apple juice, rum and brown sugar.  Cover; cook on
  low-heat setting for 3 to 4 hours.  Discard spice bag. Ladle hot
  punch into cups; float about 1/2 teaspoon of butter on top of the
  cider in each cup.

      Title: Spiced Tea
 Categories: Beverages
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      3 c  Pineapple juice
    1/2 c  Lemon juice
      3 c  Water; cold
    3/4 c  Brown sugar; packed
      3    Cinnamon sticks
      1 ts Cloves
      2 ts Allspice
      4    Tea bags
 
  Recipe by: Elizabeth Powell Preparation Time: 0:35 Bring pineapple
  juice, lemon juice, and water to a boil.  Add sugar and spices and
  simmer 20 minutes.  Remove from heat, add tea bags, cover and steep
  10 minutes. Remove tea bags and strain. Serve hot or iced.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Spicy Fish
 Categories: Fish/seafoo
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      1 ts Olive oil
      4 oz Fish (1 inch thick)
      2 ts Thyme
      1 ts Orange peel; grated
    1/4 ts Salt
    1/4 ts Black pepper
      1    Cl Garlic; crushed
 
  Recipe by: Cooking Light Magazine Preparation Time: 0:20 Preheat oven
  at 400.  Spread oil over the bottom of a shallow baking dish; add
  salmon, turning to coat. In a small mixing bowl, combine thyme,
  orange peel, salt pepper, and garlic.  Rub fish with mixture; cover
  and marinate in refrigerator 1 hour.  Bake 18 minutes or until fish
  flakes easily when tested with a fork.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Spicy Tortellini Stew
 Categories: Vegetables, Soup/stew, Tomatoes, Pasta/rice
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      2 c  Mushrooms; sliced
      1 c  Onions; chopped
      1 tb Olive oil
      1    Cl Garlic; minced
      2 c  Stewed tomatoes; chopped
      1    14 1/2 oz water
      1 cn Tomato sauce; (8 oz)
    1/2 c  Salsa
      2 tb Basil
      1 pk Cheese tortellini; (9 oz) un
 
  Recipe by: Fresh Food Favorites Preparation Time: 0:15 In a skillet,
  combine mushrooms, onions, oil, and garlic.  Cover and simmer until
  mushrooms are tender, stirring once.  Add remaining ingredients except
  tortellini.  Mix well.  Re-cover, for 10 to 15 minutes or until
  mixture is hot and flavors are blended, stirring once.  Add
  tortellini. Re-cover and heat until tortellini are tender, stirring
  once. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Spicy Yogurt Chicken
 Categories: Poultry
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      4    Boneless skinless chicken br
      1 tb Lemon juice
      3    Cl Garlic; crushed
    1/4 ts Cayenne
      1 ts Cornstarch mixed with 2 tsp.
    3/4 c  Fat-free plain yogurt
      2 ts Ginger
      1 ts Cumin
    1/4 ts Paprika
 
  Recipe by: Anita A. Matejka Preparation Time: 0:15 Preheat oven at
  350. Prepare a baking pan lined with foil with cooking spray. Prepare
  marinade by combining yogurt, lemon juice, ginger, garlic, cumin, and
  cayenne in a small bowl.  Place chicken with plastic wrap and
  refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight.  Remove marinade from bowl to
  prepared baking pan, leave coated chicken pieces in pan.  Bake for 5
  minutes covered, rearrange chicken pieces; drain liquid and discard.
  Stir cornstarch mixture into marinade and spread over chicken pieces.
  Sprinkle with paprika. Recover and bake for 30 minutes or until
  tender and juices run clear.
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Spinach Noodle Casserole
 Categories: Pasta/rice, Casseroles
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      1    8 oz pkg broad no-egg noodle
      3 tb Butter
      2 tb Unbleached flour
      1 c  Skim milk; scalded
    1/2 ts Salt
    1/2 ts Paprika
    1/4 ts Black pepper
    1/8 ts Nutmeg
      2    10 oz pkgs frozen spinach; c
    1/2 lb Swiss cheese; shredded
 
  Recipe by: Elizabeth Powell Preparation Time: 0:30 Cook noodles
  according to packaged directions until just tender; drain and rinse.
  In saucepan, melt butter; stir in flour and cook, stirring, one
  minute. Gradually add milk and bring to a boil.  Cook until thick,
  stirring constantly. Add seasonings and spinach. Stir and remove from
  heat. In greased baking dish, arrange half of noodles, and sprinkle
  with half of cheese; spoon spinach mixture over cheese.  Add another
  layer of noodles and sprinkle with rest of cheese.  Cover, and bake
  at 400 degrees for 15 minutes. Remove cover and bake 15 minutes more.
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Stir Fried Broccoli and Carrots
 Categories: Vegetables, Side dish
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      2 ts Ginger
      1    Cl Garlic; chopped fine
  1 1/2 c  Broccoli flowerets; small
      2 md Carrots; sliced thin
      1 sm Onion; sliced
    3/4 c  Chicken broth
    1/4 ts Salt
      1 tb Cornstarch
      1 tb Water; cold
      1 c  Mushrooms; sliced
 
  Recipe by: Anita A. Matejka Preparation Time: 0:15 Prepare a 12"
  skillet with cooking spray; heat until hot.  Add ginger and garlic;
  stir fry about 1 minute or until light brown.  Add broccoli, carrots,
  and onion; stir fry 1 minute.  Stir in broth and salt; stir into
  vegetable mixture. Cook and stir 10 seconds or until thickened.  Add
  water and mushrooms; cook and stir 30 seconds.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Stirred Rice with Spinach
 Categories: Pasta/rice
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      1 tb Olive oil
    1/3 c  Onion; chopped
      1 sm Clove      garlic; minced
      1 c  Rice; uncooked
  1 3/4 c  Water
    1/4 ts Salt
      1 pk Spinach; (10 oz) frozen
    1/4 c  Parmigiano-reggiano cheese -
 
  Recipe by: Rice The Amazing Grain Preparation Time: 1:00 Heat oil
  over low heat in a saucepan.  Add onion and garlic, and cook until
  golden, about 10 minutes.  Stir in the rice and turn the heat to
  medium-low. Cook, stirring constantly, about 2 minutes.  Stir in
  water and salt and heat to simmering. Cook, covered, over low heat
  for 12 minutes. Add spinach and cheese to the saucepan, stirring once
  or twice just to blend. Cover and cook over medium-low heat for 3
  minutes, or until the spinach is wilted. Spoon into a serving dish
  and serve at once.
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Summer Couscous
 Categories: Pasta/rice
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      1 c  Couscous; boiled
  1 1/2 c  Water; boiled
    1/4 c  Carrot; chopped fine
    1/4 c  Green pepper; chopped fine
      2 tb Parsley
      6 tb Olive oil
      2 tb Lemon juice
      1    Cl Garlic; crushed
    1/2 ts Salt
      1 tb Black pepper
 
  Recipe by: Anita A. Matejka Preparation Time: 0:20 Place the couscous
  in a medium bowl; add the boiling water; cover and let stand until
  all the water is absorbed and mixture has cooled slightly, about
  twenty minutes. Add the chopped vegetables.  In a small bowl, whisk
  the oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper.  Add to the salad;
  toss to blend.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Taco Pasta Salad
 Categories: Pasta/rice
      Yield: 8 servings
 
    1/2 lb Elbow macaroni or other past
      1 lb Turkey; ground
    1/2 c  Taco seasoning mix
    3/4 c  Water
    1/2 md Onion; chopped
      1 c  Cheddar cheese; shredded
      1 c  Mozzarella cheese; shredded
    3/4 c  Taco sauce
      1 md Head iceberg lettuce
           Tortilla chips; crushed
 
  Recipe by: Art Ginsburg Preparation Time: 0:30 In a pot of boiling
  water, cook pasta desired doneness; drain, cool, and place in a large
  bowl. In a skillet, over medium heat, brown meat, stirring to break
  up, until no pink remains; drain off the fat, then add the taco
  seasoning mix and 3/4 cup water.  Stir; bring to a boil, then reduce
  heat and simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes.  Add meat mixture, onion,
  and cheddar cheese to the pasta; toss gently.  Add taco sauce and mix
  gently. Serve on a bed of lettuce, topped with crushed tortilla chips.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Tex Mex Ranch Casserole
 Categories: Tex/mexican, Casseroles
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      1 lb Turkey; ground/cooked
      1    10 oz can pinto beans; cooke
      1 ts Garlic powder
    1/2 ts Cumin
    1/2 ts Oregano
    1/4 ts Black pepper
      1 c  Onion; chopped
  1 1/2 c  Squash; diced
  1 1/2 c  Zucchini; diced
    1/2 c  Red pepper
  2 1/4 oz Cheddar cheese; shredded
  2 1/4 oz Mozzarella cheese; shredded
      4    Egg whites
      3 tb Bread crumbs
 
  Recipe by: Weight Watchers Homestyle Recipes Preparation Time: 0:20
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a 13 x 9" pan with cooking spray.  In a
  mixing bowl, combine turkey, beans, garlic powder, cumin, oregano,
  and pepper. Coarsely mash beans with pastry blender; transfer to
  prepared pan. Prepare skillet with oil; add onion.  Cook over
  medium-high heat 2 minutes. Add squash, zucchini, and red pepper;
  cook 3 minutes longer. Spread vegetable mixture over turkey mixture.
  In a small bowl, whisk together cheeses and egg whites; pour over
  casserole.  Sprinkle with bread crumbs. Bake for 30 minutes, or until
  golden brown.
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Tomato Sauce With Herbs
 Categories: Pasta/rice
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      2 tb Olive oil
      2    Cl Garlic; minced
    1/2 c  Bell peppers; chopped
      2 c  Tomatoes; cored/halved/seede
      2 tb Basil
      2 tb Parsley
      2 ts Oregano
      2 ts Marjoram
      1 ts Rosemary
 
  Recipe by: Pasta Light Preparation Time: 0:20 In a skillet, heat oil
  over moderate heat.  Add garlic and peppers until tender. Add
  tomatoes, basil, parsley, oregano, marjoram, and rosemary. Cook just
  until tomatoes' juices thicken, 7 to 10 minutes.  Pour over cooked
  pasta.

      Title: Tortilla Chip Soup
 Categories: Tex/mexican, Soup/stew
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      1 lb Chicken; cooked
      2 c  Stewed tomatoes
    1/2 c  Bell peppers; chopped
    1/2 c  Onion; chopped
      2 c  Chicken broth
      2 tb Lemon juice
    1/2 ts Cumin
    1/4 ts Black pepper
      2 c  Tortilla chips; crushed
      1 c  Monterey jack cheese; shredd
 
  Recipe by: Anita A. Matejka Preparation Time: 0:15 In a large pan
  combine chicken, tomatoes, peppers, onion, broth, lemon juice, and
  black pepper, simmer for 20 minutes  Place chips in individual bowls,
  sprinkle with 1/2 cup cheese, and pour soup mixture over it.  Top

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Tropical Pineapple Banana Shake
 Categories: Beverages
      Yield: 2 servings
 
      1 c  Pineapple; crushed
      1 lg Banana; quartered
      1 c  Buttermilk*; at room tempera
      1 tb Honey
      2 ts Ginger
      1 dr Coconut extract
 
  Recipe by: Reader's Digest Live Longer Cookbook Preparation Time:
  0:05 In a blender, combine pineapple, banana, buttermilk, honey,
  ginger, and coconut extract.  Whirl for 1 minute or until smooth.
  Pour into glasses.

      Title: Turkey Burritos
 Categories: Tex/mexican, Poultry
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      1 lb Turkey; ground/cooked
      8    Corn tortillas
    1/2 c  Onion; chopped
      1    Cl Garlic; chopped
      4 ts Flour
      1 c  Green pepper; chopped
      1 c  Corn; frozen
  1 1/2 c  Mushrooms; sliced
      1 cn Tomato sauce; (8 oz)
      1 cn Tomatoes; (7 1/2 oz) chopped
      1 tb Chili powder
      1 ts Italian seasoning
      1 c  Cheddar cheese; shredded
 
  Recipe by: Anita A. Matejka Preparation Time: 0:15 Preheat oven at
  375. For filling, in a skillet cook turkey, onion, and garlic until
  meat is brown. Drain off fat.  Stir in flour, green pepper, corn,
  mushrooms, tomato sauce, tomatoes, chili powder, and Italian
  seasoning. Cook and stir until thickened,  bubbly, and vegetables are
  tender. Spoon about 1/3 cup of the filling into each tortilla  and
  top each with 2 tablespoons cheese. Bake, uncovered, for 15 to 25
  minutes.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Turkey Tortilla Casserole
 Categories: Tex/mexican, Casseroles, Poultry
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      1 tb Olive oil
      1 md Onion; chopped
      1 lg Green pepper; chopped
    1/4 ts Salt
  1 1/4 c  Mushrooms; sliced
  1 1/4 lb Turkey; ground
      1 tb Cumin
      1 tb Coriander
      1 tb Chili powder
      1 cn Stewed tomatoes; (28 oz)
      3    Cl Garlic; minced
      8    Corn tortillas
      1 c  Monterey jack cheese; shredd
 
  Recipe by: Reader's Digest Live Longer Cookbook Preparation Time: 0:20
  Preheat oven at 400.  Prepare a 13 x 9 x 2" baking pan with cooking
  spray.
   In a skillet, heat 1 1/2 teaspoons oil over moderate heat.  Add
  onion, green pepper, and 1/8 teaspoon of salt and cook, stirring
  occasionally, for 3 minutes or until slightly softened.  Add
  mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, 3 minutes more or until
  all vegetables are tender. Add turkey to the skillet and cook,
  stirring occasionally, for 3 minutes or until no longer pink.  Stir
  in cumin, coriander, chili powder, and remaining 1/8 teaspoon of salt
  and cook the mixture, stirring constantly, for 1 minute. Stir in
  tomatoes and garlic and bring mixture to a simmer. Spread just enough
  turkey mixture to cover the bottom of the prepared baking pan. Cover
  turkey with 4 tortillas, then top with half of the remaining turkey
  mixture; sprinkle with half the cheese,.  Top with remaining
  tortillas, turkey mixture, and cheese.  Bake for 25 minutes or until
  bubbling and lightly browned.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Twice Baked Cheese Potatoes
 Categories: Vegetables, Side dish, Potatoes
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      3 md Potatoes*; baked
      1 c  Beans; of choice
      3 c  Spinach; chopped
      1 c  Fat-free cottage cheese
      1 c  Cheddar cheese; shredded
      1 lg Onion; chopped
    1/2 c  Egg whites; at room temperat
      2 tb Chives
      2 tb Fat-free sour cream
      2 tb Fat-free sour cream
      2 tb Chives
 
  Recipe by: Anita A. Matejka Preparation Time: 0:15 Preheat oven at
  375. Prepare a 13 x 9 x2" pan with cooking spray.  Bake potatoes 1 to
  1/4 hours or until tender.  Cool just until easy to handle. Cut
  potatoes lengthwise into halves; scoop out pulp, leaving thins shells.
   Place potato pulp and beans in blender; cover and blend until
  smooth. Mix potato mixture and remaining ingredients except 2
  tablespoons sour cream and 2 tablespoons chives.  Divide mixture
  among potato shells.  Bake uncovered 15 to 20 minutes or until hot
  and light brown.  Top with sour cream and chives.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Vegetable Cheese Enchiladas
 Categories: Vegetables, Tex/mexican
      Yield: 4 servings
 
MMMMM--------------------------FILLING-------------------------------
      8    Corn tortillas; 6" in diamet
      1 md Zucchini; cut into 1/2" cube
      1 c  Rice; cooked
      2 sm Onions; chopped fine
    1/3 c  Fat-free sour cream
      1 c  Monterey jack cheese; shredd
    1/4 ts Salt
    1/4 ts Black pepper

MMMMM---------------------------SAUCE--------------------------------
      2 ts Olive oil
      1 md Onion; chopped
      2    Cl Garlic; minced
      1 tb Chili powder
      1    14 1/2 can tomatoes; stewed
    1/2 c  Chicken broth
      3 tb Coriander
 
  Recipe by: Reader's Digest Live Longer Cookbook Preparation Time: 0:30
  Preheat oven at 350.  Prepare a 11 x 9 x 2 pan with cooking spray.
  Wrap tortillas in aluminum foil and heat in oven for 7 to 10 minutes
  or until softened.  Meanwhile, in a saucepan of boiling water, blanch
  zucchini for 2 minutes or until just tender.  Drain, rinse under cold
  water to stop the cooking, and pat dry with paper towel.  In a large
  bowl, combine zucchini, rice, onions, sour cream, 1/2 cheese, salt,
  and pepper.  Spoon 1/8 of the filling onto each tortilla and spread
  it down the center.  Roll tortillas to enclose filling and arrange,
  seam side down, in prepared pan.  Cover pan with aluminum foil and
  bake the enchiladas for 10 minutes or until heated through.
  Meanwhile, prepare sauce. In a medium saucepan, heat oil over
  moderate heat.  Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5
  minutes or until softened.  Add garlic and chili power and cook,
  stirring for 1 minute.  Add tomatoes and broth, simmer and stirring
  occasionally, for 10 minutes or until sauce has thickened slightly.
  Stir in coriander. Spoon sauce over enchiladas, sprinkle with
  remaining 1/2 cup cheese, and bake 8 to 10 minutes longer or until
  cheese has melted and the sauce is bubbling.

      Title: Vegetable Pasta Sauce
 Categories: Pasta/rice
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      1 ts Olive oil
      1 md Onion; chopped
      1    Cl Garlic; chopped
      1 c  Bell peppers; chopped
      1 lb Turkey; ground
      1 c  Celery; chopped
      2 c  Zucchini; grated
      1 c  Carrot; grated
      2 cn Tomato sauce; (8 oz)
      1 cn Tomato paste; (6 oz)
      2 c  Water
      1 ts Basil
      1 ts Oregano
 
  Recipe by: Quick & Easy Diabetic Menus Preparation Time: 0:40 In a
  skillet, heat oil over medium heat.  Add onion, garlic and peppers
  until tender. Add meat until no pink remains.  Then add celery,
  zucchini, carrot, tomato sauce, tomato paste, water, basil and
  oregano.  Simmer over medium heat for at least 1 hour to cook
  vegetables.  Serve over cooked pasta.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Wheat Bran Pancakes
 Categories: Breakfast
      Yield: 6 servings
 
    3/4 c  Wheat flour
    3/4 c  Unbleached flour
    3/4 c  Wheat bran; unprocessed
      2 tb Sugar
      1 tb Baking powder
      2 ts Cinnamon
    1/4 ts Salt
      1 ts Vanilla
      2    Egg whites; whipped
  1 1/2 c  Buttermilk*
 
  Recipe by: Anita A. Matejka Preparation Time: 0:15 Prepare skillet
  with cooking spray and heat on medium until hot.  In a mixing bowl,
  combine flours, wheat bran, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt.
  In another mixing bowl, combine vanilla, egg whites, and buttermilk.
  Mix dry ingredients with wet ingredients just until moistened. Ladle
  in the batter, using 2 or more tablespoons per cake. Cook for 2
  minutes, then flip carefully and cook for 2 minutes more. Repeat with
  remaining batter.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: White Beans With Tomato, Basil, And Parmesan
 Categories: Vegetables, Side dish
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      1 tb Olive oil
      3    Cl Garlic
      3 c  Great northern beans
  1 1/2 c  Tomato; chopped
    1/4 c  Basil
    1/2 c  Parmesan cheese
      1 tb Lemon juice
 
  Recipe by: Reader's Digest Live Longer Cookbook Preparation Time:
  0:15 In a skillet, heat oil over low heat.  Add garlic and cook,
  stirring occasionally, for 4 minutes or until lightly colored and
  fragrant.  Stir in the beans, tomato, and basil and cook for 7
  minutes or until heated through and the tomato has released its
  juices.  Stir in cheese and lemon juice.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Yellow Rice with Beans
 Categories: Vegetables
      Yield: 8 servings
 
MMMMM---------------------------BEANS--------------------------------
      1 lb Black beans; or of choice
      1 lg Green pepper; chopped
    1/2 c  Green pepper; chopped
      4    Cl Garlic; minced
      2 tb Olive oil
      2 c  Onions; chopped
    1/2 c  Red pepper; chopped
  1 1/2 ts Cumin; or more to taste
    1/8 ts Black pepper
      3 c  Chicken broth

MMMMM----------------------------RICE---------------------------------
  1 1/4 c  Chicken broth
      1 tb Olive oil
      1 c  Rice; uncooked
      1    Cl Garlic; minced
    1/2 ts Turmeric
    1/4 c  Red pepper; diced
 
  Recipe by: Rice The Amazing Grain Preparation Time: 0:30 To make
  beans, combine 10 cups of water, green pepper, and 1 garlic clove.
   Cook over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until the beans are
  tender enough to crush with a spoon on the side of pan and most of the
  liquid is absorbed, about 2 1/2 hours.  Meanwhile, heat oil in a
  medium skillet over low heat.  Add onions, green pepper, red pepper,
  and remaining garlic cloves.  Cook over medium-low heat, stirring,
  until onions and peppers are golden, about 15 minutes.  Season with
  cumin and black pepper. Stir cooked vegetables into the beans.  Cook
  for 1 to 1 1/2 hours, stirring often and adding as much of the
  chicken broth as needed to keep the beans a thick consistency without
  sticking.  Taste and correct the seasoning. To cook rice, heat 1/4
  cup broth to boiling in a small saucepan. Cover and let stand for 5
  minutes.  Meanwhile, in a saucepan heat oil over low heat. Add rice
  and garlic, and cook, stirring, just until rice is coated and the
  garlic is fragrant, about 2 minutes.  Do not brown. Stir in turmeric,
  remaining broth and broth mixture.  Heat to boiling, stirring once.
  Cook covered, over low heat until broth is absorbed and rice is
  tender, about 12 minutes.  Spoon rice into large serving platter.
  Ladle beans on top.

      Title: Zucchini Meat Loaf
 Categories: Meats
      Yield: 12 servings
 
  1 1/2 c  Zucchini; grated
      1 lb Turkey; ground
      1 md Onion; chopped
    1/2 c  Combined red and green peppe
      2 c  Bread crumbs
      1    Egg white
      1 cn Tomato paste; (6 oz)
      1 tb Parsley
      1 ts Tarragon
      1 tb Basil
    1/2 ts Black pepper
      1 c  Cheddar cheese; grated
 
  Recipe by: Complete Taste Of Life Preparation Time: 0:30 Preheat oven
  at 350.  Prepare loaf pan with cooking spray.  In a mixing bowl,
  combine zucchini, turkey, onion, peppers, bread crumbs, egg white,
  tomato paste, parsley, tarragon, basil, and black pepper.  Press
  mixture into prepared pan and cover with foil.  Bake for 1 1/4 hours.
  Sprinkle cheese over the top.  Return to oven and bake another 10
  minutes.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Apple Butter
 Categories: Can/preserv, Condiments, Fruit, Tasteofhome
      Yield: 6 servings
 
      4 lb Of apples (I've used golden
           -delicious, granny smith,
           -pippin, arkansa black,
           -jonathan and macintosh,
           -they all work well)
      1 qt Apple cider (Try to use the
           -real stuff that hasn't been
           -clarified)
      1 c  Brown sugar
      1 c  White sugar
      1 ts Cinnamon
    1/2 ts Allspice
    1/4 ts Ground cloves
           A good book to read...
 
  This takes about 3-5 HOURS to do.  Have a day set aside.
  
  1) Peel, core and chop the apples and dump into a fairly huge pot.
  Pour in the cider and cook at medium heat about 45 minutes or until
  the apples get fall-apart tender.  Go at them with a potato masher
  until you have a pretty uniform texture.
  
  2) Add the sugars and the spices and stir in.  Bring to a simmer and
  cook for several hours, stirring every now and again to keep the
  stuff on the bottom from burning. You want to cook until it is really
  thick. You'll find that as it cooks, the liquid rises to the surface
  and it LOOKS runny. Don't be fooled, stir the liquid back in before
  you judge it ready for canning.
  
  3) Can in your sterilized jars.  Depending on how juicy the apples
  were and how long you cooked the mash, you'll have anywhere from a
  quart to a quart and a half of apple butter.  If you feel disquieted
  about not processing this mess, go right ahead.  Apple butter, unlike
  jams, doesn't lose as much flavor in processing.  It should keep for
  about a year.
  
  4) Get the kids and dole out the gooey, rubbery gunk that has stuck
  to the sides of the pan during cooking.  It tastes great and they'll
  love it.
  
  5) Once cool, label (with the date).
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Apple Butter II
 Categories: Fruit, Crockpot, Can/preserv
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      2 qt Sweet Cider
      4 lb Sweet But Tart Apples;
           -peeled, cored and sliced
      3 c  -Granulated Sugar; (about)
    1/4 ts -Cinnamon
    1/4 ts -Allspice
    1/8 ts -Ground Cloves
      1 ts -Salt
 
  *DEIDRE ANNE PENROD  FGGT98B*
  
  Apple Butter 11 to 13 hours
  
  The big advantage in making preserve butters in a slow cooker is that
  you don't have to stir or stand over the pot waiting to stir. Adapt
  your favorite fruit butter recipes to fit the instructions and
  cooking time.
  
  To Cook: Place the cider and the apples in the slow cooker. Cover and
  cook on Low for 10 to 12 hours; do not stir. Rub the apples through a
  sieve; measure the apples and add as much sugar as there is apple.
  Add the spices and salt and return to the cooker. Cover, and cook on
  Low for another hour. Pour into clean, dry, 1/2-pint canning jars.
  Seal and process in a boiling-water bath or store in refrigerator.
  Makes 4 to 6 pints.
  
  Source: "Clear & Simple Crockery Cooking", by Jacqueline Heriteau,
  Grosset & Dunlap, NY, c1975
  
  From the Recipe Files of:  Deidre-Anne Penrod, FGGT98B on Prodigy,
  J.PENROD3 on GEnie

      Yield: 8 servings
 
      2 lb Leftover pot roast
      2 ts Salt
           Freshly ground black pepper
           -to taste
      2    Cloves garlic, minced
      3 ts Vegetable oil
      2 md Onions, chopped
      2 md Tomatoes, peeled, seeded and
           -chopped
      2 md Green bell peppers, seeded
           -and chopped
      1 tb Capers
 
  'Old clothes'were a traditional way of serving leftovers, usually with
  french fries.
  
  and garlic.  In large, heavy skillet, heat oil and brown onions,
  tomatoes, and bell peppers for 5 minutes over medium heat, stirring
  occasionally. Add meat and capers.  Lower heat and continue to cook
  for ten minutes. Serve hot.
  
  From:  SKY JUICE AND FLYING FISH - TRADITIONAL CARIBBEAN COOKING by
  Jessica B. Harris, Simon & Schuster, New York. 1991. Posted by: Karin
  Brewer, Cooking Echo, 8/92
