MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Taste of Nova Scotia - Shark Margarita
 Categories: Fish/seafoo, Bbq/grill, Canadian
      Yield: 8 servings
 
      8    Shark steaks, 1-inch thick
    1/3 c  Lime juice
      1 ts Lime rind, grated
      2    Cloves garlic, minced
    1/4 ts Ground ginger
    1/2 c  Vegetable oil
      1 ts Pepper, freshly ground
      1 tb Liquid honey, or maple syrup
 
  Rinse shark in cold water and pat dry. In a large bowl, combine lime
  juice and rind, garlic,  ginger, vegetable oil, pepper and honey.
  
  Add shark, stirring to coat well. Cover with plastic wrap and
  marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes or refrigerate for up to
  1 hour, turning shark occasionally.
  
  Drain shark, reserving marinade. Grill shark steaks 4-inches from
  medium-hot coals on a barbecue, or broil in oven on a medium-high
  setting, brushing with reserved marinade, for 5 to 6 minutes per side.
  
  Cooking with medium heat, not high, is important in order to keepthe
  fish from toughening and drying out.
  Source: Taste of Nova Scotia Cookbook Contact: Taste of Nova Scotia,
  PO Bo 487, Halifax NS, Canada B3J 2R7
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Shellfish Cioppino
 Categories: Fish/seafoo, Italian, Soup/stew
      Yield: 4 servings
 
           -JUDI M. PHELPS
    1/4 c  Extra-virgin olive oil
      1 lg Onion; chopped
      3 lg Garlic cloves; chopped
    1/4 ts Crushed hot pepper flakes
      2    Celery ribs; chopped
      2 md Carrots; peeled and chopped
      1 c  Dry red wine
     28 oz Can Italian crushed tomatoes
           -(in puree)
  1 1/2 c  Water
      1 tb Fresh oregano; chopped OR
      1 ts Dried oregano
      1 ts Fresh rosemary ; chopped OR
    1/8 ts Dried rosemary
     12    Crab claws; cracked and
           -preferably Dungeness, fresh
           -or defrosted frozen
     12    To 14 clams; soft-shell or
           -cherrystones; scrubbed
           -clean
     12    To 14 mussels; scrubbed
           -clean
      3 tb Fresh parsley;chopped
      2 tb Fresh basil; chopped OR
      1 ts Dried basil
           Crusty Italian bread
           Freshly ground pepper
 
  In a nonreactive large, flameproof casserole, heat olive oil over
  medium heat.  Cook onion 3 to 4 minutes, or until softened.  Add
  garlic and hot pepper flakes and cook 30 seconds, or until fragrant.
  Stir in celery and carrots and cook until softened and just turning
  golden, 3 to 4 minutes. Add wine, tomatoes, water, oregano, and
  rosemary. Cook, uncovered, over medium heat until liquid is reduced
  by one fourth, 8 to 10 minutes.
  
  Add crab and cover.  Cook over medium-high heat 3 minutes.  Add clams
  and mussels and cook until opened and crab claws are bright red, 3 to
  4 minutes longer.  Discard any clams or mussels that did not open.
  Sprinkle with parsley and basil.  Serve in shallow soup bowls with
  thick crusty bread, passing a pepper mill on the side.
  
  Judi's Notes:  The above recipe is a basic Cioppino recipe.  I usually
  double the amount of tomatoes and wine and add 1/2 cup of clam juice
  to the tomato wine mixture. I add an extra garlic clove, and then add
  about 1/2 lb each scallops and shrimp and a couple pieces of firm
  fish such as halibut, swordfish, or whatever is in season. Be sure to
  add the scallops and shrimp at the very end of the cooking time or
  they will be too tough to even eat and will taste like rubber. Make
  sure you have plenty of napkins, seafood shell crackers, and a plate
  or bowl for discarded shells. Enjoy!
  
  Source:  365 Easy Italian Recipes.
  
  Shared and MM by Judi M. Phelps. Jphelps@shell.portal.com,
  juphelps@delphi.com, or jphelps@best.com
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Spiced Blueberry Jam
 Categories: Salsa/sauce, Dips/spread, Fruit
      Yield: 3 cups
 
      7 c  Blueberries (or two 12-oz
           Packages frozen blueberries)
    1/2 c  Plus 2 Tbsp apple-grape
           Concentrate sweetener (see
           Separate recipe)
      2 tb Orange juice
      2 tb Water
    3/4 ts Ground cinnamon
    1/2 ts Ground nutmeg
    1/4 ts Ground cloves
    1/4 ts Ground mace
 
  1. If using fresh blueberries, wash, drain and remove any bits of
  stem.
  
  2. In a 4-quart saucepan, combine the berries, apple-grape sweetener,
  orange juice, water, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves and mace.  Bring to a
  boil and reduce the heat to medium.  Cook at a low boil 20 minutes,
  stirring often, until very thick.  (To test for gelling, put about
  1/2 teaspoon jam on a chilled saucer and place in freezer for 1
  minute.  If, when cooled, jam wrinkles when touched, it is done.)
  Skim the foam from the top of the jam during the cooking time.
  
  3. Ladle into freezer containers, leaving 1/2-inch headspace.  Cool,
  cover and place in freezer.
  
  Data per tablespoon: Calories......20 Carbohydrates.....5g
  Monounsaturated fat....0g Protein.......0g Sodium...........3mg
  Polyunsaturated fat....0g Fat...........0g      Saturated fat.....0g
     Cholesterol...........0mg
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Apple-Grape or Pineapple Concentrate Sweetener
 Categories: Dips/spread, Condiments, Fruit
      Yield: 2 cups
 
MMMMM-------------------APPLE-GRAPE SWEETENER------------------------
     12 oz Can frozen apple juice
           Concentrate, defrosted
     12 oz Can frozen grape juice
           Concentrate, defrosted

MMMMM--------------------PINEAPPLE SWEETENER-------------------------
     12 oz Can frozen pineapple juice
           Concentrate, defrosted
 
  1. For the apple-grape sweetener: In a large saucepan, combine the
  apple and grape juice concentrates.  Bring to a boil, reduce the heat
  slightly and cook at a low boil 15 to 20 minutes.  Measure; you
  should have about 2 cups.  Transfer to a jar and cool.  Cover and
  refrigerate.
  
  2. For the pineapple sweetener: Pour the pineapple juice concentrate
  into a medium saucepan.  Bring to a boil; reduce the heat slightly,
  and cook at a low boil 15 to 20 minutes.  Measure; you should have
  about 1 cup. Transfer to a jar and cool.  Cover and refrigerate.
  
  3. The sweeteners will have a 2-week shelf life in refrigeration.
  
  Data per tablespoon for apple-grape sweetener: Calories........44
  Carbohydrates.......11g    Monounsaturated fat...0g Protein.........0g
  Sodium..............4mg    Polyunsaturated fat...0g Fat.............0g
  Saturated fat........0g    Cholesterol..........0mg
  
  Data per tablespoon for pineapple sweetener: Calories........48
  Carbohydrates.......12g    Monounsaturated fat...0g Protein.........0g
  Sodium..............1mg    Polyunsaturated fat...0g Fat.............0g
  Saturated fat........0g    Cholesterol..........0mg
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: GALAKTOBOUREKOS (Custard Tarts)
 Categories: Desserts, Greek, Pie/tart
      Yield: 50 tarts
 
      6    Eggs
      1 c  Sugar
      1 qt Milk
      6 tb Cornstarch
    1/3 c  Water
    1/4 c  Butter (or margarine)
      1 ts Vanilla extract
     16 oz Filo pastry sheets
     12 lb Sweet butter; melted
           Powdered sugar
 
  Beat eggs in saucepan; add sugar and beat thoroughly; slowly add
  milk. cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
  
  Dissolve cornstarch in water; slowly add to milk mixture before it
  comes to a boil.  Cook until mixture thickens and comes to a hard
  boil. Remove from heat; add 1/4 cup butter and vanilla.
  
  Cut pastry sheets in to thirds or into 9x5-inch pieces.  Brush pastry
  with hot melted butter.  Place about 1 tablespoon custard filling at
  bottom left corner of strip and fold the right bottom corner over it
  into a triangle. Continue folding back nad forth into a triangle and
  brushing with butter to end of strip.
  
  Place triangles, cut side down, on greased cookie sheet.  Brush tops
  with melted butter and bake at 375 degrees for 35 minutes.  Dust with
  powdered sugar while warm.
  
  Note: Custard can be refrigerated a few days before making tarts.
  These tarts can be frozen for 6 months.  Bake frozen at 350 degrees
  for 10 minutes; sprinkle with powdered sugar while warm.
  
  SOURCE: Southern Living Mazazine, sometime in the early 1970s. Typed
  for you by Nancy Coleman.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Tuna au Poivre
 Categories: Fish/seafoo
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      2 tb Soy sauce
      3 tb Lime juice
      1 md Clove garlic; peeled and put
           Through a press
    3/4 ts Sugar
      1 lb Fresh tuna
      2    To 3 teaspoons coarsely
           Ground black pepper
 
  1. Combine the soy sauce, lime juice, garlic and sugar.  Put the tuna
  into a glass dish and pour the marinade over the fish.  Marinate 1-2
  hours in refrigerator.
  
  2. Remove the fish from the marinade, discard marinade and place on a
  rack (or broiling pan) in a foiled lined pan.  Sprinkle the pepper on
  top of the fish, patting gently to adhere.  Bake in a preheated
  450-degree oven until cooked through..
  
  Data per serving: Calories.....128 Carbohydrates.....2g
  Monounsaturated fat.....1g Protein......20g Sodium.........291mg
  Polyunsaturated fat.....2g Fat...........4g     Saturated fat.....1g
     Cholesterol...........32mg
  
  From "Chic Simple-Cooking" by Kim Johnson Gross and Jeff Stone.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Bacardi Double-Chocolate Rum Cake
 Categories: Alcohol, Cake/cookie, Chocolate
      Yield: 16 servings
 
      1 pk Chocolate cake mix
     12 oz Semi-sweet chocolate chips
      1 sm Chocolate instant pudding --
           -divided
      1 c  Bacardi Black Rum
      1 c  Raspberry preserves --
           -(10 to 12oz)
    3/4 c  Water
      2 tb Shortening
    1/2 c  Oil
      1 oz Vanilla baking bar square
      4    Eggs
 
  Preheat oven to 350~. Combine cake mix , pudding, eggs, 1/2 cup of
  the rum, water and oil in a large mixing bowl. Using an electric
  mixer, beat at low speed until moistened. Beat at medium speed for 2
  minutes. Stir in 1 cup of chocolate pieces. Pour batter into a
  greased 12-cup Bundt pan. Bake 50 to 60 minutes until cake tests
  done. Cool in pan for 15 minutes. Remove from pan and cool on a wire
  rack. Heat raspberry preserves and remaining 1/2 cup of rum. Strain
  through a sieve to remove seeds. Place cake on a serving platter.
  Prick surface of cake with a fork. Brush reaspberry glaze evenly over
  cake, allowing cake to absorb glaze. Repeat until all the glaze has
  been absorbed. Combine remaining 1 cup of chocolate pieces and
  shortening. Microwave on high for 1 minute or until melted. Stir
  until smooth. Spoon chocolate icing over cake. Let stand 10 minutes.
  Combine vanilla baking bar and 1 ts. water. Microwave on high for 30
  seconds or until melted.
  
  Drizzle on top of icing.
  
  Recipe By     :
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Garlic Festival Chili 95
 Categories: Soup/stew, Chili
      Yield: 10 servings
 
      6 lb Pork butt -- 1" cubes
      2    Yellow onions -- chopped
     60    Garlic cloves -- chopped
    1/2 c  Jalapeno peppers -- finely
           -chopped with seeds
      1 tb Brown sugar -- packed
     28 oz Tomatoes -- crushed with
           -juice
    1/4 c  Molasses
      2 oz Unsweetened chocolate --
           -melted
    3/4 c  Chili powder
    1/4 c  Cumin -- ground
      1 tb Dried basil
      2 tb Oregano -- dried
      2 ts Mustard -- dried
      1 ts Coriander -- ground
      1 ts Black pepper -- ground
    1/2 ts Cloves -- ground
     24 oz Dark beer
      3 c  Water -- boiling
      2 tb Salt
    1/4 c  Cider vinegar or dry red
           -wine
      3 tb Soy sauce
    1/4 c  Habanero pepper sauce
 
  The day before serving, in a Dutch oven over high heat, brown pork
  until crispy and as much fat as possible has been rendered.  Remove
  pork with slotted spoon.  Drain in a colander lined with paper
  towels.  Leave 1/4 cup drippings in Dutch oven;  refrigerate
  remainder of fat.
  
  In the fat, over medium-low heat, saute onion, garlic and jalapeno
  peppers until soft, about 10 minutes.  Stir in brown sugar.  Cook a
  few more minutes. Remove from heat, stir in tomatoes, molasses and
  melted chocolate. Stir in spices and reserved pork. Refrigerate
  overnight.
  
  The next day:  Heat refrigerated mixture over low heat.   Remove
  solidified drippings from refrigerator and remove top layer of fat.
   Add bottom dripping layer to chili mixture. Stir in beer, boiling
  water, red wine or vinegar, soy sauce and salt. Bring to a boil,
  stirring frequently. Reduce heat, cover, simmer and stir occasionally
  until meat is very tender and flavors marry, about 1.5 hours. Stir in
  habanero sauce to taste. Simmer, covered, 1/2 hour longer. Garnish
  with sour cream and cilantro.
  
  Recipe By     : Kelli Larkspur-Honda

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Mocha Zucchini Bread
 Categories: Breads
      Yield: 10 servings
 
      2 c  All-purpose flour
      3 ts Baking powder
    1/2 ts Salt
      4 tb Cocoa powder
    1/3 c  Shortening
    2/3 c  Granulated sugar
      2    Eggs
      1 tb Instant coffee -- dissolved
           In
    1/4 c  Hot water
  1 1/2 c  Zucchini -- grated
 
  Preheat oven to 325 degrees.  Thoroughly grease a glass loaf pan.
  
  Sift dry ingredients together.  In the bowl of an electric mixer,
  cream shortening and sugar together.  Add eggs to creamed mixture one
  at a time. Add dissolved instant coffee.  Add zucchini.  Mix in dry
  mixture by hand, just until mixed.  Do not overbeat.
  
  Pour batter into prepared pan and bake 50 minutes to an hour, until a
  toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.  Let cool in pan on
  a cooling rack 15-20 minutes, then turn out of pan onto rack to finish
  cooling.
  
  Serve slightly warm, spread with butter, cream cheese, or plain.
  
  Recipe By     : Alison Meyer
  
  From: Alison Meyer                    Date: 08-14-95 (21:04) (159)
  Fido: Cooking

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cashew Nut Barfi
 Categories: Nuts/grains, Indian, Desserts
      Yield: 16 servings
 
      3 c  Unsalted cashews
  2 1/2 c  Sugar
    1/2 c  Milk
     20 g  Ghee
      1 ts Ground cardamom
      1 ts Rosewater
           Silver leaf
 
  Place cashews in a bowl, cover with boiling water and stand for 1
  hour. Drain well and process in a food processor or blender until
  finely chopped. Slowly bring the sugar, milk, ghee, cardamom and
  rosewater to the boil in a saucepan over low heat.  Add nuts and cook
  over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens but is
  still of a pourable consistency. Pour into an oiled 23cm round dish
  and set aside to cool.  Place silver leaf on top and cut into wedges.
  Store at room temperature. From: Sherree Johansson
  :            Date: 08-14-95 (08:34) (163) Fido: Interco

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Sauerkraut Rice For A Crowd
 Categories: Meats, Pasta/rice, Vegetables
      Yield: 50 servings
 
      4 qt Sauerkraut, drained
      6 c  Long grain rice
      3 lb Lean ground beef or bacon
      2 lb Butter or margarine
      4 c  Chopped onions
      3 c  Chopped celery
      4 c  Chicken broth
    1/2 ts Pepper
           Salt and pepper to taste
 
  Boil and drain sauerkraut.  Cook rice, rinse with hot water and drain.
  Brown beef or fry bacon, draining fat.  Saute in butter, the onions
  and celery.  In large pot, mix all ingredients together and place in
  large roasters or casserole dishes and bake in 350F oven for 1-1/2
  hours.
  
  Origin: Homestyle, Canadian Classics.  Ladies of the Royal Purple.
  Shared by: Sharon Stevens, July/95.
  From: Sharon Stevens                  Date: 08-14-95 (00:00) (164)
  Fido: Home Co

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Macaroni Salad For A Crowd
 Categories: Salads, Meats, Pasta/rice
      Yield: 50 servings
 
      8 c  Uncooked macaroni
     12 c  Cubed cooked turkey or ham
      2 c  Grated cheese
      2 c  Chopped celery
      2 c  Grated carrots
  2 1/2 c  Chopped onions
  2 1/2 c  Mayonnaise or salad
           Dressing
      1 c  Vinegar
    3/4 c  Lemon juice
  2 1/2 c  Sweet pickle juice
    3/4 ts Paprika
      1 ts Salt
      2 ts Pepper
 
  Cook macaroni, rinse and drain well.  Set aside.  In large bowl,
  combine the cooled macaroni, meat, cheese and vegetables.  Combine
  the remaining ingredients and pour over salad.  Toss to coat well.
  Refrigerate for at least 3 hours.  Salad is best, when made the same
  day as being served. This will last 2-3 days.
  
  Origin: Homestyles, Canadian Classics, Ladies of the Royal Purple.
  Shared by: Sharon Stevens, July/95.
  From: Sharon Stevens                  Date: 08-14-95 (00:00) (164)
  Fido: Home Co

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Mashed Potatoes For A Crowd
 Categories: Potatoes
      Yield: 1 servings
 
     30 lb Potatoes
      1 qt Milk
      1 tb Salt
    1/2 c  Butter
 
  Peel potatoes, cook until tender.  Drain well.  Mash until smooth.
  Add butter and salt.  Slowly add the milk while mixing until you get
  a smooth consistency.  Beat until light and fluffly.
  
  Origin: Homestlye, Canadian Classics, Ladies of the Royal Purple.
  Shared by: Sharon Stevens, July/95.
  From: Sharon Stevens                  Date: 08-14-95 (00:00) (164)

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Minestrone For A Crowd
 Categories: Soup/stew, Vegetables, Meats
      Yield: 100 servings
 
      2 lb Small white beans
     14 lb Soup bones
      4    5 lbs stewing beef
           Flour for dredging
           Salt and pepper
    1/2 c  Oil
     12 qt Water
      3    4 bay leaves
     10    28oz can tomatoes
     12    Beef bouillon cubes, or to
           Taste
      8    Leeks, sliced
      8 md Onions, chopped
     15    Carrots, sliced
      1 bn Celery, chopped
      2 sm Firm cabbages, shredded
      1 c  Chopped parsley
      2    3 tbsp oregano AND thyme, or
           To taste
      8 c  Macaroni
      2 lb Frozen peas
 
  Soak bean overnight in hot water, drain.  Roast soup bones in a lsow
  oven until browned.  Chop stewing beef into very small pieces, dredge
  with flour, salt and pepper and then add to oil which has been heated
  in a large dutch oven.  It may be necessary to do this in several
  batches. Stir beef until brown on all sides.  In a very large soup
  pot (12 gallon) place soup bones, beef, 4 tbsp salt and approx 3
  gallons of water. Bay leaves may be added at this time. This should
  be simmer for about 6 hours or more. At the end of this time, remove
  the bones and gristle and add the tomatoes, beef bouillon, leeks,
  onions and carrot and the white beans. Simmer soup for 1-1/2 to 2
  hours.  Add celery, cabbage, parsley and herbs, salt an dpepper to
  taste.  Simmer for 1/2 hour more and then add macaroni and peas and
  more seasoning if necessary. If soup is extremely thick, you may add
  up to 4 quarts of hot water with the last vegetables, or at any time
  if there is a dange or scorching. After the last addition, the soup
  should again simmer until the macaroni is tender.  Again check for
  seasonings and adjust.
  
  Origin: Homestyle Canadian Classics, Ladies of the Royal Purple.
  Shared by: Sharon Stevens, July/95.
  From: Sharon Stevens                  Date: 08-14-95 (00:00) (164)
  Fido: Home Co
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Multi Layered Salad For A Crowd
 Categories: Salads
      Yield: 300 servings
 
     12    Heads lettuce
     12 c  Sliced celery
     48    Hard boiled eggs, sliced
      6 lb Frozen peas
      7    Green peppers, chopped
      5    5oz cans water chestnuts,
           Sliced thin
      6 sm Jars mayonnaise
      6    16oz containers of sour
           Cream
      8 tb Sugar
      4 lb Grated cheddar cheese
     27    28 oz bacon bits for garnish
           (or real bacon, crumbled)
 
  Wash, drain and tear lettuce into small pieces.  In large pans or
  bowls, arrange lettuce on bottom, then layer the next ingredients as
  given. Mix the mayonnaise, sour cream and sugar together and spread
  over salad to cover top layer.  Seal to edges.  Sprinkle grated
  cheese over top and then bacon bits on top of cheese.  Seal tightly
  with plastic wrap or airtight lid.  Allow to sit overnight in fridge.
  MUST be allowed to sit overnight... much better flavour when made the
  day before.
  
  Origin: Homestyle, Canadian Classics, Ladies of the Royal Purple.
  Shared by: Sharon Stevens, July/95.
  From: Sharon Stevens                  Date: 08-14-95 (00:00) (164)
  Fido: Home Co

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Shrimp Salad For A Crowd
 Categories: Salads, Fish/seafoo, Desserts
      Yield: 25 servings
 
      2    3oz pkgs cherry jello
      4 c  Tomato juice
      1 tb Vinegar
      2    7 5oz cans chopped or broken
           Shrimp
      1 c  Chopped celery
    1/2 c  Grated carrots
           Onion salt
 
  Dissolve the jello with hot tomato juice.  Stir until no crystals
  remain. Add veinger.  Cool.  When half set, add the shrimp, celery,
  carrots and a little onion salt.  Refrigerate until completely set,
  overnight.
  
  Origin: Homestyle, Canadian Classics, Ladies of the Royal Purple.
  Shared by: Sharon Stevens, July/95.
  From: Sharon Stevens                  Date: 08-14-95 (00:00) (164)
  Fido: Home Co

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Mom's Mincemeat
 Categories: Can/preserv, Tasteofhome
      Yield: 1 batch
 
      3 lb Green tomatoes; chopped
      3 lb Apples; chopped, unpeeled
      3 lb Brown sugar
      2 lb Rasins; chopped
      1 tb Salt
      1 c  Beef suet; chopped
      1 c  Vinegar
      2 tb Cinnamon
      2 ts Cloves
      1 ts Nutmeg
      1 ea Orange w/peel; chopped
 
  Grind tomatoes, drain well (use coarse knife on blender or grinder).
  Measure juice and discard.  Put same amount of water in tomato
  mixture and bring to a boil, drain again, measure juice and discard.
  Put same amount of water (as juice discarded) and bring to a boil
  again. Drain well, add remaining ingredients to and including
  vinegar. Cook until mixture is clear.  Add spices and cook until
  thick.
  
  Put into jars and seal.  Does not need cold packing.  Do not put
  spices in until after mixture cooks clear, then add spices & cook
  about 3-4 hours until thick.
  
  Notes:
  
  We couldn't find beef suet, so we substituted fat trimmings from beef.
  
  We packed it hot into jars and processed it in a pressure canner, 10
  minutes @ 10 psi pressure.  This is for our altitude at @ 5000 feet,
  and should probably be less for lower altitudes.  It worked well for
  us this way.
  
  Recipe from Ann Haffly Entered into MealMaster by Stephen Haffly
  Submitted By STEPHEN HAFFLY   On   08-13-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: German Potato Salad - Kartoffelsalat
 Categories: Salads, Diabetic, Potatoes, Aust/german
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      4 md Potatoes
      1 pn Salt
      1 md Onion, finely minced
      1 md Dill pickle, chopped
    1/2 ts Capers, rinsed
    1/2 c  White chicken stock
      1 tb Vegetable oil
      2 ts Spicy mustard
      1 tb Vinegar, or lemon juice
           Freshly ground pepper to
           -taste
 
   Cook the potatoes in their jackets in lightly salted water. When the
  potatoes are cooked and cool enough to handle, peel and slice them,
  and drop them into a bowl. In a small bowl, whisk the remaining
  ingredients. Taste, and adjust seasonings.  Pour dressing over the
  potatoes, and marinate for 30 minutes before serving the salad. Serve
  warm or cold.
  
    Serving size:  1 cup
    Nutritional info:  Calories - 146, Protein = 3 grams, Carbohydtates
  = 26 grams, Fat = 4 grams, Fiber = 3 grams, Sodium = 298 mgrams,
  Cholesterol = 0 mgrams.
    Exchanges = 1 1/2 starch, 1/2 vegetable, 1/2 fat exchanges.
   On   MON, 3 MAY 93 1611 CST
  Submitted By JEFF PRUETT   On   08-14-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Squash Pickles
 Categories: Can/preserv, Pickles, Vegetables
      Yield: 2 pints
 
      4 md Yellow squash; sliced 1/4
           -inch thick
    1/2 c  Pickling salt
      2 sm Onions; thinly sliced
    1/2 c  Sugar
  1 1/2 c  Vinegar (5% acidity)
      3 tb Dry mustard
      1 tb Ground ginger
      1 tb Curry powder
      6 ea Whole peppercorns
 
       Layer squash and salt in a large glass or plastic container.
  Cover and let stand about 4 hours.  Rinse squash several times in
  cold water; drain well.
      Place squash and onion in a large Dutch oven.  Combine remaining
  ingredients in a small, heavy saucepan, mixing well.  Bring to a
  boil; boil 5 minutes, stirring often.
     Pour vinegar mixture over squash; bring mixture to a boil, and
  cook 5 minutes or just until squash is crisp-tender.
     Pack into hot sterilized jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace.  Cover
  at once with metal lids, and screw bands tight.  Process in
  boiling-water bath for 15 minutes.
  
  "Southern Living"   August, 1981     Typos by Jeff Pruett
  Submitted By JEFF PRUETT   On   08-14-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Mixed Pickles SL
 Categories: Can/preserv, Pickles, Vegetables
      Yield: 6 pints
 
    3/4 c  Pickling salt
      4 qt Cold water
      1 qt Sliced small cucumbers;
           -( 1-inch slices )
      2 c  Sliced carrots; (1-1/2 inch
           -slices)
      2 c  Sliced celery; (1-1/2 inch
           -slices)
      2 c  Small boiling onions
      2 ea Sweet red peppers; cut into
           -1/2-inch strips
      1 sm Cauliflower; broken into
           -flowerets
  6 1/2 c  Vinegar (5% acidity)
      2 c  Sugar
      1 ea Fresh hot red pepper;
           -sliced crosswise
    1/4 c  Mustard seeds
      2 tb Celery seeds
 
     Dissolve salt in water; pour over vegetables in a large crock or
  plastic container.  Cover and let stand in a cool place 12 to 18
  hours. Drain well.
     Combine vinegar, sugar, hot red pepper, and spices in a 10-quart
  Dutch oven; bring to a boil, and boil 3 minutes.  Add vegetables;
  reduce heat, and simmer until thoroughly heated.
     Pack into hot sterilized jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace.  Cover
  at once with metal lids, and screw bands tight.  Process in
  boiling-water bath for 15 minutes.
  
  "Southern Living"  August, 1981    Typos by Jeff Pruett
  Submitted By JEFF PRUETT   On   08-14-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Dilled Fresh Zucchini SL
 Categories: Can/preserv, Pickles, Vegetables
      Yield: 10 pints
 
      6 lb Medium zucchini; thinly
           -sliced
      2 c  Thinly sliced celery
      2 c  Chopped onion
    1/2 c  Sugar
      2 tb Dillseeds
      2 c  Vinegar (5% acidity)
      6 cl Garlic; halved
 
     Combine vegetables in a large bowl; cover with ice cubes.  Cover
  and let stand about 3 hours.  Drain well.
     Combine sugar, dillseeds, and vinegar in a large Dutch oven; bring
  to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.  Add vegetables, and
  bring to a boil.
     Pack into hot, sterilized jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace.  Add 1
  to 2 pieces of garlic per jar.  Cover at once with metal lids, and
  screw bands tightly.  Process in boiling water bath for 15 minutes.
  
  "Southern Living"  August, 1981      Typos by Jeff Pruett
  Submitted By JEFF PRUETT   On   08-14-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Quick Sweet Pickles SL
 Categories: Can/preserv, Pickles, Vegetables
      Yield: 7 pints
 
      6 lb Medium-sized cucumbers;
           -unpeeled
      1 lg Sweet red pepper; cut into
           -strips
      1 sm Onion; sliced
      2 cl Garlic
  1 1/2 c  Pickling salt
      2 qt Crushed ice
      3 c  Sugar
      1 qt White vinegar (5% acidity)
      2 tb Mustard seeds
 
     Wash cucumbers; remove 1/4-inch from ends.  Cut into 1/4-inch
  slices. Combine cucumbers, red pepper, onion, and garlic in a large
  bowl; add salt, and stir well.  Pack ice over cucumbers; cover and
  let stand 3 hours. Remove garlic; rinse, and drain.
     Combine remaining ingredients in a large Dutch oven; bring to a
  boil. Add vegetables and reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, 5 minutes.
  Pack cucumber mixture into hot, sterilized pint jars, leaving 1/2
  inch headspace. Wipe jar rims.  Cover at once with metal lids, and
  screw on bands. Process in boiling water bath 10 minutes.
  
  Recipe from H.F. Bowman of Florida   in "Southern Living"  July, 1987
  Typos by Jeff Pruett
  Submitted By JEFF PRUETT   On   08-14-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Corn Relish SL
 Categories: Can/preserv, Vegetables, Relishes
      Yield: 6 pints
 
     18 ea Ears fresh corn (approx)
      7 qt Water
      1 sm Head cabbage; chopped
      1 c  Onion; chopped
      1 c  Green pepper; chopped
      1 c  Sweet red pepper; chopped
      1 c  To 2 cups sugar
      2 tb Dry mustard
      1 tb Celery seeds
      1 tb Salt
      1 tb Ground turmeric
      1 qt Vinegar (5% acidity)
      1 c  Water
 
     Remove husks and silks from corn just before cooking.  Bring 7
  quarts water to a boil; add corn.  Bring water to a boil; add corn.
  Bring water to a second boil; boil 5 minutes. Cut corn from cob;
  measuring about 2 quarts of kernels.
     Combine corn kernels and remaining ingredients in a large saucepan;
  simmer over low heat 20 minutes.  Bring mixture to a boil.
     Pack into hot sterilized jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace.  Cover
  at once with metal lids, and screw bands tightly.  Process in
  boiling-water bath for 15 minutes.
  
  "Southern Living"  August, 1981      Typos by Jeff Pruett
  Submitted By JEFF PRUETT   On   08-14-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: French (Green) Beans in Hollandaise Sauce (Mw)
 Categories: Side dish, Microwave, Vegetables
      Yield: 4 servings
 
  1 3/4 lb French (Green) beans
    1/3 c  Butter
      5 ea Egg yolks
           Salt and pepper
           Grated lemon zest
           Juice of one lemon
           Tabasco sauce
    1/2 ts Dried basil
 
   Top and tail the beans and put in a dish with 1/2 cup water. Cover
  and microwave on HIGH for 8 minutes.  Leave to stand for 5 minutes.
   Melt the butter in a bowl in the microwave for 2 minutes on high.
   Whisk together the egg yolks, salt and pepper, a few drops of lemon
  juice and 1 teaspoon water in a Pyrex bowl.  Gradually whisk in a
  little of the foaming butter.  Heat on high for 1 minute, remove and
  whisk again, gradually adding the remaining butter.  Return to the
  microwave for 1 minute on high.  Whisk again.
   Add the remaining lemon juice and zest (peel) and a drop of Tabasco
  sauce. Whisk well, and if the sauce has not thickened enough, return
  the bowl to the microwave for 30 seconds.
   Drain the beans, sprinkle with basil, and return to the microwave.
  Cook on high for 3 minutes.  Stir and serve with the sauce poured
  over.
  
  Microwave Hint:  To cook green beans, trim the ends, cut long beans
  is half and put in a suitable dish.  Sprinkle with salt to taste and
  add 1/4 cup water.  Cover and cook on high for 3 minutes.  Test for
  tenderness, re-cover and cook for a further 2 to 3 minutes.  Leave to
  stand, covered, for a further 2 minutes before serving.  Sprinkle
  with chopped savory.
  
  _The Ultimate Microwave Cookbook_  Elisa Vergne, 1988 Gallery Books
  ISBN 0-8317-5985-2     Typos by Jeff Pruett
  Submitted By JEFF PRUETT   On   08-14-95
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Venetian Green Beans (Microwave)
 Categories: Side dish, Microwave, Vegetables
      Yield: 4 servings
 
      1 ea Finely sliced onion
      1 cl Garlic; crushed
      2 tb Butter
      1 lb Green beans
     14 oz Can tomatoes; drained and
           -chopped
    1/4 ts Dried marjoram
           Salt and pepper
 
   Put the onion, garlic, and butter in a medium casserole dish and
  cook on high for 3 minutes.
   Add the beans, tomatoes, and marjoram.  Cover and heat on high for 8
  minutes.  Leave to stand for 5 minutes.
   Season lightly with salt and pepper, and serve hot.
  
  _The Ultimate Microwave Cookbook_  Elisa Vergne, 1988 Gallery Books
  ISBN 0-8317-5985-2     Typos by Jeff Pruett
  Submitted By JEFF PRUETT   On   08-14-95
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Low Fat Cake Modifications
 Categories: Cake/cookie
      Yield: 1 servings
 
           Text
 
  You can bake a cake with a regular cake mix. Instead of 3 whole eggs,
  use 4 egg whites. Instead of adding 1/4c oil to the cake mix, add 1/3c
  applesauce.
  
  Your cake will be delightfully rich and yummy and have less than 15%
  calories from fat.
  
  Posted on dieting echo by Jerrilynn Chung
  Submitted By LISA GREENWOOD   On   08-14-95
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Health Grain Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    3/4 c  Water
  1 1/2 c  White bread flour
    1/4 c  Wheat bread flour
      2 tb Dry milk
      1 ts Salt
      2 ts Honey
      1 tb Olive oil
    1/4 c  Carrots (chopped or grated)
    1/4 c  Raisins
    1/4 c  Sunflower seeds
    1/4 c  Bran Flakes
      1 tb Wheat germ
      1 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This bread has everything, including flavor!  It's moist with a light
  crunch, and chock full of good things.  Serve it with a fresh fruit
  plate, and let them think it's all about taste!
  
                             Success Hints
                             -------------
  
  If using the time bakc cycle, place the carrots away from the yeast to
  prevent carrots from turning brown.
  
  This recipe can be used with the regular, rapid or delayed time bake
  cycles.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cinco de Mayo Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    2/3 c  Water
      2 c  White bread flour
      2 ts Sugar
    1/2 ts Salt
      2 tb Olive oil
    2/3 c  Corn meal
    1/3 c  Creamed corn
      2 tb Green chilies, canned/diced
      1 ts Jalapeno peppers,    "
      1 ts Cilantro, dried
  1 1/2 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, acfive dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  Served with chili, this lightly textured loaf will convince you never
  to back to plain corn bread again!
  
                            Success Hints
                            -------------
  
  Drain canned chilies and jalapeno peppers well.  Be careful! Jalapeno
  and chili juice can sting.
  
  This recipe can be used with regular and rapid bake cycles.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cherry Yogurt Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    1/2 c  Water
      2 c  White bread flour
    3/4 ts Salt
    1/2 c  Cherries, dried
    1/3 c  Cherry yogurt, low fat
      2 tb Applesauce, unsweetened
      2 ts Brown sugar
  1 1/2 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This sweet bread is surprisingly versatile.  You can use it in lieu of
  raisin bread for French toast, or serve it warm with cream cheese and
  honey for a dessert bread.  The applesauce and yogurt contribute a
  refleshing moistness to this light loaf.
  
                               Success Hints
                               -------------
  
  Add the dried cherries whole, at "add-in" time.
  
  This recipe can be used with the regular and rapid bake cycles.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

      Title: Classic White Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
  3 3/8 c  Water
      2 c  White bread flour
      1 tb Dry milk

           - or -
  1 1/2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This is a classic - plain white bread, but a world away from
  store-bought!
  
                               Success Hints
                               ------------- This recipe can be made
  with the regular, rapid or delayed time bake cycles.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Raisin Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    3/4 c  Water
      2 c  White bread flour
      1 tb Dry milk
      1 tb Sugar
      1 ts Salt
      1 tb Butter
    1/2 ts Cinnamon
    1/2 c  Raisins
  1 1/2 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  One of life's simple pleasures!  This recipe blends the fruit right
  into the loaf unless you add the raisins in mid-cycle; it's your
  choice.
  
                               Success Hints
                               ------------- For whole raisins in the
  bread, add fruit at the beep on the fruit and nut cycle or after the
  first knead.
  
  If using the rapid bake cycle, add raisins with other ingredients.
  
  This recipe can be made with the regular, rapid or delayed time bake
  cycles.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: 100% Whole Wheat Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
      1 c  Water
  2 1/2 c  Wheat bread flour
  1 1/4 tb Dry milk
      1 ts Salt
  1 1/2 tb Butter
  1 1/4 tb Honey
      1 tb Bluten
      2 ts Molasses
  1 1/2 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, acvive dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  The trick to making 100% whole wheat bread in your machine is an extra
  knead, which gives the yeast and gluten a second chance to create a
  lighter loaf.  When your first knead cycle is completed, simply reset
  the machine and start again - or use the whole wheat cycle, if it's
  available on your machine.
                               Success Hints
                               -------------
  
  If your market doesn't stock wheat gluten, try your local health food
  store.
  
  Remember the extra knead (as usual for wheat bread) - it's especially
  important for 100% whole wheat bread!  You should use only the
  regular bake cycle.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: 100% Whole Wheat Bread (Machine) - Large Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
  1 1/2 c  + 2 T   Water
  3 3/4 c  Wheat bread flour
      2 tb Dry milk
  1 1/2 ts Salt
      2 tb Butter
      2 tb Honey
  1 1/2 tb Bluten
      1 tb Molasses
  1 1/8 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      3 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  The trick to making 100% whole wheat bread in your machine is an extra
  knead, which gives the yeast and gluten a second chance to create a
  lighter loaf.  When your first knead cycle is completed, simply reset
  the machine and start again - or use the whole wheat cycle, if it's
  available on your machine.
  
                               Success Hints
                               -------------
  
  If your market doesn't stock wheat gluten, try your local health food
  store.
  
  Remember the extra knead (as usual for wheat bread) - it's especially
  important for 100% whole wheat bread!  You should use only the
  regular bake cycle.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Swedish Limpa Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    1/4 c  Water
  1 3/4 c  White bread flour
    1/4 c  Rye flour
      1 tb Dry milk
      1 ts Salt
      1 tb Butter
    3/4 tb Molasses
    1/2 c  Flat ale
    1/4 ts Cardamom
    1/4 ts Anise seed
    1/2 tb Orange peel
      1 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This rich but light rye is the cornerstone of a traditional Swedish
  breakfast.  The anise and orange peel add just a kiss of flavor to
  complement the rye.  Nice with a slice of cheese, a soft-boiled egg
  in an egg cup and a cup of strong black coffee!
  
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  You can produce flat ale by opening a dark beer and stirring until the
  bubbles disperse.  Scoop off residual foam before measuring ale.
  
  This recipe can be made with the regular or rapid bake cycle.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

      Title: Swedish Limpa Bread (Machine) - Large Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    1/2 c  Water
  2 1/2 c  White bread flour
    1/2 c  Rye flour
      2 tb Dry milk
  1 1/2 ts Salt
      2 tb Butter
      1 tb Honey
      1 tb Molasses
    3/4 c  Flat ale
    1/2 ts Cardamom
    1/2 ts Anise seed
      1 tb Orange peel
      2 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      3 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This rich but light rye is the cornerstone of a traditional Swedish
  breakfast.  The anise and orange peel add just a kiss of flavor to
  complement the rye.  Nice with a slice of cheese, a soft-boiled egg
  in an egg cup and a cup of strong black coffee!

  bubbles disperse.  Scoop off residual foam before measuring ale.
  
  This recipe can be made with the regular or rapid bake cycle.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Tropical Medley Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    3/4 c  Water
      2 c  White bread flour
      1 tb Dry milk
      1 tb Sugar
      1 ts Salt
      1 tb Butter
    1/2 c  Dried fruit mix
  1 1/2 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      3 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This is a light, colorful bread full of fruity surprises.  Because of
  the variety in the dried fruit mix, each bite has a different flavor!
  
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  Apricots, coconut, golden raisins, papaya and pineapple make a good
  combination for the dried fruit mix
  
  Several brands of pre-chopped and pre-packaged "Tropical Medley" mix
  are available - great for fast preparation.
  
  You don't need to use the fruit & nut cycle; simply add the dried
  fruit with your other ingredients.
  
  This recipe can be made with the regular, rapid or delayed time bake
  cycles.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Tropical Medley Bread (Machine) - Large Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
  1 1/4 c  Water
      3 c  White bread flour
      2 tb Dry milk
  1 1/2 tb Sugar
  1 1/2 ts Salt
      2 tb Butter
      1 c  Dried fruit mix
      2 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      3 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This is a light, colorful bread full of fruity surprises.  Because of
  the variety in the dried fruit mix, each bite has a different flavor!
  
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  Apricots, coconut, golden raisins, papaya and pineapple make a good
  combination for the dried fruit mix
  
  Several brands of pre-chopped and pre-packaged "Tropical Medley" mix
  are available - great for fast preparation.
  
  You don't need to use the fruit & nut cycle; simply add the dried
  fruit with your other ingredients.
  
  This recipe can be made with the regular, rapid or delayed time bake
  cycles.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Kulich Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    1/2 c  Water
      2 c  + 2T White bread flour
      1 ts Salt
      1    Egg
      2 tb Raisins
      2 tb Dried cherries
      2 tb Dried fruit mix
      2 tb Milk
      2 tb Honey
    3/4 ts Vanilla extract
    1/4 ts Lemon peel, dried
      2 tb Toasted Almonds
      1 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This festive loaf, topped with the traditional Russian sweet Paskha,
  will be a brunch favorite!
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  Brush bread with a mixture of 1 T honey, 1 T lemon juice and 1 T
  triple sec while still hot for a glazed finish.
  
  If dried cherries are unavailable, double the dried mixed fruit.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

      Title: Kulich Bread (Machine) - Large Loaf

      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    3/4 c  Water
  3 1/4 c  White bread flour
  1 1/2 ts Salt
      2    Eggs
    1/4 c  Raisins
    1/4 c  Dried cherries
    1/4 c  Dried fruit mix
    1/4 c  Milk
      3 tb Honey
      1 ts Vanilla extract
    1/2 ts Lemon peel, dried
    1/4 c  Toasted almonds
  1 1/2 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      3 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This festive loaf, topped with the traditional Russian sweet Paskha,
  will be a brunch favorite!
                                 Success Hints

  triple sec while still hot for a glazed finish.

MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Multi-Grain and More Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    3/4 c  Water
  1 1/4 c  White bread flour
    1/4 c  Wheat bread flour
      1 tb Dry milk
      1 ts Salt
      1 tb Butter
    1/4 c  7 Grain rolled cereal
      2 tb Wheat germ
      1 tb Oat bran
      1 tb Cracked wheat
  1 1/2 tb Honey
      1 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
  1 1/2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  Packed with good-for-you stuff!  All those grains give it a full, rich
  flavor - and enough body to stick to your ribs.  If you want the
  benefits of cereal and the timeliness of toast, this is the bread for
  you.
  
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  Any unsweetened multi-grain cereal should work in this bread.
  
  For accent & crunch, sprinkle a few oats on top after the final rise,
  just before baking.
  
  This recipe can be made with the regular, rapid or delayed time bake
  cycles.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

      Title: Multi-Grain and More Bread (Machine) - Large Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
  1 1/4 c  Water
  2 1/4 c  White bread flour
    1/2 c  Wheat bread flour
      2 tb Dry milk

      2 tb Butter
    1/2 c  7 Grain rolled cereal
      3 tb Wheat germ
      2 tb Oat bran
      2 tb Cracked wheat
  2 1/2 tb Honey
      2 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      3 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  Packed with good-for-you stuff!  All those grains give it a full, rich
  flavor - and enough body to stick to your ribs.  If you want the
  benefits of cereal and the timeliness of toast, this is the bread for
  you.
  
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  Any unsweetened multi-grain cereal should work in this bread.
  
  For accent & crunch, sprinkle a few oats on top after the final rise,
  just before baking.
  
  This recipe can be made with the regular, rapid or delayed time bake
  cycles.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Honey Mustard Bread (Machine)
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    1/2 c  Water
  1 1/2 c  White bread flour
    1/2 c  Wheat bread flour
      2 ts Dry milk
  2 1/2 tb Honey
    1/2 ts Salt
    1/4 c  Chicken broth, low salt/can
  1 2/3 tb Gourmet mustard
      1 ts Chives, dried
      1 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  The mustard adds a subtle, secondary flavor.  This bread makes an
  unforgettable ham sandwich, or serve it warm with baked ham or roast
  duck.
  
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  Try Grey Poupon Country Dijon Mustard!
  
  This recipe can be made with the regular and rapid bake cycles.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Honey Mustard Bread (Machine) - Large Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    3/4 c  Water
      2 c  White bread flour
      1 c  Wheat bread flour
      1 tb Dry milk
    1/4 c  Honey
      1 ts Salt
    1/2 c  Chicken broth, low salt can
  2 1/2 tb Gourmet mustard
      2 ts Chives, dried
      2 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      3 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  The mustard adds a subtle, secondary flavor.  This bread makes an
  unforgettable ham sandwich, or serve it warm with baked ham or roast
  duck.
  
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  Try Grey Poupon Country Dijon Mustard!
  
  This recipe can be made with the regular and rapid bake cycles.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Apple Oat Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    1/2 c  Water
  1 1/3 c  White bread flour
    2/3 c  Wheat bread flour
      2 ts Dry milk
      1 ts Salt
      2 ts Butter
    1/2 c  Apples, canned/chopped
      1 tb Apple juice, concentrated
      2 ts Lemon juice
      1 tb Honey
      2 tb Yogurt
      2 ts Molasses
    1/4 c  Oats
      1 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This is a full-bodied oatmeal bread with the added sweetness of
  apples and honey.  It goes well with smoked meats such as summer
  sausage. For something different, try a curried salad filling.
  
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  Use unsweetened apples, canned in water.  Drain well and chop into
  chunks.
  
  Use frozen apple juice concentrate, thawed, with no water added.
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycle.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Certainly Citrus Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    2/3 c  Water
      2 c  White bread flour
      1 tb + 1t Dry milk
      2 ts Sugar
      1 ts Salt
      1 tb + 1t Butter
      2 tb Orange marmalade
      2 ts Lemon juice
      2 ts Lime juice
           Pinch lemon peel
      1 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This tangy bread has a fine, light texture.  The subtle yet
  distinctive flavor makes it a perfect accompaniment for fish or
  chicken. Try it with swordfish baked with lime butter or your
  favorite lemon chicken recipe.
  
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  If using fresh lemon peel, grate very fine and avoid using the white
  pulp.
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycle.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cottage Dill Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    1/2 c  Water
      2 c  White bread flour
      1 tb Dry milk
      1 tb Sugar
      1 ts Salt
      1 tb Butter
    1/4 c  Cottage cheese
    1/2 tb Dry onion
    1/2 tb Dill seed
    1/2 tb Dill weed
      1 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This bread will make a bread machine believer out of anyone.  The
  aroma is heaven, and the taste lives up to the aroma.  Cottage Dill
  is best served warm from the oven or toaster; the heat liberates the
  spices for a full, rich flavor.
  
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  Use small curd, low fat cottage cheese.
  
  The liquid in cottage cheese varies.  If your dough is too dry, try
  adding water, a tablespoon at a time, during the kneading until dough
  appears moist and pliable.
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycle.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cottage Dill Bread (Machine) - Large Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    3/4 c  Water
      3 c  White bread flour
  1 1/2 tb Dry milk
      2 tb Sugar
  1 1/2 ts Salt
  1 1/2 tb Butter
    3/4 c  Cottage cheese
      1 tb Dry onion
      1 tb Dill seed
      1 tb Dill weed
      2 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      3 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This bread will make a bread machine believer out of anyone.  The
  aroma is heaven, and the taste lives up to the aroma.  Cottage Dill
  is best served warm from the oven or toaster; the heat liberates the
  spices for a full, rich flavor.
  
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  Use small curd, low fat cottage cheese
  
  The liquid in cottage cheese varies.  If your dough is too dry, try
  adding water, a tablespoon at a time, during the kneading until dough
  appears moist and pliable.
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycle.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Cajun Spice Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    3/4 c  Water
      2 c  White bread flour
      1 tb Dry milk
    1/2 ts Salt
      1 tb Butter
      1 tb Brown sugar
      1 tb Cajun spice blend
      2 ts Tomato paste
    1/2 ts Onion paste
    1/4 ts Parsley flakes
  1 1/4 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This is not a shy little bread to quench the fire of jambalaya or your
  blackened redfish.  This is a bread with legs - bread that will get
  up and dance to Zydeco music all by itself!  The Cajun spice mix
  promises to send a wake-up call to your taste buds when you serve it
  with a salad or red beans and rice.
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  1/8 t onion powder may be substituted for onion paste.
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycle.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Almond Poppy Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    1/2 c  Water
      2 c  White bread flour
      1 tb Dry milk
    1/2 ts Salt
      1 tb Butter
    1/4 c  Lemon yogurt
  1 1/2 tb Honey
    1/4 c  Almonds, sliced & toasted
      2 ts Lemon peel, dried
      2 tb Poppy seeds
      1 ts Lemon extract
      1 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This soft yellow bread is reminiscent of your favorite poppy seed
  muffin, but versatile enough to take you from breakfast to dessert.
  Start the day enjoying it with a touch of sweet butter on a
  freshly-toasted slice. Savor with tea in the afternoon.  After
  dinner, celebrate this winning dessert bread by topping with slices
  of cheesy lemon spread. Mmmm!
  
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  Toast almonds lightly in a shallow pan.  STIRRING FREQUENTLY, bake at
  350 degrees for 5 minutes or until golden brown.
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycle.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Garlic Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    3/4 c  Water
      2 c  + 1T White bread flour
      1 tb Sugar
    1/2 ts Salt
    1/2 tb Parmesan, fresh/grated
    1/2 ts Sweet basil
    1/2 ts Garlic powder
    1/2 ts Garlic paste
    3/4 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
  1 1/2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  The aroma of this bread is "to die for" - and it butters up to make
  the easiest garlic toast around!
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  Grate your own fresh parmesan cheese.  Pre-ground cheeses often have
  salt in them.
  
  1/4 t finely-chopped or pressed garlic may be substituted for paste.
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycles.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

      Title: Garlic Bread (Machine) - Large Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
      1 c  + 2T Water
      3 c  + 2T White bread flour
  1 1/2 tb Sugar
    3/4 ts Salt
    3/4 tb Butter
      3 tb Parmesan, fresh/grated
    3/4 ts Sweet basil
    3/4 ts Garlic powder
    3/4 ts Garlic paste
      1 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  The aroma of this bread is "to die for" - and it butters up to make
  the easiest garlic toast around!
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  Grate your own fresh parmesan cheese.  Pre-ground cheeses often have
  salt in them.
  
  1/2 t finely-chopped or pressed garlic may be substituted for paste.
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycles.

MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Saffron Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    3/4 c  Water
      2 c  White bread flour
      1 ts Sugar
      1 ts Salt
      1    Egg, beaten
  1 1/2 tb Olive oil
    1/4 ts Saffron, ground
           - or -
    1/8 ts Saffron threads
      1 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  Saffron is the world's most expensive spice - 225,000 crocus stigmas
  are needed to make a single pound!  The texture and flavor of this
  light and fluffy loaf will convince you it's worth it.  This is bread
  for a special occasion - or bread that will make any occasion
  special. The distinctive old world flavor works majic with seafood
  and hearty soups like lentil or sausage.
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  If using saffron threads, grind to a coarse powder-like consistency
  using a mortar and pestle.  The fresh powder will be more potent than
  the pre-ground so you'll need less.
  
  Once opened, the intensity of a vial of saffron will diminish.
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycle.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Maraschino Pecan Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    3/4 c  Water
      2 c  White bread flour
      1 tb Dry milk
      1 tb + 1t Sugar
    3/4 ts Salt
      2 ts Butter
  2 1/2 tb Raisins
  2 1/2 tb Sunflower seeds
  2 1/2 tb Pecans, chopped
           Pinch ground cinnamon
           Pinch ground ginger
  1 1/2 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  You can dress this bread up or down, and you'll love it either way.
  Combine green and red maraschino cherries for a festive holiday
  bread, or substitute your favorite dried fruits for a sweet morning
  meal with a light crunch.  The pecans offer a perfect counterpart to
  the fruit.
  
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  Drain cherries well on paper towel; add cherries whole for appearance.
  
  Add the fruit & nuts at the beep, on the fruit & nut cycle or at the
  end of the first knead.
  
  You can replace half the cherries with chopped dried appricots, pears,
  dates or apples.
  
  Use regular, rapid or delayed time bake cycle.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

      Title: Maraschino Pecan Bread (Machine) - Large Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
  1 1/8 c  Water
      3 c  White bread flour
  1 1/2 tb Dry milk
      2 tb Sugar
  1 1/4 ts Salt
      1 tb Butter
    1/4 c  Raisins
    1/4 c  Maraschino cherries
    1/4 c  Sunflower seeds
    1/4 c  Pecans, chopped
    1/8 ts Ground cinnamon
    1/8 ts Ground ginger
      2 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      3 ts Yeast, active dried
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  You can dress this bread up or down, and you'll love it either way.
  Combine green and red maraschino cherries for a festive holiday
  bread, or substitute your favorite dried fruits for a sweet morning
  meal with a light crunch.  The pecans offer a perfect counterpart to
  the fruit.
  
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------

  Add the fruit & nuts at the beep, on the fruit & nut cycle or at the
  end of the first knead.
  
  You can replace half the cherries with chopped dried appricots, pears,
  dates or apples.
  
  Use regular, rapid or delayed time bake cycle.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Easy French Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    3/4 c  + 1T water
      2 c  White bread flour
      1 tb Sugar
      1 ts Salt
      1 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
  1 1/2 ts Yeast, active dried
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  [This is Cheshire Cat's "staple" bread - there's always fresh french
  bread around, or in the works!]  This Easy French is exactly that -
  easy. And from its light, chew interior to its crusty crust, it
  tastes great.
  
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  To develop the crisp crust that French bread is famous for, turn the
  machine off and reset it after the first knead cycle is completed.
  This gives the bead extra kneadint time and results in a crisp crust.
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycles
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Easy French Bread (Machine) - Large Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
  1 1/2 c  Water
  3 1/4 c  White bread flour
  1 1/2 tb Sugar
  1 1/2 ts Salt
      2 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      3 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  [This is Cheshire Cat's "staple" bread - there's always fresh french
  bread around, or in the works!]  This Easy French is exactly that -
  easy. And from its light, chew interior to its crusty crust, it
  tastes great.
  
                                 Success Hints
                                 -------------
  
  To develop the crisp crust that French bread is famous for, turn the
  machine off and reset it after the first knead cycle is completed.
  This gives the bead extra kneadint time and results in a crisp crust.
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycles
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

      Title: Sweet Coconut Curry Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    3/4 c  Water
      2 c  White bread flour
      1 tb Dry milk
      1 tb Brown sugar
      1 ts Salt
      1 tb Butter
    1/3 c  Raisins
    1/3 c  Coconut flakes
      2 ts Curry powder
  1 1/2 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  Colorful and unexpected, this bread is as distinctive as the country
  inspired it.  The raisins and coconut lend a slight sweetness, but the
  flavor and aroma are distinctly curry.  Serve it with your favoritet
  rice and meat dish.
  
                             Success Hints
                             -------------
  
  If you like more kick in your curry, use hot curry.
  
  Use regular, rapid or delayed time bake cycle.

      Title: Carrot Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    1/2 c  Water
  1 1/3 c  White bread flour
    2/3 c  Wheat bread flour
      2 ts Dry milk
      1 ts Salt
    2/3 c  Carrots, grated
      1 tb Honey
      2 tb Yogurt, plain
      1 tb Molasses
      2 tb Walnuts, chopped
      1 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  [A new favorite of Cheshire Cat!]  The wheat flour gives this bread
  body, the nuts and carrots give it texture, and the yogurt keeps it
  moist. Serve this bread with steaming bowls of vegatable soup for a
  nutritious hearty lunch.
                             Success Hints
                             -------------
  
  Use freshly grated carots
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycle

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Italian Wheat Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    1/2 c  + 2T Water
  1 1/2 c  White bread flour
    1/2 c  Wheat bread flour
      1 tb Sugar
    1/2 ts Salt
    1/4 c  Pesto sauce
      1 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
  1 1/2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This is a light wheat bread with a succulent pesto flavor.  Serve it
  plain or use it for garlic bread with spaghetti or lasagna.
  
                             Success Hints
                             -------------
  
  Use freshly prepared pesto sauce or make your own.  Stir the sauce
  well before measuring to blend oil.
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycle

MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Bits 'o Bacon Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    2/3 c  Water
  1 2/3 c  White bread flour
    1/3 c  Wheat bread flour
      4 ts Sugar
      1 ts Salt
      4 ts Butter
    1/2 ts Green pepper corns *
    1/2 ts Sweet basil, dried
           Pinch Garlic powder
    1/4 c  Bacon, with fat
      1 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This is one of those loaves the whole family eats up, right from the
  oven. If it lasts long enough, this tasty loaf enlivens any soup or
  salad.
  
                             Success Hints
                             -------------
  
  * Green pepper corns should be dried & crushed
  
  Cook bacon till almost crisp.  Set bacon fat aside while you crumble
  cooked bacon, then remix bacon & fat before measuring.
  
  After loaf is partially cooled, brush with butter and sprinkle a
  little coarsly-ground salt on top.
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycle.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

  little coarsly-ground salt on top.

MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Saucy Apple Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    1/2 c  Apple cider
  1 1/3 c  White bread
    3/4 c  + 1T Wheat bread flour
      1 ts Salt
  2 1/2 tb Yogurt, plain
  2 1/2 tb Honey
    1/3 ts Vanilla
  2 1/2 tb Walnuts, unchopped
  2 1/2 tb Egg, beaten
    1/3 c  Applesauce, unsweetened
    1/3 c  Granny smith apple, unpeeled
    3/4 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
  1 1/4 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  Did you ever hear the cooking tip about putting a slice of fresh
  apple in your cake saver to keep your cake moist?  Well, the fresh
  Granny Smith apple in this recipe works the same way in this tangy,
  long-lasting bread. Even days later it retains a nice moistness that
  makes it a favorite for those times when you need to bake ahead.
  
                             Success Hints
                             -------------
  
  Core & dice unpeeled apple.
  
  The Granny Smith apple adds a tartness to the bread.  For a sweeter
  bread, try using a Rome or a McIntosh.
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycle.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

      Title: Saucy Apple Bread (Machine) - Large Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    3/4 c  Apple cider
      2 c  White bread flour
  1 1/4 c  Wheat bread flour
  1 1/2 ts Salt
    1/4 c  Yogurt, plain
    1/4 c  Honey
    1/2 ts Vanilla
    1/4 c  Walnuts, unchopped
      1    Egg, beaten
    1/2 c  Applesauce, unsweetened
    1/2 c  Granny smith apple, unpeeled
  1 1/4 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread

  bread, try using a Rome or a McIntosh.

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Baked Potato Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    1/2 c  Water
      2 c  White bread flour
      1 tb Dry milk
      1 tb Sugar
      1 ts Salt
    1/4 c  Sour cream
  1 1/2 tb Potato flakes, instant
  1 1/2 tb Bacon bits
  1 1/2 tb Chives
      1 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  If you are a meat-and-potatoes kind of person, this is the bread for
  you. Just add butter and you have a potato loaf with all the
  trimmings! The velvety texture and rich flavor make this bread a
  wonderful companion to roasts, and a natural for meatloaf sandwiches.
  Served warm, it turns a bowl of vegetable beef soup into a memorable
  meal.
  
                             Success Hints
                             -------------
  
  The dough will be very dry; resist the urge to add water.
  
  For best flavor, use real bacon bits.
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycle.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: 100% Crunch Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    3/4 c  + 1T Water
      2 c  White bread flour
      1 ts Salt
      4 ts Honey
      4 ts Molasses
      2 ts Gluten
      4 ts Olive oil
    1/2 c  Seeds *
      1 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  The seeds inject a crunchy, chewy texture so stisfying, you won't
  even need a toaster for crispness.  High in fiter and high in taste,
  this bread brings a new dimension to an avocado and sprout sandwich.
  
                             Success Hints
                             -------------
  
  * Experiment with unsalted seeds for different taste and texture; try
  equal amounts of pumpkin seeds, flax seeds and sunflower seeds.
  
  For best results, use the "extra knead" process and add seeds near
  the end of the first knead.
  
  Gluten is available in health food stores & nutritional departments.
  
  Use regular, rapid bake or timed bake cycle.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Garden Herb Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    3/4 c  Water
      2 c  White bread flour
      1 tb Dry milk
      1 tb Sugar
      1 ts Salt
      1 tb Butter
      1 ts Chives
      1 ts Marjoram
      1 ts Thyme
    1/2 ts Basil
      1 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  [This bread deserves some SERIOUS raves  Electric Bread's description
  says most of it, but I like it so much I've used the bread for turkey
  stuffing - absolutely outstanding!]
  
  The fragrance of turkey stuffing will fill your home while this
  flavorful bread is baking, thanks to all those aromatic dried herbs.
  This loaf is excellent for any cold meat sandwich you can drem up -
  including turkey and cranberry - and it makes downright tasty
  croutons.
  
                             Success Hints
                             -------------
  
  Use dried herbs that are flaked and not ground.  If using ground,
  reduce the amount by half.  If using fresh herbs, double the amount.
  
  Any combination of spices may be substituted according to your tastes.
  
  Use regular, rapid bake or timed bake cycle.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

      2 g  Sugar

           - or -

  This loaf is excellent for any cold meat sandwich you can drem up -
  including turkey and cranberry - and it makes downright tasty

MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Challah Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    1/2 c  Water
      2 c  White bread flour
      1 tb Sugar
      1 ts Salt
  2 1/2 tb Butter
      1    Egg
      1    Egg yolk
    1/2 ts Poppy seeds
    3/4 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
  1 1/2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This light egg bread represents the manna of the desert in Jewish
  tradition.  For special holidays, the dough can be styled into a
  variety of shapes.
                             Success Hints
                             -------------
  
  For traditional braided Challah, mix ingredients (without poppy
  seeds) in the dough cycle.  Turn dough out onto a floured surface,
  punch down, divide into ropes and braid, pinching dough together at
  ends. Top with poppy seeds.  Lift onto greased baking sheet and allow
  to double, about one hour. Bake at 375 degrees for 20-25 minutes.
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycle.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95
 
MMMMM
 
MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Challah Bread (Machine) - Large Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    3/4 c  Water
      3 c  White bread flour
      2 tb Sugar
  1 1/2 ts Salt
    1/4 c  Butter
      2    Eggs
      1    Egg yolk
    3/4 ts Poppy seeds
  1 1/4 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
  2 1/4 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This light egg bread represents the manna of the desert in Jewish
  tradition.  For special holidays, the dough can be styled into a
  variety of shapes.
                             Success Hints
                             -------------
  
  For traditional braided Challah, mix ingredients (without poppy
  seeds) in the dough cycle.  Turn dough out onto a floured surface,
  punch down, divide into ropes and braid, pinching dough together at
  ends. Top with poppy seeds.  Lift onto greased baking sheet and allow
  to double, about one hour. Bake at 375 degrees for 20-25 minutes.
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycle.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Mocha Java Bread (Machine) - Regular Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
    3/4 c  Water
  1 3/4 c  White bread flour
      1 tb Dry milk
      1 ts Salt
  1 1/2 tb Butter
    1/4 c  Rye flour
  1 1/2 tb Brown sugar
      1    Egg
      1 tb Instant mocha *
    1/4 c  Pecans, chopped
      1 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      2 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This is a coffee-lover's bread.  It goes great with a cup of rich
  French Roast any time of day, making any coffee break feel like a
  brunch. Serve it with a light spread of cream cheese for an even
  richer flavor.
  
                             Success Hints
                             -------------
  
  * Sugar-free coffee mix.  Try your favorite instant coffee mixes,
  such as Cappuccino or Vienna.
  
  For an alternative, use sugar-free cocoa mix instead of the coffee
  mix.
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycle.
  
     ƒƒƒƒ Cheshire Cat BBS - over 23,000 recipes online!  916-587-6947
  ƒƒƒƒ Submitted By DAN KLEPACH   On   08-15-95

MMMMM----- Recipe via Meal-Master (tm) v8.02
 
      Title: Mocha Java Bread (Machine) - Large Loaf
 Categories: Breads, Breadmaker
      Yield: 1 loaf
 
      1 c  + 2T Water
  2 1/3 c  White bread flour
      2 tb Dry milk
  1 1/2 ts Salt
      2 tb Butter
    1/2 c  Rye flour
      2 tb Brown sugar
      1    Egg
      2 tb Instant Mocha *
    1/2 c  Pecans, chopped
      2 ts Yeast, fast rise or machine
           - or -
      3 ts Yeast, active dry
 
  Source:  Electric Bread
  
  This is a coffee-lover's bread.  It goes great with a cup of rich
  French Roast any time of day, making any coffee break feel like a
  brunch. Serve it with a light spread of cream cheese for an even
  richer flavor.
  
                             Success Hints
                             -------------
  
  * Sugar-free coffee mix.  Try your favorite instant coffee mixes,
  such as Cappuccino or Vienna.
  
  For an alternative, use sugar-free cocoa mix instead of the coffee
  mix.
  
  Use regular or rapid bake cycle.
